description:
We have eaten at this beautiful restaurant  for breakfast and brunch many times.  
When we heard that they opened for dinner  we decided to give it a try. We were not disappointed. 
The mussels were fresh and the broth was flavorful. We drank all the broth. 
Lamb chops and surf and turf came next. Nice to see a chimichuri sauce for the steak. Most restaurants don't have this. 
Portions were good and pricing was very reasonable. Will definitely be back.
author: Sabrina M.

description:
Everything was mostly fine but, other than a very tasty BourbonSour & lovely atmosphere (we liked the chairs and decor), nothing else was exceptional. $15 average breakfast, reasonable enough service (somewhat difficult to communicate w the waitress). They bring complimentary scones with jam.  Nice touch but, they are not great texture and therefore not very tempting. 

If the management t is reading and looking for ways to improve:  a better quality English Muffin for the Benedicts would make it better than average.  This muffin was strange. 

The Hollandaise sauce was good (and no one got sick) and the broccoli I and spinach on the Florentine Benedict were very fresh.
author: Erika M.

description:
I came for Sunday brunch with two other friends. We checked in with yelp which worked out perfectly because the wait was long once we arrived. Walking in, I looove the interior. It is very homey, apparently what my friends expected by the name (I was thinking sports bar). 

Upon sitting we were greeted immediately and decided to go with the unlimited mimosas which are $18 with entree purchase or $8/mimosa. I'm unsure if the unlimited version is weaker but had I paid the $8 and received the same mix, I would have been disappointed. They were very orange juice heavy. 

For an appetizer, we split the crab puffs. Great price and super delicious! The crab tasted fresh, better than I would have expected. Would def order those again. A complimentary scone comes out per person with 2 jams and butter. So good. For the meal I went with the angry Benedict with shrimp, spinach, and Cajun hollandaise. My English muffin was a little soggy with the spinach over it in a different way than w hollandaise, and it was also super light on the hollandaise but a great flavor overall. I wasn't crazy about the potato pancake. It was super crispy and hard... maybe just not what I expected. My friends ordered the salmon/cream cheese scramble and the huevos rancheros and both said they were really good! I would definitely have brunch here again :)
author: Brittany N.

description:
I'm amazed how busy yet efficient and friendly this excellent brunch spot is. I love that they use yelp waiting lists effectively as well.

Enjoy your food in a glam-farm house environment complete with instagramable picture wall. Everything you order here is fresh and delicious. Not too greasy like some brunch places. 

Whether you want a lunch salad/burger or eggs served in every conceivable fashion, this is the spot for you. $18 gets you a bottomless mimosa for 1.5 hours too. 

I've had the Breakfast Board and the Steak Noodle Salad. Hubby Bear has had the Steak and Eggs and Chicken Omelette. All meals were great quality and portion for the price. 

Stop by Home Plate for all your Marina bunch needs!
author: Susan C.

description:
New favorite brunch spot!!

What I tried:
*Corned beef Benedict - large chunks of beef yum
*Crab melt sandwich - delicious real crab meat

Overall thoughts:
*I was really impressed with this gem

*The wait was pretty short since we joined the wait list on the way driving there

*Decor and chairs inside are so nice and make the place look more upscale. However the prices are equivalent of an average brunch spot in Sf.

*Food was so good. Great portions and great prices. There was a little wait for the food but they offered us a variety of fresh fruits on the house to apologize. Every customer also gets a fresh scone on the house (Also was delicious). Regardless, quality food takes time and it was worth the wait.

*Bottomless mimosas are $18. There's employees walking around with pitchers waiting to refill your glass. Very interesting since typically I read about how restaurants tend to take their time in refilling your drink.

*Service was great and there are so many appealing dishes on the menu. Really can't wait to come back and try more!
author: Sarah W.

description:
Stopped here after running Bridge to Bridge Sunday.  I joined wait list via Yelp which was great because we didn't wait long.  The hostess wasn't the friendliest, but things got better. We got bottomless mimosa's and they actually use fresh orange juice (I'm pretty sure) which is great.  The mimosas were yummy and they were on top of the refills.  After an hour and a half the bottomless mimosas stop though.  

Loved the free scones I could have had more.  I ordered the veggie frittata with potato pancakes.  It came with side salad which I appreciate but it didn't have any dressing on it.  We also shared the Dulce De Leche pancakes.  Everything was really yummy!  I practically had to roll out of there.  I would definitely go back.
author: Megan M.

description:
Highly recommend this place. The service was amazing. The setting was so beautiful. I love how there was actual real plants on the wall. The food was BOMB dot com. The presentation of the food was incredible. It was my first time having egg Benedict. There a long wait if you go after 9 AM so plan ahead. It is a small place so it can get a bit crowded. There two bathroom. We got the table near the window which was perfect because we were able to look outside. We were visiting SF bc of Gen Beauty and we didn't know where else to go but I am so happy my fiancé chose this place. It is very cute ! 

Thank you for the amazing service ! Can't wait to visit here again.
author: Christina E.

description:
Home Plate has a diner-esque menu but super cute décor. They have the usual omelets, frittatas, benedicts, pancakes, waffles etc- nothing particularly fancy. Love the open space and the cozy chairs. 
I had their mimosa which was made from fresh-squeezed OJ- bottomless for $18!. They started us off with complimentary scones and homemade jams which was awesome. I thought my crab benedict was awesome- the crab benedict was juicy and perfectly crispy. Dishes come with either potatoes or a potato latke. The Latke was interesting- very thin like a wheat thin, had a good flavor but wasn't as crispy as it looked. Their waffle was 'da bomb. 
There was a wait on the weekend, but with the option to check into the waitlist on Yelp, we barely had to wait- woohoo!
author: Sharon H.

description:
Home Plate is one of my favorite brunch spots in the Marina. Used to be very hole in the wall, but they just moved to a new location which is very trendy and a lot nicer. All of our past experiences have been great, but our most recent visit was subpar. Hoping that this is just a result of some growing pains at the new location. 

My favorite drink here is their pink mimosa which has grapefruit juice instead of orange. You can get bottomless for $18 pp or opt for a carafe for $27. Their iced coffee is also great and comes with free refills. 

As for food, their Benedict's are good. I've had the smoked salmon in the past and loved it. This time I tried the crab cake Benedict and wasn't a huge fan. The crab cakes were pretty dry and didn't have a ton of flavor. 

My boyfriend always gets the home run special with the waffle and bacon. The waffle is always delicious but during our most recent visit it came out cold, even though his plate came out several minutes after my Benedict. 

We always get a side of the potato pancakes which never disappoint. This time we also started with truffle fries which were perfectly cooked. 

My favorite part of the brunch was that they brought out little scones with jam that were warm and yummy. 

Even though our most recent visit wasn't great, we will definitely be back to give Home Plate another chance as we've always enjoyed it in the past
author: Jessie K.

description:
Had breakfast here yesterday. Menu options are good. Service was great. Metered parking outside. 

Atmosphere is very posh/a hint of farmhouse style. 
Free biscuits- tasted delicious with what seems to be homemade jam. They're small biscuits. 

The crab cake Benedict was somewhat not as flavorful as I had wanted but nevertheless tasted great. The medley home fries were awesome!

The potatoes pancakes were great too!!
author: Oanh P.

description:
If you want a great place to make your favorite breakfast place this is it. The restaurant is warm and inviting. Nice lighting, fireplace, living wall enhance the dining experience 

Yes there are breakfast places you may want to go for big special occasions and go all out, but the price and selection here is awesome. Little scones come out to the table to start your breakfast. Portions are generous. 

I took a star off because the service is a bit cold. The gentleman is the best of the servers. It seems English is not their first language and maybe it's for that reason the service does not feel spot on  

I have visited 3x. I have enjoyed all the food selection. They open at 7 and that is a plus as well. Seems most places open at 8.
author: Tony C.

description:
+1 star for having the Waitlist feature on the Yelp app because no one wants to be standing around hangry for brunch, especially on Lombard.

We were frequenters of the OG Home Plate - so much so that even after being out of the neighborhood for a couple years, we were recognized by staff. Man, is this new location a 180 into bougie brunch! The old spot had that greasy spoon vibe, was so small that even when empty felt crowded, and could use some updates (the espresso machine was so commonly broken that it became a running joke).

So I was super happy that the Home Plate team moved into a huge spot that can attract the Marina crowd who brunch like it's their job (yes, they have bottomless mimosas). The interior feels warm and inviting like a  modern Southern home: decor includes a plant wall, comfy stuffed chairs, fancy overhead lighting, and even upgraded dinner wear. The only detractor from the ambience was the prominent TV with Fox News - even if this wasn't SF, the 24 hour news cycle isn't really the brunch vibe I think they're going for.

The menu has been slimmed down with some carryovers and a few new additions (cotton candy on waffles, what??). The best part is always the complimentary scones and jam, which we eagerly awaited along with our lattes (sadly, no fat free milk just almond milk, but overall it was a decent cup). It took awhile for those to come out, but entrees were hot on their heels. Recalling that the waffles at the original spot went a little downhill, we opted for pancakes, which I had a bite of but weren't crave-worthy, and instead stuck to my granola and yogurt. The yogurt was a good dish despite the lopsided ratio of the two ingredients - I didn't need to finish all that granola, which was quite reminiscent of broken up Nature Valley bars. They accommodated my aversion to bananas and the fruit was perfect - definitely much fresher than at the old spot. I'm happy to report that another dish from our party, the crab omelette, is still generously packed with avocado.

The new Home Plate is the kind of place where you can take your parents (who have zero understanding of why you'd wait for any restaurant), and when your mom walks in she says "ooh, this is nice honey." They're not the most adventurous eaters but love their classic go-tos and Home Plate has plenty of options to make sure everyone is well fed.
author: Cristina S.

description:
Terrible.  My Benedict Blackstone arrived with perfect eggs on top of room-temperature bacon, refrigerator-cold tomato slices and refrigerator-cold and untoasted English muffin halves, all of which resulted in a soggy cold mess.

I sent it back and asked for at least a warm toasted muffin but got it back three minutes later with the food moved around on the plate but all else the same.

I then paid the bill with no tip and walked out and would never go back because the cooks don't know what they're doing - or don't care.  It was a total waste of $19.
author: Bob C.

description:
The food is great and fairly reasonably priced for the portions. If we weren't in a rush, I would have taken part in the $18 bottomless mimosas. Will do next time. 

It can be a bit of a wait sometimes so be sure to use the Yelp check in when you're on your way. We did and were taken straight to a table. There were about 10-15 folks waiting outside for a table. 

The ambience inside is very trendy and bright. I was a fan. Very clean. 

My only knock is that the service was slow. I don't blame our waiter as it seems he was just stretched between too many tables. I would just say the restaurant needs to hire more wait staff as it seems like a lot of folks were waiting for refills or their bills to be paid. 

Other than that, it was a great experience.
author: Matt M.

description: Good taste and service, we enjoyed having breakfast and dinner there. Photos of food show that how wonderful the food is. You should have a try and I believe you will go there again.
author: Jet L.

description:
Excellent service! We were able to save a spot in line via yelp. As soon as we entered we were greeted and seated promptly. The chairs and atmosphere are comfortable and welcoming. 
The food was great and our server was wonderful. Our food came out quickly and was very tasty. 
A great breakfast stop while in San Francisco!
author: Jane C.

description:
I was visiting SF and was looking for a Brunch spot Sunday for 1. I was sat fairly quickly, however no one was there to greet you at the door which is kind of gives the beautiful interior and decorated restaurant a cold feeling. 
The server came over fast, I just asked for water and another minute to look over the menu. I shouldn't have. It was another 10 min and I had to stop another server to take my order because I wasn't sure where mine was. I ordered the Home Run. Generic breakfast dish. It was pancakes( average ) eggs (very fluffy and delicious) and the chicken sausage which was amazing! 

The upsetting part was there was a table that walked in so much later than me, that clearly knew the staff or owners because they we're served so quickly and were checked up on 4 times before I was talked to once. Tha was upsetting. Plus they received 5 complimentary scones for 2 ppl and I was given 1 for 1 person. Not that I care. Just left a bad taste in my mouth. 
Food very good.
Little pricey but your in SF 
Service is kind of poor. And non existent
author: Ryan R.

description: Great environment, and the wait staff was accommodating! My only issue was with the hostess who was a bit rude before seating us and made us wait an extra 10 minutes after she told us our table was ready. Still happy I came as the food was delicious
author: Courtney L.

description:
Not a huge fan of 5 star reviews but not sure what they could do better. We found this place on day two of our stay an stopped her for breakfast daily. Highly recommended.

Service - Great service. They work well as a team and are always topping off coffee or water yet are unobtrusive. Very speedy at getting the bill when done and getting checked out.

Food - great food and that is what it is all about. Reasonably priced for San Francisco and huge plates.

Crab Omelet - Full of crab and a huge portion. Breakfast Board - Smoked salmon with eggs, avocado, toast, fruit and a salad. Everything was fresh. The fruit has very little melon in it but lots of strawberry, kiwi, blueberry, raspberry, blackberry and oranges.

Try it - you won't be disappointed.
author: Mike P.

description: if ever you're in need for good brunch or a great breakfast is a good place to come in their passion drink is wonderful!! It was just a random thought of me being hungry but I left there full and pleased with the home run meal. The waffle was buttery and my easy over eggs with apple sausage was a great mouth feel to the creamy yolk with the hot fresh coffee it's nice to seat back a relaxe like ur in someone's home!!
author: Keywanda F.

description:
This place is really good; I especially love the option of putting your name down through the yelp app. My husband and I did this when we left our house and by the time we walked there, our table was ready which I LOVED!!! 

The food was great; I got a scramble with potatoes and it was very good. I liked how they have the option of chicken sausage instead of pork sausage and egg whites instead of just eggs. They bring you scones and homemade jelly to your table while you wait for your food so that's always a nice little touch as well. 

The coffee & drinks seem reasonable. We stuck with water because we didn't have time to enjoy the bottomless mimosas but they do have those for $18 which is a great deal in my opinion. 

The only knock on this place is the service. They were sooooo slow. We waited at our table for a good 10 mins before anyone even talked to us or brought us water. And when he finally came up, there was no greeting or anything, he just poured our water and said "what do you want to eat?" Very unfriendly and unhelpful completely. 

I'd say I'd be back because I did enjoy the food and ambiance but it's not good enough to trump how we were treated so heads up, go on a day they aren't busy and maybe you'll get better service.
author: Bethany M.

description:
We made it to our destination San Francisco!!
We went to home plate for breakfast and we weren't disappointed. The service was great the place look super clean. The food was so good!! 
At the beginning of your meal they give you scones with mango and strawberry sauce! Wow those scones were super super goody. My husband order corn beef hash Benedict's. His eggs were cook to perfection.
author: Belgica V.

description:
Fun brunch location that I found on yelp. When I saw the name and the outside of the restaurant, I thought it'd be more diner-y but was surprised when we entered that it was so cute. We ordered a liter of pink mimosa (pink grapefruit) to share and I had the California scramble (crab, avocado, cilantro, tomatoes). The portions are huge and I wish I could've eaten it all. 

Would definitely recommend adding your name on the wait list (through yelp) prior to getting there. We did before walking the half mile from where we were and by the time we got there, they called us up.
author: Jenni R.

description:
Based on the long wait I was expecting to be blown away by their brunch.  Sadly the food was just ok at best... the service was also a bit inconsistent.  

I had their version of millionaires bacon, French toast with fresh fruit, and scrambled eggs with cheese. Although nothing was bad, nothing was spectacular either. 

Aside from the cool ambiance this place seems like any other brunch spot in San Fran.
author: Trey W.

description:
After an early morning shoot, my friend and I were starving so we looked on yelp for a breakfast spot and came across this place. 

Service was great in the beginning but after we placed our order, that's when it started to decline...I've worked in the restaurant biz as a server before so I always try to give staff the benefit of the doubt bc I know how it feels...but to have to ask for an update on your order not 1-2 times but 4-5? That's just ridiculous...

There seems to have been a morning rush after we placed our order but I wish they could've prioritized the orders a lot better bc there were people who got their food before us even though they got seated after us. We both ordered the homeplate special- one with pancakes and sausage, one with French toast and bacon. My friend also ordered an add on of hash browns and all star bacon. The unfortunate thing was that my friend couldn't enjoy his meal to its full potential bc he finished the special before he even got his add on orders...

My special with the French toast was alright but the bacon was way too hard that I couldn't even enjoy it. One bite into it and the piece would shatter...not good. Despite the spotty service, my friend did enjoy his food and he says their saving grace would be the all star bacon...even though it came at the end of the meal. For me, it would be their warm raisin scone with homemade jelly. 

All in all, I'm glad I got to try this place out but I'm not in a hurry to come back.
author: Coco L.

description:
First off, the remodel is great and the ambience is wonderful! 

The service is quick and expect to be seated quite fast. They also utilize the Yelp Waitlist functionality to perfection. 

Unfortunately, we received some dirty water cups that we had to return. All of the food we received was lukewarm and a bit stale. 

The biscuits were delivered to us and arrived slightly warm, but a bit chewy. The bacon was also lukewarm and was standard. 

I ordered the Home Run special with a waffle, 2 eggs over easy and bacon. The eggs were great, while the waffle was mediocre. 

We love the location and live nearby! That being said, they're known for their pancakes!!
author: John A.

description: As soon as we walked into this place, 2 people greeted us right away and found us a seat. It has great ambiance, to start the day. The only reason I don't give 5 stars is because we first got sat at a table that seemed for 4, to share with another couple. However, I asked if we could get changed and they did it right away. Be aware that there is an area like that, the tables for 2 are very close to each other. The menu is quite diverse and prices are reasonable for SF. Very good food! We ordered Breakfast for starters and Garden omelette with egg whites. Both were excellent. They come with a light salad that gives a sofisticases twist to our breakfast. I loved their bread! BONUS: They give you these tiny scones with awesome natural mango and strawberry preserve, on the House, that is awesome! Service was very fast and pleasant. I'm definitely coming back soon... maybe tomorrow.
author: Xiomara P.

description: I enjoyed my breakfast here. The place was recently remodeled I guess and was quite charming. The breakfast was much fancier than I am used to (presentation wise) and was disappointed with the breakfast potatoes but all in all was a good breakfast
author: Jim P.

description: My boyfriend and I came here from Fresno, California and let me tell you the inside was so pretty. Everything the interior was clean, the bathroom had great quotes on the wall, and on a addiction the waiter had served us complimentary scones they were delicious. Wish they weren't so small I would love to get more.:) I did not order a meal I just ordered French toast which I wish I had tried the potatoes and the omelet. My boyfriend had ordered pancakes that surprisingly it filled him up. The necessities was cute where they put the jam,hot sauce, salt and pepper etc~~
author: Jennifer Y.

description: Extremely underrated place. We got the Crab Cake Benedict with Cajun Sauce, Spanish Scrambler and a soda for only $30. Food was amazing. They have a new big location with white ship lap on the walls and nice decorations. Upscale look for low priced plates. We have been going to home plate since 2009 when they were at the tiny location. They never disappoint. You must eat here. Oh and they give you two amazing tasting soft scones with their homemade jam.
author: Jay R.

description:
This is bittersweet if you've ever gone to the old Home Plate. I've been going since the restaurant was actually baseball themed and a hole in the wall. Now it resembles a country club, and plays thumping club music in the afternoon. While I'm happy they seem to be doing well enough to expand, it's just not the same restaurant.

Sadly, the restaurant has lost the charm it once had. The scones are still there - but they are half the size. The potato latkes have shrunken to tiny squares, and only four items transitioned over from the old menu. Service is very slow - we waited for 20 minutes after ordering to receive our food. Latkes aside, the other sides include salad with just olive oil, or 'potato medley' which are just fried, unseasoned, purple and white potatoes. 

Getting the check also took an additional 10 minutes. So overall, this seems to be a complete overhaul - cosmetically and food-wise - of what was once my favorite place in San Francisco. Time to retire Home Plate and find somewhere new.
author: Elizabeth S.

description: Their pancakes are my new favorite. They were amazing ! I love that you can put your name on the waitlist before arriving so that's a time saver. Would definitely go again. Highly recommend !
author: Janet J.

description:
Came in for a late brunch and joined yelp waitlist which made the wait next to nothing. Parking is difficult to find so we spent most of our time looking for nearby parking. We originally came as a 2 party and then had friends join us of party of additional 8. They were very accommodating in setting us up at the last minute with a big group. 

The breakfast itself was large portion for the price especially in SF. We got the Homeplate frittatas Roasted Chicken omelette which were all delicious. It came with potatoes medley, a salad and toast as well. I definitely was completely full and still had lots leftover. 

The decor was very cute and it felt high end brunch without the high end price.
author: Diana N.

description: V good brunch. Marina is v nice too. Super nice inside too, and the breakfast is the best part. Really welcoming and cape cod meets SF interior. V good pancakes too. V
author: Phil D.

description: Excellent food service and ambience. Crispy french toast were amazing will definitely recommend if you in a mood for some sweet.
author: Swati T.

description:
Decor at the new place is very strange. I can't get it out of my head. Everything is new and the intent was to be..fancy but comfortable, I think...but the chairs and tables are Western, the fireplace and walls are chandeliers are like a nightclub, and then there's a kitchen themed area with flour jars, and out front there is a wall of plants and a fish bowl and a model ship and a suburban mailbox. It's like they looked at a bunch of magazines and picked a bunch of trends and mashed them all together. So obv I miss the old place even though we were choking on smoke. 

BUT THE FOOD IS STILL BOMB! AND I WILL ALWAYS GO THERE, even though I feel like I'm in someone's weird living room. NOM NOM NOM for the win!!!
author: Shiva E.

description:
This place truly gives you the vibes of a nice breakfast! 
The atmosphere is great and even the regular coffee is good, I am even thinking about bringing my mom here. 
Not 5 stars because they took too long to bring salsa and my eggs got cold.
Tip: It seems to be a really busy place, so make a reservation!
author: Gloria A.

description:
Came here for brunch on a Saturday morning at 10am. Don't be fooled by yelp's online waitlist system, you'll still wait 20 minutes. 
We placed our order right when we sat down and asked for our hash browns and home fries/well done. We proceeded to wait 30 minutes for our food and watched people who sat after us order, finish their food and leave before our food even arrived. I thought that since we asked for our potatoes well done that was why it was taking so long, but they didn't even fulfill that request.

TLDR; subpar food took way too long paired with poor service. Not coming back.
author: Carla E.

description: No question, this place is one of the most elegant neighborhood breakfast spots.  Their plush high back chairs, spacious table placement, and polished decor certainly veer well-away from the sports-bar breakfast I feared when I saw their name.  The food and service was spot on.  Even if I could have had a tad more lemon in my hollandaise, the food arrived more like an expensive artsy dinner entree and the flavors were clean and lovely.
author: Patrick B.

description:
Embarrassed to say we've been here 2 weekends in a row. Love the bright decor and the cute almost nautical feel of the restaurant. Very much a Hamptons vibe! The homemade scones are incredible and a great start to the meal. Our recent favorite also comes from the crab puffs, great bite before the meal. 

However my favorite menu item is the Angry Benedict. The Cajun style hollandaise is so different from any other brunch I've had. It truly takes a traditional Benedict and gives it a great savory and spicy spin. If you like sweet breakfast definitely try the crunchy French toast- great portions and attentive service here. Only wish my iced coffee was refilled! 

You should definitely try this place for a date or a family meal. Super accessible and easy for any group of people and they do bottomless mimosas!
author: Tamara M.

description: We found this restaurant via Yelp. It's located fairly close to the Golden Gate bridge. The decor is so charming. Customer service was flawless and the food was wonderful. I ordered an omelet with veggies, ham and cheese. My girlfriends had a hearty veggie burger that was divine and my other girlfriend had pancakes that tasted like the ones my Mom made on a cold day off from school :) Slamming hot cakes! Yummy!! Thanks for the wonderful service.
author: Stacey M.

description:
Long wait for our order to be taken. Oj fresh squeezed.  Great.  Scones delish.  I hear the food is to die for so I wait with bated breath.
And the results were amazing.  I would give them an eight out of 10 for quality food, but service needs some work, even with the very friendly staff.
author: Liz C.

description:
Good luck getting anybody's attention in there. You'd have to set yourself on fire for somebody to acknowledge you. Had a reservation and our table was ready, but we stood at the door for almost 10 minutes before someone bothered to check in on us. Trend continued after getting seated: very slow service and a forgetful waitress.

I don't usually mind poor service if the food makes up for it, but it didn't. Came here because of the many good reviews of their food, but I guess most of them are from tourists that normally go to Waffle House. Had the crab Benedict and the smoked salmon Benedict, both were meh: soft, almost soggy English muffin, and a bland soggy mess for the crab cake. Salmon was ok, and at least the eggs were on point. Extra star for the tasty complimentary scones.
Sad, I could have used another good breakfast place near home, but I won't be back.
author: Eric W.

description:
On my quest for the best breakfast I am starting when I travel, this was my stop in SF. It was a bit off the beaten path for a business traveler, not easy from union SQ. Cute place, great kind servers..
Probably he owners too. It's got charm and great feel. I got the huevos ranchero and it was the lightest one I have ever ordered, not a gut bomb but a surgical delight. High quality food for a diner feel. Look forward to more meals and one extra star in the future.
author: Brad M.

description: Came for a summer Saturday brunch and got the bottomless mimosas. If you're looking for a good time Home Plate is the place. Food was good -- got the Spanish Scramble and loved it. Salad was just OK.
author: Matt J.

description:
We stopped here one morning after using the Yelp check-in feature. If you use the app to check in, once you get there, tell them you've arrived! We walked in, checked for our name on the list, and then waited, and they gave our table away because "they didn't know we were there."  The meal made it better; the free scones with apple and strawberry jam were delicious. I ordered the Home Plate meal- everything was very good. Coffee was good as well. 
Just make sure you announce your entrance if you use the online app!
author: Ashley A.

description: Good spot to grab some food with friends on a Saturday morning! Their 18$ bottomless mimosas can really get a group going. I ordered the breakfast starter which came with bacon, a large hash brown, eggs, and a small salad. The food was prepared very quickly but was all kind of bland. If I come back I will try something different next time.
author: Andy K.

description:
Bottom line: Satisfying cafe/diner-style breakfast, if there isn't a wait

Context: Been here a number of times over the past few years as a party of two

I have tried different things on the menu, liked some things better than others. Overall generally liked things. Last time I got the Chorizo and Eggs; that dish was very tasty.

On weekend prime breakfast/brunch time, there can be a wait. I never like to wait though.
author: Elizabeth C.

description:
Very cute restaurant with good comfort, breakfast food and surprisingly reasonable prices. 

I got the banana butterscotch pancakes with almonds and it was exactly the kind of over-the-top pancake I was hoping for. The pancakes was topped with big bananas slices and almonds and had butterscotch drizzled all over. After taking my first bite, I realized that there was even butterscotch smeared in between the pancakes. It was delicious.

Service was also good! There wasn't really anything notably good or bad about it. There can be a wait to be seated, but if you come early enough it's not that bad. On a Sunday morning at 10:45, we waited for ~20-30 min. 

I would definitely come back just for the amazing pancakes
author: Danielle C.

description: For many years I went to the old Home Plate and enjoyed their large reasonably priced breakfast items...some of the original menu items are now gone like the chicken hash and the crispy hashbrowns that you could choose with a side of applesauce are now replaced with a slightly soggy side of potatoes. The shrimp in the angry Benedict are of good size. The remodel and new location are nice interior wise but I'd rather have the old style of food and service.
author: Louise K.

description:
Came here for Sunday brunch. Had the corn d beef hash and philly cheese steak - kitchen is doing excellent job and the food was really satisfying. I also appreciate an establishment that invests in the restroom design - so slick and spacious I wanted to take a nap there.
The only reason why this is not a 5 star review is the wait staff. They all seemed miserable, barely smiled, messed up our order and kept trying to push us to get drinks. When we finally decided to try the strawberry lemonade it tasted like coolaid.
author: Calanit K.

description: The food was lacking major flavor. The egg whites had absolutely no seasoning and the waffle... well I wouldn't even call it that. The service was atrocious! It took about 15 minutes for the waitress to take our order and another 15 to receive our DRINKS and another 15 or so to receive our food. The chicken sausage was under cooked, so we sent it back and when they brought it out I was shocked to see that the waitress brought out the same chicken sausage I had taken a bite of. Last time I checked that is a major health code violation. The only upside to this entire brunch fiasco was my grapefruit mimosa. I'll admit, the food did look good, but looks can be deceiving.
author: Kat G.

description:
This is an ok place to me. The ambience is super good. I was expecting the food would also be of that level but its not that great. We ordered Denver omlette and garden omlette . These were very average in taste. I was expecting a lot . Although the price is not that much but not cheap too. $13.50 for omelette which is not extraordinary and pretty basic :/ ah ah .nooo .
We also ordered pan cake , guess it was a banana walnuts pancake. It was still ok .
author: Isha K.

description: Cute place with nice staff, but hate how they crammed all the couples/parties of two along the inner wall while leaving the lovely tables on the inner patio open. Step up from our usual breakfast at Squat-n-Gobble but pricier too.  Millionaire Bacon at Blackwood is better than the spicy/sweet bacon served here.  However very nice place for families (who get the nicer tables so they aren't crammed in with others).
author: Gia B.

description: Incredible place to come to here in SF. Instantly became a favorite. Beautiful interior- wonderfully decorated. Food is both delicious and plated extremely well. Staff is super kind. Prices are way to low for such an awesome place. Overall great place for breakfast / brunch.
author: Daniil C.

description: First visit to Home Plate. Cute place. Friendly service but it took over 5 minutes for them to even come to the table and we had to ask for water a few times before we got it. Food was really good. I had to order hot tea though because the place was SO COLD! I looked around and everyone had their coats on for breakfast. I'm thinking most people don't enjoy wearing their down jackets while eating... it would have been nicer if they turned the heat on.
author: Adrianna S.

description: I went here just for blueberry pancakes, they are my absolute favorite but the pancakes that I received yesterday were just lackluster. They almost didn't take taste which was kind of disappointing. The decor and the staff were nice which is why I'm giving this place 3 stars...still on the hunt for the best blueberry pancakes in SF
author: Danielle D.

description: Quintessential Lombard St brunch place. Open and Airy feel matched with solid food to back it up. The "Angry" benedict I had was quite an interesting a traditionally mild   Favourite. The Cajun sauce and jalapeños worked with the perfectly cooked eggs. The potato pancakes added that bit of exotic. For the rest of group, the pancakes were very well received
author: Nandan N.

description: NEW ADDRESS!!! Hope they can change their address to the new one ASAP, worst case scenario you show up to the old address just walk a couple of blocks. First impression was FANCY!!! Super clean, super nice. Incredible food and easy menu to read and order. Service was extremely fast and accurate. Only thing that I did notice is that the tables are EXTREMELY close to one another, meaning you are literally sitting next to a different couple which is kinda weird if you wanna have a private conversation. Other than that, amazing place.
author: Manuel A.

description:
Love this place! Bright, lovely space with comfy upholstered chairs and friendly, welcoming staff. The all-star bacon was a hit with our meat lovers. Thick cut, glazed with syrup and chili flakes. 
Eggs Benedict, French toast and old-fashioned oatmeal--all awesome! OJ and robust coffee were fresh and delicious.
author: Lee S.

description:
First time here today and I liked that I was able to put my name down on the waiting list using the Yelp app on my phone (they have a waitlist you sign into inside - also powered by Yelp) but I saved time using my phone and I killed some time walking around the Marina district until I was notified that my table was almost ready. 

This place is beautiful. I have an eye for design and I love that you feel like you're enjoying a meal with family or friends right at your own dinner table. 

Freshly baked scones are complimentary and they're delicious too! Ordered our food and it was unfortunate that my order came out wrong. It was a long wait until my food finally came out but they were very apologetic and even came out and brought more scones while I waited. Nice! More time has passed and my server brought out a cup of mixed fruit from the chef, again apologizing for the long wait - how nice of them! I thought the food was fantastic and the potato latkes that accompanied my smoked salmon Benedict were so so good. I'm definitely going to return and bringing my family with me!
author: Julie Ann M.

description: I love this spot so much! The pancakes here are my favorite I've ever had anywhere! Staff is very nice and it's never too busy. Not to mention, it's so cute and comfortable inside! Highly recommend!
author: Baylee R.

description: Very good food and good service, but for me, a Boomer, there's a disconnect with the decor and music. The original Home Plate was more like an old greasy spoon, something you might see on Diners and Dives. I was glad to see that they've moved to a new location, but the new restaurant, while keeping a little of the old SF Baseball theme, seems to be decked out for a swanky dinner party, including the jazz or ambience style music, vs a fun casual meal. I wish they would play up the farm or industrial theme a little more as it would fit better with what I think of as comfortable and casual. But that said, maybe a lot of people have blue flame gas fireplaces and formal chandeliers in their homes? It does seem like a lot of the other reviewers like the decor - so what do I know?
author: Juna C.

description: We enjoyed the complimentary scones. This is my daughter's favorite place for eggs Benedict when we visit San Francisco . I had the Guevos rancheros, they were delicious.
author: Elena M.

description: Very small cute homey feeling. The staff is very attentive. A little overpriced for the portions but I can't blame them considering how small of a restaurant it is they can't fit a lot of customers at once. The food was great! I ordered the smoked salmon bagels and it was everything I expected in a bagel and more. Normally I'm very picky with the quality of fish but I was amazed by how good the salmon was! The pickled onions was also a great touch. My boyfriend ordered the angry Benedict and he seemed to really enjoy it.
author: Hadeel A.

description: The waitlist is a nice idea, but doesn't work. My friend and I arrived at 10am on Saturday to many, many people waiting. The hostess came out every minute or so and called out a list of names. About one in seven names were for people actually there waiting. After a 30 minute wait we were seated. Everything from that point was just ok. The requested water was never brought. My breakfast arrived five minutes before my friend's. Service was brusque. And on top of that, the food was not worth the wait, mediocre at best.
author: Johnny B.

description: Food was delicious!  Have the home fries crispy (three different types of potatoes).  Eggs were yummy good too!
author: Jennifer S.

description:
Horrrrrrrible service, and I mean BAD. Perhaps being the only decent breakfast spot in the neighborhood open before 10am the manager thinks it's ok to under staff??? Not sure. 

We sat down and wait 20 minutes - I repeat, TWENTY MINUTES before anyone came by to give us water or take our order. Absolutely ridiculous....

We've lived in the neighborhood for a decade and used to frequent the old location. We will NEVER be back here again. What a waste of our time.
author: Meredith M.

description: Ordered two different Benedict's and they definitely disappointed. The crab cakes were extremely fishy, and some shells were present as well. On the angry Benedict the eggs tasted sour and the shrimp still had some prongs. Both muffins were thrown in the toaster for maybe 10 seconds. Took almost ten minutes to get greeted once we sat down. Not a very good experience in general. Would not recommend.
author: Reece B.

description: Well designed restaurant. Good service. Very reasonable prices for upscale setting. The name sounds like plate lunch but it's high end.
author: D T.

description:
I used to love this place. I lived in the neighborhood years ago and would visit the old location every single weekend for breakfast. I finally came back yesterday to find they're at a new location with a completely new look. 

While the new location has a nice southern or country charm to their decor, it doesn't feel the same as the old mom and pop's spot that it once was. It's a lot bigger now, but it took a long time to get food and we watched two tables that sat down and ordered after us get their food before us. There were a couple issues with getting the order right for us, and others next to us had the same problem. 

Service is spotty and inconsistent. I miss the old baseball theme and homey feeling, which was also fitting of the name. The new Home Plate is definitely mirroring many of the new brunch spots in the city now. Mimosas and resort-like vibes. Ritzy. It used to be a real gem; quaint, cozy, and unpretentious. The owners haven't changed, and you can still see them working hard alongside their staff, which I admire. If only this place could've found a way to keep their old charm.
author: Stacey L.

description:
7/29/17

One more SF breakfast place crossed off the list!

Every month or so we try to run The Bridge.  Normally we park at a structure down the waterfront, and head out to do the 15ish mi round-trip run...

...but alas... we've never made it yet, ha ha.  Pretty much after getting off the bridge on the way back, and running down the side to the Golden Gate park on the bottom, always around the 9-12mi mark,  I hear something over the trance playing in my headphones..... "no, Dean... no no NO NONONONONONO............."....

Yup, that's the signal for... breakfast time!  So, we've sorta made it our mission, forced by circumstances, to find some good breakfast near-ish to the bridge, and Home Plate, you're up!

...alright... I'll just cut to the chase cause I got some stuff to do........... Home Plate is alright.  I had high hopes--there was a line outside and all that.  Had that upscaled downscaled feel SF breakfast places are so good at presenting.  Looked great.

Then we saw the menu.  Pretty boring menu.  It was hard to find anything that excited me...

1. Coffee $2.95

2. Can of Diet Coke $1.75

3. Bangkok Frittata $15.70 "shrimps, mushroom, tomato, green onion, cilantro, jalapenos, kaffir lime leaves, galangal, served with 2 potato carrot pancakes or hash browns and toast":  So, as I was saying everything looked very traditional and boring, but this stood out on their daily specials menu.  Glad I got it, cause it was certainly different, but it was truly a mess.  It's like they took a bunch of Asian flavors, mixed in some egg, and called it a day.  It's not eggs.  It's not an Asian dish.  Tasted alright--very spicy, and totally filled with seafood and bits of stuff.  Certainly wasn't cheap stuff.  But just didn't really satisfy.

Also, about those "potato carrot pancakes"... so, I've never had these before, and thus have no clue how they should taste.  Given that, take my opinion with a grain of salt, but they're basically wafers of semi-fried vegetables.  Kinda like a cheap crab cake minus the cheap crab.  Not what I was expecting at all.... 5/10

4. Crab Melt Sandwich $14.95 "crab, avocado, chives, jack cheese and house-made aioli served on grilled sourdough with salad and french fries":  When this was placed in front of my gf I was shocked at how plain it looked.  A small sandwich of toasted bread and crab salad in the middle.  REALLY plain looking.  Well, I took a bite and was like....... okay, it's actually really good.  The crab is certainly not cheapo canned lump crab.  If it's not fresh, it's certainly some of the best canned crab you can buy.  So, you get a basic as all hell sandwich, but tasting really good for what it is.  6/10

5. Smoked Salmon Bagel $13.95 "served with 2 potato latkes, cream cheese, smoked salmon, pickles onions and capers":  It's pretty much like any other smoked salmon bagel.  They certainly did not skimp on the salmon, and I can tell this is one of the higher grade smoked salmons.  Definitely better than the stuff at Costco.  But still, $14 is a bit steep.  Well, I guess $5-7 gets you half of their portion at a standard bagel shop, so, maybe it's not too outrageous... 6/10

Oh, they give you a free scone with fresh jams with the meal.  Nice touch.

Service was a bit lacking though.  They didn't refill the coffee or water unless you waive someone down.  No one came by to check on us either.

3/5

#breakfast #brunch #sanfrancisco #bridgerun
author: Dean C.

description: I'm so glad I came here for Breakfast !!! I got the salmon Benedict , both my son and wife got the Home plate.  My food was amazing , perfectly cooked and presented, soo flavorful. This place offers fresh fruit juice and scones with home made jam.  My wife's & sons food was also perfect , soft & tasty French toast , fluffy eggs and crispy bacon . My salad coarse & potatoes were to die for. This place lives up to its reputation. Very tasty food , beautiful decor & comfy seating. The wait staff was quick, attentive & polite, refilling my coffee before I could think to ask & the food came out quickly.
author: Alex B.

description:
Home Plate is not as charming as it used to be. While the remodel as attractive, the place has a cold feel. I had the huevos rancheros and they were OK but not delicious. Service wasn't great either and it was some time before my order was taken. And no one checked to see if the food was OK. This review is pretty bland because it's not as fun as writing a one-star review or a five-star review. 

Meh.
author: Scott W.

description:
I was excited to try the newer larger Home Plate. it was weekend brunch at 9:35 am on Easter, but brunch places are packed in the marina all year round. After a 15 minute wait I was seated and it took 10 minutes for someone to take my order. Ordered corned beef eggs Benedict with potato latkes. It look d nice but then I tasted.   It took about 20 minutes to come out. The latkes were like Luke warm hockey pucks. The eggs were like hard boiled eggs. I did request different eggs and was asked if I would like my poached egg "easy" which in my opinion, people ordering poached eggs expect runny eggs. They brought me a new plate and the eggs were perfect. But instead of my latkes they brought potatoes and a salad (which I requested on it get because I do not like the smell of vinegar) (Potatoes were way better than latkes). I had a few bites and left. They did offer me an orange juice for the issues. Didn't adjust the bill or even care why 90% of the meal
Was left. I hope they adjust the staff to support the expanded size. Maybe in 6 months I will retry but for now I will stick with castagna for brunch.
author: Kimberly S.

description: I had a few errands to run and figured I would treat myself to breakfast. I saw this place on Yelp decided to try it out. I was able to get seated right away. The was great. They were friendly but not hovering allowing me to enjoy my meal. I ordered the crab cake Benedict with a potato pancake and orange juice. They were also kind enough to bring me a glass of water which I had to return because of the dirty glass. It was promptly replaced with a clean glass. The Benedict was delicious however one of the eggs was slightly over cooked. I probably wouldn't get the pancake again but the creme and apple sauce helped it a lot. Overall I had a good experience here and plan on going back.
author: Ashton V.

description:
Bummer... I really liked this place before they changed everything.  I stopped in for some coffee and pancakes today and promptly walked out after realizing the whole place was different.  I begrudgingly headed over to Mels Diner across the street instead.  

The vibe now is a bit too "fluffy white pillow" for me to feel comfortable sticking around for a quick weekday breakfast by myself.  It lost all it's casual dining appeal.

I suppose I may eventually come back with a group for brunch to get down on those amazing scones one last time.  But it now exclusively falls in the ritzy brunch spot category.
author: Douglas R.

description: Great breakfast for family on Lombard in Marina.  Nice, open atmosphere.  Big tables and booths.  Kids loved the waffles with butterscotch and pancakes with bananas.  Generous portions.  Good coffee.  Friendly staff and prompt service.
author: Steve B.

description:
The service at the original Home Plate had always been spot on.  The owners are friendly, hard-working, and courteous.  I've dined at their new location twice so far.  During my second visit, Kong the owner, excitedly informed me of his intent to open for dinner service in the near future.
A few days later as I was brain storming where to plan my son's first birthday party, a thought came to mind.  What not ask Kong and Stella if they'd be interested in hosting an after-hours dinner service for my son's birthday party?  I figured it would be a win-win situation for them.  They'd get more exposure from my 40-50 guests while making some extra income.  On Thursday at 1:30pm, I called Home Plate and asked for Kong.  A young man answered the phone.  He said the owner was not available.  I then asked for Stella.  He told me she was busy.  So he offered to take a message from me.  I gave him my name and number and told him the reason I was calling.  He immediately said " the owners do not want to do dinner." I asked him to please double check with the owners anyway and told the young man to ask Kong or Stella to call me back.  He seemed hesitant.  
The next morning around 10:30am, I decided to call Home Plate again in hopes of reaching one of the owners for a reply before I booked a different venue.  The same gentleman answered the phone.    I told him the reason I was calling again.  He said "The owners are never here.  They only come to collect money."  He also insulted me by saying "I cannot force the owners to call you.  If they are interested in your business, they will call you back." Wow, in my head I was thinking, WTF!?  This is one of the worst customer service I have ever experienced!  Let's say that the owners did indeed not care for my business.  I believe there are kinder ways to portray that to me other than utter disrespect!  The owners could've still returned my phone call with a reply.  I have been a patron for so many years!  
I certainly hope the young man's response was not a direct reflection of   Stella and Kong's intentions.  If it was, then I'm truly disappointed.  However, if it wasn't their intention, they should really check their staff for quality control if they want loyal customers to stay.
author: Gloria Y.

description: Ate here with friends after going to the American Craft Fair @ Ft. Mason yesterday & it is a FIND! All food is finely 'crafted' and beautifully prepared. The device is superb & the chairs are from heaven (seriously. Reminds my of cafe in Four Seasons Chicago Hotel). We had breakfast stuff- eggs Benedict, bacon in maple syrup w chili flakes, crab omelette, huevos rancheros, pancakes, home fries, scones, delish espresso coffees. An absolute treat!
author: Lin B.

description: HUGE portions but I'll take quality over quantity anyday. Walked in on an earlyish Sunday morning (8:00am) and asked for a table for 2 in the front area, they kindly escorted us to the back room instead which is way less appealing than the cute front area. Tables are extremely close together so get ready to hear every word your table mate has to say. A waiter finally came to take our order after waiting 15 minutes. Complementary scones were delivered to us with homemade jam and the food came quickly after that. Once again, huge portions. My veggie omelet was probably 4 eggs and a half pound of veggies. There was no real flavor- the veggies were practically raw (I prefer them more sautéed). Thank god there was hot sauce on the table. Pita tales were cold and side salad was a bowl of lettuce with a few drops of dressing. My sister had the angry Benedict which she raved about. She said she had never had a Benedict with so much flavor. Quite the opposite of my omelette. Would be willing to give this another go around if I had a front table and a better meal but then again, I'd think I'll try another marina brunch spot instead...
author: Kara N.

description:
This is a nice little hole-in-the-wall breakfast joint.  As the name sounds, got lots of neat baseball memorabilia on the walls.  But the food was awesome!  I had the special of the day: crab and avo omelette, and it was the perfect blend of fluffy, salty, and savory.
They also offer a selection of fresh squeezed juices, and it was legit! Totally coming back to this joint to try the rest of the menu.
author: Talon T.

description: Had been wanting to check this place but hadn't gotten around to it until last weekend when I had a friend in town visiting. The food was unreal! So delicious, everything we had did not disappoint. Not to mention the plating too is very well done. Definitely going to start coming more often.
author: Jamie L.

description: Breakfast was very tasty but pricey. Also, don't be fooled by the signage out front. The interior is more elevated than what I would expect from a brunch place. I brought my 5 year old nephews and it was not great for children.
author: Cari S.

description:
Everything was overcooked yet still cold. The meal appeared as if created by a machine. The hash browns came out in a large rectangle (overcooked and tasteless) and the bacon was the same.  I like crispy bacon but it has to have flavor. This was crunchy alright, it shattered on bite but too, was flavorless.

The location had a nice "look" to it and that is the only reason it got any stars.
author: Chris D.

description:
Food here is tasteful and good-looking. Decor is nice. This place is good choice for casual breakfast or lunch.

We haven't seen our waitress most of the time, and I would call such service as unobtrusive.
author: Nick N.

description:
AMAZING diner!! I am always worried when I see so many online articles online but these are well deserved! 
I had the homemade granola with fruits and I WISH I could remake this granola at home. This is by far the best granola you can ever dream of! 
Also the mimosa is a staple but was really appreciated :-) 
Really, you must try this place no ifs ands or buts!
author: Aurélie M.

description: Obsessed with the crab omelette! Chicken omelette is delicious too. Do wish they offered simple syrup for their iced coffee as regular sugar doesn't dissolve, but I've had 2 great brunches here. Highly recommend and their new location is great! Make sure to get on waitlist before arriving though!
author: Lauren T.

description:
Solid breakfast place in the Marina/Cow Hollow district of SF.

Prices are typical for SF --- $11 to $15 for breakfast plates.  

Service is fast & responsive, and we both loved our omelettes.
author: Matt C.

description: We are visiting for the weekend from Las Vegas and I used the yelp app to find a breakfast spot. I am sooo happy I chose Home Plate. I had the bottomless mimosas for 18.00 which is a great price compared to Vegas. And the fresh squeezed orange is the best I have ever had. The prices are reasonable I had the steak and eggs and it was the best breakfast plate ever. The atmosphere is relaxing and the decor has a calming effect. I am truly sad that I will not be able to return to home plate next weekend.
author: Sonia C.

description: What a great choice! Super clean, delicious food with unexpected extras, like fresh scones with jam as soon as sat down to breakfast and a side of greens with our eggs. Just redone and very nice. We will be back.
author: Pamela B.

description: This is a really good and agréable place to have a brunch with some friends. Great food with reasonable prices! However, I advise you to book a table 15-20 minutes before arriving there, the service was  really fast and we didn't waited too long, though.  I definitely recommend this place
author: Liberte F.

description: Quick service, food cane out super fast and was so good! I sill be coming all the time.
author: Megan M.

description: Nice decor with good comfort, good service, Scone always fresh, $18/person for whole party limited time 1.30hour surprisingly reasonable prices. They also have appetizers for happy hours. Highly recommend this place you must try! I will be back.
author: Thanawan L.

description: Food was good and fast but service sucked. I only saw my waitress once and that was to place my order. I dropped my fork multiple times, pretty sure our table was slanted or very slippery. Each time I got up to replace my fork. I also got up multiple times to fill up my water as well.
author: Jackie C.

description:
Came here for Sunday brunch with one of my girlfriends. I had high hopes for this place seeing that the line was out the door! At first glance, it seems like a successful mom and pop shop with a variety classic breakfast options like sausage, toast, omelettes, eggs benedict, etc. But they also have creative specialty breakfast options that try to fuse elements from different cuisines into classic breakfast options such as dulce de leche pancakes and the New York scramble.

Food: 3/5
Complimentary scone - The scone was tiny, about two inches in diameter, but a nice touch to start off the meal. It was moist and came with the best homemade strawberry and mango jam. I even made sure to smear all of the remaining jam onto the toast that came with my meal.

New York Scramble - I ordered the New York scramble thinking I loved all the elements of a New York bagel so combined with an egg scramble including avocado and sour cream, I was really expecting to be blown away. However, the the eggs were bland and the plate was arranged in such as way that the elements of the dish did not feel cohesive. I felt like I was have smoked salmon with a side of eggs and avocado. The potato carrot pancakes that came with the dish were good enough but didn't work well with the rest of the meal either.

Service: 4/5
The wait was pretty long, about 30 mins, which I suppose is typical for Sunday brunch prime time. The line was efficient and we were given menus in the meantime while we waited. Once we were seated, our orders were taken quickly and our food came just as quickly.

Ambience: 3/5
The restaurant has a very down to earth feel. The decor isn't fancy and the kitchen is open to the rest of the small dining space making it feel a little busy and cramped. Because of the limited seating space, two of us were seated at a table of four with the condiments serving as a barrier from the adjacent party of two. It felt a little awkward to be within hearing range of another couples conversation while pretending to not hear them, but we made it work.

Value: 2/5
I paid $15 for a subpar scramble and toast which to me felt very steep. The portions felt pretty small for the price too. Maybe the classic breakfast items are worth the splurge, but if I wanted just eggs and toast for breakfast, I would've stayed home instead of dropping $12.
author: Kristine T.

description: We went to Home Plate while on vacation. We woke up early and not many places in walking distance were open at 8am. The restaurant was very nice. Every detail of the decor and the presentation of the food was beautiful. The fresh squeezed orange juice might be the best I have ever had. I also ordered the buttermilk waffle and a side of bacon. It was all perfect.
author: Amy L.

description: All Star Bacon is a must! The staff is friendly and helpful. The eggs Benedict is always good. The potato pancakes are a must. The scones are to die for and I don't like scones. We do breakfast here every time we are in SF. Their new location was an unexpected change, I missed the small diner feel but the reduced wait was awesome.
author: Alysha D.

description: Delicious breakfast! I had the Dulce de Leche Pancakes while my mom had the Crispy French Toast. Both of us really enjoyed our meals and felt the portion size was spot on: not too much, not too little. I wasn't a big fan of the "scones" we were given before the meal though. They were crunchy and more biscuit-like; nothing like traditional scones you'd get in England. They also sat everyone in the same area, a little on-top of one another. I would've liked a little more space, especially since the restaurant wasn't packed or full. Overall delicious though and I'll happily go back.
author: Ashley E.

description: Their side dishes were very good - fries, potato pan cakes, and scones. The main dishes were underwhelming. We ordered Crazy Benedict and Chorizo and Eggs. Both needed more flavors.
author: Ah M.

description:
This is always our first stop when in SF
Breakfast here is really good. Small place but is moving to a bigger location down the street. They give you a complimentary biscuit with home made jelly while ypou wait for your food. Food is really good, I recommend the Spanish scramble, the chorizo and egg and the dulce de leche pancakes.
author: Claudia M.

description: The breakfast platter is so delicious; a complete meal with all very fresh ingredients. Love your staff, attentive but not overly so.  Thank you for creating a wonderful breakfast/brunch destination!
author: Erik E.

description: I ordered take out for breakfast one day earlier this week. the breakfast sandwich was good, but I asked the eggs to be cooked overmedium and they were cooked like sunny side up. I hate runny eggs, needless to say, I took one bite and got egg yolk all over my shirt and pants, 3 minutes after getting to work that morning. I also think it was super over priced.
author: Tati C.

description: If you enjoy a peaceful place home plate is the place for you with excellent food that you will enjoy with friends and family
author: John S.

description: I've been going here for several years. I used to absolutely love this place but recently the quality has noticeably declined. The service is not as good and our orders have been getting mixed up. The size of the glasses are smaller but drinks stayed the same price. The scones are smaller. The food isn't as good. I used to recommend this place without reservation but now I don't think I'll be returning.
author: Emma B.

description:
Hype. That's what I've been on these past few weeks: on that Brunchfest Hype.

They boast a four-star but, I'm giving it a solid tres estrellas right here.

They're sorta hole in the wall - not hating on that at all, cuz I love their small town feel especially since it's located off of busy Lombard in the Marina. They gladly seat you, hand you a menu and give you the time you need to peruse it. I was already set on my brunchfest to consist of a Bloody Mary since NO brunch is complete without it *ahem* This Bloody was a little short of, well... blood (tomato juice, flavor - just that spicy pizazz I guess I've gotten used to). It's pretty low key I'd say maybe for the "beginner" Bloody Mary drinker(?). Perhaps because it is made with soju and not vodka? Really unsure. Albeit it was lacking in flavor and color, it definitely did not lack in celery! They basically stripped off a stalk and stuck it in my glass - like the whole 2 inch x 14 inch stalk. It was a little hard to get the whole drink in my tiny iPhone picture frame.

Had their Home Plate breakfast. Before breakfast is served, however, they do serve you petite scones with butter and their housemade jams - we had apple and mango. This right here was a nice touch and possibly their saving grace. 

It's cute how their entire right side wall also serves as a blackboard menu with pictures too to help you envision your meal for all you right-brained individuals. That creative touch helps the restaurant appear a little more modern especially after just walking in.

At any rate, the food is good. Bloody Mary, not so much. I'd likely still come back but will probably have a coffee and water to wash down that petite scone and breakfast instead.
author: Cat V.

description: Really not what I was expecting, overpriced and to full of itself. The seating is super close to other patrons and they don't let you sit where you want. I mean the coffee was 3.25, cmon bud.
author: Mark P.

description:
* Love the new location, nice layout, décor
* Love the food, as good as ever
* Service is slow and a bit frustrating

Party of 3, they brought our food out for 2 guests, had to inquire after ten minutes about my wife's breakfast, she had not been served and no one seemed to notice. 

Slow to refill coffee, get the check, etc.

Perhaps they will add some staff? It's great that they have a line of people out the door on weekends, hope they get adequate help to serve everyone properly.
author: Scott N.

description: Very slow service 30 minutes for pancakes and scrambled eggs is a bit excessive, elevator music, pancakes were good therefore the 2 stars, eggs mediocre, the free scone was very good as well, maybe come when is not busy at all and you can wait a looong time for ok flavor.
author: Andres G.

description:
Sigh, we had such high hopes for this place. We came after the Sunday brunch rush and it was great because there was only 3 tables taken on top of ours. The place is really cute and the people are so nice, so why the low stars... well long story short, they just missed the mark for our table.

I had gotten a Spanish Scramble and for some reason it was VERY lacking, especially for a Special. There was barely any eggs that it was so recognizable. My boyfriend also ordered a scramble but his had a normal amount of portions in comparison to mine. In addition, all other tables received the complimentary scones except for us. Overall, the two misses were huge and greatly affected our overall experience.
author: Margarita M.

description:
Wow what a find!! I ordered their special- Bancock shrimp frittata with potato carrot pancakes. Delicious. Hubby ordered a special as well- the dulce de Leche pancakes with Carmel and almonds on top! Delicious! A total religious experience. We will be back for "the 2nd coming!! And I will order the angry Benedict!! Everything is unique and delicious. What a find! We will return!! 

2 days later we can't back. This time I ordered the ANGRY BENEDICT with SHRIMP!! Husband could not resist ordering the same as last time- the caramel Creem pancakes! Oh la la!! Delicious!! We walked in and was greeted by the friendly staff who remembered us!!all was delicious!
author: Lynette J.

description: More spacious, nicely remodeled, awkward set-up that made me feel uncomfortable.    Service was okay and the coffee was great but the biscuit/ scone was not as good as how it used to be (from previous owner).
author: Hannah L.

description: New Homeplate is one of my favorite breakfast spot now. I've tried so many good things so far. Great foods and reasonable prices & qualities. Definitely recommend it!!
author: Peter A.

description:
I've been frequenting this place for about 25 years. It's always been, in my opinion, the best breakfast spot in the city. Moved to a different neighborhood a couple of years ago yet I still would make the trek to the marina every now and again (2 busses) because the food and service were that good. I've recommended this place to countless people through the years. 
That being said, I went to eat there recently and, well, I was pretty disappointed. I was by myself and was sat about 4 feet away from the person at the next table. Right away very awkward. Whatever. Server came by a couple of times and checked in on the table next to me but I was ignored. Ok she's busy, I thought. It happens. Finally came over to my table and I said I was ready to order. She said ok I'll be right back. Well, I'm not kidding 15 minutes went by (felt like an hour) and crickets. So I got up and left. Total waste of time. 
So now the only thing I would recommend about this place is that you stay away. Find another establishment that values loyalty.
author: Phil L.

description: I came here to grab some breakfast on Memorial Day before heading back to SC. Since I knew it would be busy, I made sure to add my party onto their waitlist. My gf and I got sat and had our orders taken fairly quickly. They gave us really yummy scones but took forever bringing out our food. When I asked our waiter to check on our food, he returned and let us know that it had been given to another table and the kitchen was working on making another set for us. I thanked him for letting us know and asked our waiter if he could bring us more bread. Now, being a server, myself, I understand that sometimes kitchens can get backed up and that stuff happens but not being informed of the mistake and waiting another 30mins w/out having our meals discounted or at least comped wasn't cool. :/ we weren't even checked on, after we got our food. Bummer.
author: Livè S.

description: Food just ok. Had the Home Plate fritado...husband had bacon and eggs. His was better. Service terrible...$3.25 for coffee...no refills. I asked 3 times this morning.
author: Terri S.

description:
So good!!  Homemade scones brought out before our breakfast with homemade strawberry and mango sauces - what could be better??

I had the almond French toast and my husband had the Home Plate Special with raisin bread French toast. The kids had mushroom Swiss burgers and they were on homemade buns. 

Fresh juices (even honeydew!) and amazing smoothies with honey. 

So worth the wait if you see a line. I felt so sorry for all those people across the street at the IHOP - wasting money because the real food experience is Home Plate!!
author: Cheryl B.

description:
Omelette you finish, but I would've never thought to order a dungeness crab omelette, but my local friend pointed it out on the specials board and said, "You have to get that." Welp, I'm not about going against the advice of  my essentially local SF friend, so that's what I went with.

Holy moly, I wasn't expecting entire chunks (CHUNKS!) of crab in the omelette, I was thinking it'd be little bits and pieces. NOPE. I don't really order omelettes for a meal, but this was soooooo good. IF you see it on the daily specials, just forget what you were craving/wanted to order/needed/desired off the menu, because you must get this crab omelette!

It was a Saturday around noon, so there was about a 20-25 minute wait, which our friend said was pretty usual and not too bad. The place was packed and everyone was very much into their food. 

Definitely coming back here next time I visit - the food, the service, the people, the food, and of course, the food - were all top notch!
author: Matthew L.

description: OMG!! I highly recommend. This is a nice place to have breakfast in San Francisco. The place is so clean and good atmosphere. And my breakfast is so pretty decorated by petal of several flower. Love it!!!
author: Dolce D.

description: A tale of two visits. Came for breakfast on Friday and had a wonderful experience. Food was great and service was spot on. Saturday breakfast was a totally different experience. The floor staff were overwhelmed and disorganised. My partners pancakes came out 10 minutes before mine. The two tables next to ours returned their pancakes due to undercooked doughy pancakes. If you are a gambler roll the dice and you may get a 5 star or 3 star visit!
author: David P.

description: Stumbled upon this gem after waiting in line for hours at two other places. The food was great, the service was quick and the setting was quite lovely. My husband particularly liked that we could secure a place in line using the Yelp waitlist (especially after our experiences at other places earlier that morning). We loved it.
author: Nicole A.

description: Really great food and the place is so cozy! The crispy French toast was my fave! Prices were surprisingly inexpensive for a brunch place in the city. Looking forward to our next brunch here!
author: Rosita J.

description:
Service has gotten drastically worse in the new location. When you ask to change one thing server the looks at you like your stupid and then when my mom asked for fruit salad the woman acted like my mom was doing something wrong. 

One table even had to get up to get their own water after asking 3 time to be served. 

The food is good but the service is not worth it.
author: Stephanie D.

description:
My family went here after a wonderful morning playing at Golden Gate Park, and my daughter was tired and not entirely interested in normal "human in a restaurant" behavior, so we didn't get to spend as much perusing the menu as I would have liked. I got the corn beef hash, my husband got the corned beef benedict, we each got a fresh squeezed juice, and we got the small one some links. My plate and the kiddo's came out in about ten minutes...my husband's didn't...so baby and I munch a bit, waiting, and my husband says just to eat...so we eat...and still, my husband doesn't get his food...and no-one has bothered to check with us. We wait another 10, but my husband's food never came and still, no-one checked on us! Finally, we stopped someone to ask, they go check. Turns out the printer ran out of paper, and cut off my husband's order... but nobody knew, or bothered to check. So we just cancelled his and he ate the rest of mine.

TL;DR: The food was pretty good, the fresh squeezed juice delicious. The service subpar in the extreme.
author: Jennifer M.

description: Very good food. Everything was fresh and the wait wasn't too crazy for a Sunday after Church brunch, I believe you can also joint the waitlist before arrival online. They also offer bottomless mimosas, however, everyone at your table must participate. The ambiance is a huge plus as well, very cozy and cute. 10/10
author: Hallie M.

description: Great food and service.  Husband and I came here on a Sat for brunch.  Filled out our info on the ipad to get on a waitlist.  Waited for about 10 mins before getting seated.  They gave us fresh complimentary scones with homemade jam which were delish.  I got the homerun special and my husband got the chorizo and eggs.  Both were yummy and filling.  Would definitely recommend.
author: Lisa C.

description:
Never coming here again. Here is why:

We arrived outside at 1:05 pm on Sunday. We waiting about 15 min in line. They when we were seated - we were severed water and then forgotten.  We waited 20 minutes and then I had to go and find a server to come take our order. After we saw a group of two leave because they got tired of waiting. The table next to us also had to get up and grab a waiter who could take their order. We ordered and it took about 35 min before my eggs benedict arrived. Never did a waiter come to check on us to see if we needed more drinks. The food arrives, the English muffins were burned all around the edges and were soggy wet - like a sponge. The hollandaise sauce was absolutely bland, tasted like nothing. So all I could take was the egg, wet sponginess and burntness. Then we had to wait about 15 mins for the check, which we had to stop a waiter and ask for them to bring it. The same thing happened to the group of two who was sitting next to us. They pancakes were severely undercooked, she asked for a new one which never came and they got tired of waiting and asked for their check. This is the 3rd time Home Plate had failed us. Their new location is very nice but the service is non-existent and the food is a waste of one's time. I highly recommend you never even bother with coming here.
author: Nathan G.

description: Love the new location. More seating, very pretty and inviting. And as usual the food is exceptional.
author: Cat A.

description: Great place. Perfect for a brunch with friends. Plenty of seating , good for a big companies. Food is great, loyal prices.
author: Liza P.

description: Really good brekkie place. Super fast and efficient and big portions. Scones are delicious and their potato latkes are yummy too. I had the omelet with bacon and avocado it  came with latkes and sour dough toast with a scone. Awesome place!
author: Stacie S.

description: Only three stars based on comparing the new home plate v the old. The original location had a more homey feel, while this one has a trendy atmosphere.
