Not that this is a bad thing, just personal preference. The food at the new location, to me, does not taste the same. It appears that the menu has also been updated to fit the trendy decor as well. Also, they have done away with the complimentary scones. Some things to consider if you have been to the old location and are considering going to the new one!
author: Bianca B.

description: We're just visiting from the Midwest so are by no means experts on west coast cousine, but this place feels like it's just about perfect for the area. I got the basic home run special with eggs, French toast, sausage. Like I said, Midwesterners! And it was all great (probably hard to mess up scrambled eggs). But my wife went with the breakfast board. It arrived looking like a work of art. From the perfectly thin sliced smoked salmon to the sculped avocado, and the salsa in its own tin to avoid cross-contamination, the prep and presentation were amazing. It cost almost twice what mine did, but somehow felt she got the better deal. Add the super polite wait staff and almost zen vibe and the 30 feet between you and busy Lombard St. might as well be 30 miles.
author: M M.

description: One of the best crab omelettes I've ever had, and the staff are so friendly. I loved being able to join the waitlist remotely via the Yelp app. So convenient.
author: Dustin S.

description:
Amazing, amazing food. Staying at a hotel nearby and after the breakfast that graced my tastebuds this morning. I find myself planning the remainder of my vacation around breakfast at Home Plate. 
Go there. 
Order anything. 
Enjoy.
author: David S.

description: Although we'll always have a soft spot in our hearts for Baywatch, the restaurant that used to be in this Lombard St location, Home Plate is a worthy successor. Above average fare, service and decor.
author: Todd D.

description:
FYI, Home Plates food safety score has plummeted to a very alarming 67 and the service has become incompetent.
.
The usual scones came cold and after we had finished all our food, coffee and OJ. 
.
On the positive side, at $14.95 the Crab-cake Benedict came out perfectly and the potato carrot pancake with sour cream and applesauce was excellent.
.
From the Specials Chalk Board, not the specials menu, we also tried the $13.95 Angry Benedict with prawns and jalapeños. Another excellent dish also with potato carrot pancakes applesauce and sour cream.
.
What ever is responsible for this awful change in cleanliness and service, please correct it.
author: Caesar A.

description: Service was pretty bad and and food was under seasoned. Everything was bland. Not a terrible breakfast but would not return.
author: Rachel M.

description: This is a review for the new establishment, and it's more of a review for the restaurant and the service and not so much the food and here's why. We happened to show up on their very first day of the opening of their new place. We honestly are from out of town and thought this was the only place. Come to find out we have come for breakfast on day one opening. There was a line once we walked in, but it moved pretty quickly. Honestly for the first day opening, they were pretty calm and collected as a whole staff, I was surprised to hear upon entering that today was their first day. People were sat fairly quickly, we waited maybe ten minutes. The lady in front of us was a regular of their old place (she told us) and kept stopping employees as they walked past obviously busy, trying to offer her tips and saying there's open tables. They were very sweet despite the fact they were clearly busy. Let me start by saying this place is beautiful inside. They have decorated it in a farmhouse chic style that's so in right now and it just looks like it's straight out of a catalogue. We were sat at a table that were actually two tops placed side by side, which was a bummer because there were these cute little booths, and then round tables all over with comfy wingback chairs- but they were for larger parties. These ones were pretty close together which made it hard to hear each other or ignore the people a half an arms length apart from us. I ordered the corned beef Benedict and a coffee and my husband ordered the home plate special. You could tell that food was coming out at odd times and some people seemed bothered, but most people were happy and having a good time. I mean we were there in day one, it's expected. My husband got his food after a long wait, it had homemade chicken sausage patties, eggs and a waffle. He didn't enjoy his waffle, I liked the sausage because it seemed fresh and healthier. He ate his entire food and unfortunately mine hadn't come out yet. It had been a good 10 minutes. We flagged the lady down and she went and checked on the order. She came back and said they would be sending it right out. At this point, we needed to get going we had been there over an hour and a half. She was very apologetic and this is the reason for the four star review. She apologized over and over and another gentleman even came over and apologized and said that they had taken care of the entire bill. I have worked in many restaurants, one that I partook in the opening of, and I understand how stressful it is and how it takes a little bit to work the kinks out. This place will be just fine. They obviously care about their customers and their food, I wish this place the best. It's a beautiful place with yummy sounding food. Just wish I had gotten to taste it after they've figured out how to accommodate a much larger establishment. I hope to be able to try your place again!
author: Ryann H.

description: I'm baaaaaaacccck. 4 stars. Not 5. Had he corned beef Benedict. Wouldn't get it next time. English muffin was a bit over toasted and hard to eat completely. Water was good. Waitress was nice. Ambiance was great. Not too bad for the Marin-brah. Would recommend.
author: Connor H.

description: The place is só beautiful. Charming. And everything good that you can image. The plates... well... they are good but not that big. One for each person is fine.
author: Jaqueline Y.

description: The food was ok.  Nothing extraordinary but it was good.  The customer service can improve. First they kinda got upset cause we asked for another table since the one we originally got was next to were the waiters had the water and stuff.  Next they were a bit upset about the stroller we had.  Finally they took forever to bring the check and to charge our card.
author: Angelica B.

description:
Poorly executed service. The food came luke warm and heavily buttered after a long wait. 

Staff was not attentive and food came out at different times. Over greasy and tasteless. Not impressed. Not worth the long wait.
author: Waseem A.

description: Nice staff but food was horrible. Huevos rancheros was totally off. Bad tortilla, bad egg, bad cheese and bad sauce. Couldn't finish. Coffee was a little weak for my taste, but I like it really dark.
author: Matt A.

description: Very nice inside and outside. People were very nice. Good location. Gets pretty busy but the space was big and roomy. Good food and good size portions
author: David T.

description: Very good place to have breakfast i totally reccomend it. Worth the wait and you end up waiting more at ihop for reheated food. This is quality food and good quantity for the price which is similar to ihop prices i will come again when in town!
author: Sofia B.

description: Amazing food but new location is kinda messy. It took about 45 minutes for them to sit us and there were so many open tables. We ended up getting seated at a table that was available since we got there. But the food is great
author: Sabrina K.

description: The hotel recommended this place. Thank goodness we didn't go to IHOP. Loved the scones and the strawberry and apple jam. The crab cake Benedict was delicious!! Yummy. There was no wait but we went on a weekday!  Will be back whenever we visit this city again!
author: Jen C.

description: Perfect brunch! Can't believe we didn't do it before! Every dish was warm, hearty, and delicious. Happy with every single bite!
author: Vika N.

description: I love the breakfast here the potato carrot pancakes are fantastic!! So cute to start us with a little scone and jam :) we've loved everything we've ordered!!
author: Paige B.

description: Food was average. Came out really quickly and a bit lukewarm. $1.50 for one extra scone is a little overpriced.
author: J Y.

description: Great portions. Their brunch is the excellent. I'd highly recommend going there on a Saturday.
author: Shawn P.

description: This place is GREAT. I love the yelp check in option (especially since we live in Daly City and usually Uber in, we can do it in the car and then our table is basically ready when we get there!). Came for bottomless mimosas and they did not disappoint! I usually don't love when places premix the champagne and OJ as it's typically 80% OJ, but theirs is a pretty solid mix and the OJ is super fresh and super good. While $18 is a little steep, I would say we got our money's worth. They were pretty good about coming around and refilling glasses. The food was great too, we all got the combo to try a bit of everything. Highly recommend!
author: Maddie D.

description: Dulce de Leche pancakes were amazing!  Comfy chairs, big windows, homey atmosphere.  Great place to relax with family and friends.
author: L G.

description:
Went to Home Plate for brunch today. Great ambiance to begin with. The place did not have loud music and had cosy seating arrangement.
The food Was delicious and the serving size was great, truly was bang for the buck.
The only thing disagreeable was that the server for our table seemed to be in a bad mood and kinda rude. 
Other than that the entire experience was perfect.
author: Anab W.

description:
This place is my absolute favorite! I've been going here with my boyfriend every Sunday, and I love that they remember us and our order! It's really sweet, and it has such a family feel to it. I recommend their french toast with strawberries and my boyfriend loves the Homerun Special! It's such a great deal and the food is to die for. They also have these complimentary, delicious scones with homemade jam. I wish I could buy a dozen of those every morning. 

Definitely give them a try when you're in Marina/Cow Hollow. 

Without a doubt a better value than most brunch places in the area.
author: Lisa B.

description:
Stumbled upon this place because it was near our hotel and I am completely impressed!!!! 

It's such a cute lil spot that serves these delicious complimentary scones while you wait for your food to come out with mango jam!  
I ordered the special scramble with hash browns, amazing!!! Definitely recommend coming here!
author: Kayla S.

description: Very nice and cozy place, delicious food, great presentation, accomadating stuff. Definitely coming back next time we're in the city
author: Tatiana D.

description: This little hole in the wall place it's great. The food was excellent and the service was great. We loved the scone and jam it's was delicious. My husband ordered the crab scrambled eggs and he loved it. You have to try the homemade chicken patties, delicious. We definitely recommend it.
author: M M.

description: This is our go to breakfast place when we are in San Francisco. We come every couple of months for doctors appointments and being able to eat breakfast here almost makes spending an entire day at UCSF worth it. The frittata and eggs Benedict's are phenomenal and potato pancakes are amazing.
author: Michelle W.

description: I've known home plate for a while now and it was my sister in law that introduce me to this place and so far the taste is there.the order process is fast as well so when am busy at work I just order online and the pick up service is fast.
author: Liliana P.

description:
What a nice small breakfast joint.  

The meal began with a pleasant greeting and a warm cup of coffee.  Seconds later our order was taken and an unexpected treat arrived.  A small warm scone is given to each patron accompanied by two flavors of home made jam.  I love unexpected treats!

I paid special attention to cook staff as you can look directly into the kitchen.  Care was taken with each plate of food.  

Staff(5 out of 5):

Pleasant and happy to see us.  Friendly and prompt.  Four coffee top offs in our short visit.

Food (4 out of 5):

Eggs, bacon, sausage, pancakes, mushroom-spinach-swiss omelet.

Everything was tasty and cooked perfectly.
author: Steph P.

description:
Great place for brunch! Fairly close to the Palace of the Fine Arts (it's a nice walk after eating--haha) and also Baker Beach. Not too sure about the parking situation because I took a lyft there. 

Walking into the cafe, I was greeted by smiling waiters and the most adorable menu written on blackboard. Got raisin scones with strawberry jam and mango jam (my first time having it!) as a starter. The scones were warm and the jam was sweet-- the mango jam in particular was kinda tangy and I really enjoyed it. I ordered the Pacifica Omelette a small orange juice. The omelette came as a combo with toast (your choice) and potato -carrot pancakes served with sour cream and apple sauce. The omelette was simple but I could tell that all of the ingredients were fresh; the shrimp really made it memorable. The potato-carrot pancakes were delicious and dipping a piece into both the apple sauce and sour cream made for a sweet and savory combo. For good food and a college kid budget, I highly recommend.
author: Mary S.

description:
Home plate sits unassuming on Lombard St surrounded by hotels. Inside is basic tables and chairs with old baseball photos on the wall (took me a couple of visits to realize "home plate" was a baseball reference...). Although not massive in size it does fit a fair few people with room to move. They also have high chairs available.

The food is pretty standard diner with a bunch of specials which are quite unique. There are also free scones and jam at the beginning of the meal. The service is always friendly and pretty quick, I have only been on quieter days so I don't know if that changes on a Saturday/Sunday brunch when there is a crowd outside the door.

There is a private bathroom with space to move, pretty clean with all the bits and pieces you need.

It isn't one of the trendy places in the area but it is solid and fairly cheap.
author: Tristan L.

description: Get the dulce de leche pancakes and Bangkok frittata and you will be in heaven. Great breakfast spot.
author: Gentry W.

description: What a gem of a restaurant. Went for breakfast. Everything was freshly made using quality ingredients. Run away from IHOP and eat here!! Home run special is highly recommended. As a side note: the owners are very nice people care about your food experience and positively deserve a chance for your business!
author: Jim S.

description: Great find in SF! Super small place but worth the wait. I had the Homeplate Fritatta which was excellent.
author: Tonya C.

description: Ordered the California Scramble the crab didn't smell right and there was hair in my food. When I pointed it out it was not really acknowledged. Definitely never coming back to this place.
author: Sundeep A.

description:
Keep in mind I NEVER had BRUNCH before so this was my very first time. Located right across iHop, people say this is the place for real breakfast and brunch. Came in during lunch hour and surprisingly this place isn't very big, so there was a little bit of waiting. I'd say if waited ten minutes before getting seated inside. The inside is very sleek and modern which makes this place so cute. I've been eyeing the almond French toast since I've seen it on Yelp so that was what I wanted. My friend got the corned beef Benedict and we agreed to share each other's food since it looked like big portions. People walked in and out, as this place filled up with hungry people quickly. We first got free scones on the house with mango/strawberry jam, yum(yay for free food)! 
A few minutes later, both of our plates arrived looking better than ever. The almond French toast came with six half slices but better yet, they were big slices. The Benedict dish came with the two usual eggs with hollandaise sauce on top with a hash brown on the side! We dug in quickly after all the picture taking and oh my, Home Plate is the way to go! Definitely didn't let my first time brunching go to waste, service was amazing as well. Left this place total $30 with tip. I'll be back soon whenever I'm in the area.
author: Lisa W.

description:
Came here with my family on a Sunday morning. Pretty small place, waited about 25 minutes for 5. The service wasn't bad, they're pretty nice. The best thing about the place is the free scones that you get while waiting for your food. 

I ordered the corned beef hash. Pretty mediocre. My sister got chorizo and eggs, she barely touched it. It was very bland and not like we're used to. My brother actually enjoyed his Marco Polo. The home plate fritata was nothing special. New York scramble was pretty plain as well.

The foods all come with choice of hash brown or carrot potato pancake. We all got the hash brown so I can't comment on the pancake, but it was pretty gross. It tasted burnt and bland.
author: Steven C.

description: Very delicious breakfast, tasty, good quality. Cost is reasonable. I also loved their strawberry and mango sauces for breakfast muffins.
author: Mariana I.

description:
Great brunch spot in the Marina.  The line can sometimes be long so make sure to sign up on the wait list sheet.

Each meal comes with the most tasty buttery scones and jam. I recommend ordering the carrot pancakes as the side.

I had the crab omelette which is light healthy and tasty.  If you see the Bangkok frittata special, be sure to order it. So good
author: Eric B.

description:
Home Plate has become my favorite breakfast spot not only in just the Marina, but across the whole city!

The ingredients are very high quality, the staff is friendly and professional, and they even give you a warm scone with jam & butter while your delicious frittata is being made...

While sipping an iced coffee the other morning, I realized I was never going to either iHop or Mama's ever again...

I highly recommend Home Plate to both travelers passing through, and long time locals looking for their perfect go-to spot in the neighborhood!
author: HappyGo H.

description: Love Home Plate and have been coming here for 20 years, but the service at the new place is atrocious. The buildout is beautiful, but they raised their prices and if you can't deliver food in a timely fashion, it doesn't matter. We waited over 40 minutes for our food, and even then it didn't all come out together.
author: Matt D.

description: Took our family here this morning for breakfast.  If your hungry for a good breakfast, this is the place in this neighborhood.  The food was top notch.  It arrived promptly and looking great. The portion size was amazing. If you walked away hungry from there portions you have issues.  We had the crab omelette. The shrimp omelette and the meat lovers omelette. They were all delicious.  Worth the money for a great breakfast.
author: Dave T.

description: This place is delicious and very affordable. It offers complementary scones with jam. I recommend getting the Home Run Special, it has everything you need in a breakfast.
author: Jason R.

description: We went on a Sunday and only had to wait about 10 Minutes which surprised us. We were expecting at least a 45 to an hour wait so that was a nice surprise. Our waitress was nice and took our order very quick and brought us our complimentary scones which were delish. I really liked the jelly that was on the side. My only complaint is that my coffee was luke warm, and our food was also just semi warm not hot as if it was just made.
author: Priscilla R.

description: This place is the best! It may look like a hole in the wall from the outside but the food is amazing and portions are huge! I love the endless mimosas, especially the grapefruit one!
author: Lindsay M.

description:
This place did have a wait at around 8:30, but it wasn't too long! They made sure we were in the loop for how long we would have to wait. Then, we were seated and they immediately took our drink and food order. Soon after, our food was given to us. We all ordered omelettes(phenomenal), corned beef(delicious), one of the specials(to die for) and buttermilk pancakes(so frickin fluffy). 

The only downside to this place is the price. It's pretty expensive for about everything.
author: Maya K.

description:
What an adorable gem.  You will have to get there several days ahead of time to find a parking space unless you are very lucky so plan accordingly. It's small and shoulder to shoulder with the most incredible full wall chalk menu you've never seen.

I had a Thai flavored egg creation with taste so tingling I'm still experiencing it two weeks later. Across the table from me was French toast big enough for an entire baseball team. Make this modest and engaging little breakfast and lunch place top priority next time you're in the West Lombard area.

 See photos below of the two dishes I mentioned above.
author: John N.

description: Really good breakfast. Strawberries on my French toast were really fresh and everything else was great. People are very nice and it wasn't too crowded like some of the other places around that area.
author: Gracie N.

description: We were in San Francisco for a family wedding & stayed in Cow Hollow.  One morning we got up & walked around & found Home Plate.  My husband wanted to try & we entered & were seated right away.   From there it went down hill as took over 5 mins to have any one come over & offer us coffee.  We did get our coffee & ordered & both of us ordered off of the sides as not that hungry so wanted something light.   The potato pancakes were ok but confusing to order as I asked for 2 potato pancakes & received a plate w/6 on it.  My husband also just order 2 eggs over easy & rec'd a plate with 4 nicely cooked eggs!   All in all, besides the confusion of how many items come on a side, they corrected the plates & everything was fine.  This could've been avoided if the menu let customers know how many come in the side order.  Food was hot & tasy but service @ the start a bit lacking.
author: Cathy F.

description: One word...YUM!!! This place is in a great location, close to many hotels and motels along Lombard St. in the Cow Hollow District of San Francisco. The price is very good for the city, but may give sticker shock to some travelers. HOWEVER, you get a lot of food for the price. My mother and I both ate for $29, both had pancakes, eggs, bacon, and hot tea. The scones are free and delicious!!!
author: Jessica H.

description: The environment is so calm and beautiful, the customer service is the best I've seen so far in this city (I'm only here for the weekend), the food came quickly and tasted great! There's a lot of variety here and I enjoyed every moment of this! I highly suggest that you visit this place for breakfast! There's no wait time here even at 9:30. I love love love this place!
author: Jeannie M.

description:
Located literally across the street from IHOP, it's definitely a better choice. Small restaurant that has shared tables with benches if it gets too packed. 

Ordered the Breakfast starter which includes 2 eggs, hash browns or their pancakes, toast and meat ($2 extra) good portions and good customer service. 

PLUS, they give you scones and jam on the house :) 

Would come back if I'm in SF.
author: Gina K.

description: We came into the restaurant hoping we could get vegan options. Neither the vegetarian burger or the portobello mushroom burger was available although listed on the menu. When asked if we could just get a salad with added vegetables we were told that they were unable to accommodate us as they could not deviate from salads listed. Not great customer service.
author: Debbie C.

description:
Egg white omelette just ok

No cottage cheese. No tomatoes 
Disappointed breakfast. Waitress barely understood English
author: Martin A.

description: Such a cute and quaint spot! Not only was the service great, but the food was as well. I ate the yogurt parfait with fruit and it was delicious. The fruit was so fresh and yummy. My boyfriend got the crab cake Benedict and loved it as well. I definitely recommend this place to everyone who's looking for a affordable/good food
author: Lily W.

description: I don't understand why people mess with a good thing. The newly opened Home Plate was a fail from start to finish. The person seating people couldn't keep things straight and you couldn't hear her at all. The waitress told us they no longer had hashbrowns as an option (which turns out wasn't true) and that you could no longer get blueberry pancakes. The two things I was most excited about. Meals came out at different times. The potatoes and eggs were cold. The pancake was like rubber. The service was terrible overall.  We were loyal and regular visitors to Home Plate pre move. No longer...  just sad.
author: Michelle K.

description: Cute brunch spot in Marina. Not in the neighborhood that I usually hang out in, but it's nice to branch out to a different part of town some time. The Yelp app waitlist is awesome as it saved us at least 20 minutes. The line moved pretty fast and we got seated within 5 mins of arrival on Saturday ~11.30am (several parties ahead of us were not there in person when the hostess called their names). The price was also pretty reasonable: My friend and I each got a pink mimosa and decided to split a Benedict entrée (there were 2 eggs anyway) and 2 other small bites (crab puffs and salmon roll). That turned out to be the right amount of food. It was a bummer that we didn't get the (complimentary?) scones. My guess is we would have needed to order 2 entries to get them? Anyway, cute spot with reasonable price that I'd visit again if I were in the neighborhood. Wish more restaurants would adopt the Yelp waitlist system.
author: Mel L.

description: Really enjoyed the waffle with blueberries. Perfectly thin and crispy, savory, with adequate sweet from the blueberries. Corned beef hash was good, not great; the corned beef cubes were tender, just the right amount of saltiness but the potatoes were not seasoned well or crispy. Eggs florentine was standard. They have a large menu with a number of items that looked pretty good. Prices were fantastic for the neighborhood and area. Service was good. Repeater.
author: Will H.

description: Nice farm to table type food ! Highly recommend for breakfast/brunch . Cozy atmosphere.
author: Tracy S.

description:
First they brought out scones which were complimentary. AMAZING. They had homemade strawberry and mango jams that complimented the scones beautifully. The service was outstanding. We had three servers constantly checking up on us. My coffee was ALWAYS filled to the brim. 

Now to the food. I had the New York scrambled eggs, an omelette with tomatoes, smoked salmon, cream cheese, and hash browns on the side, along with toast. The presentation was on point and the flavor was just as good! Would definitely recommend. 5 out of 5.

FYI, get there early, it gets full quick!
author: Matthew H.

description: Went here after Barry's that's next door. Got sufficient calories and protein to recover from the workout. What more one could ask for?
author: Nandan S.

description:
I would like to start off by saying that I was really enjoying my corn beef hash benedict then shit hit the fan.....

I found a small COCKROACH on my biscuit and that was the end of my home plate experience. The server seems not to be phased by this which also raised my suspicions.  They were polite and did as they should've, comped our entire meal.

I feel bad for the owners as they seem sweet but this is simply unacceptable. Hope they are able to clean up their act and straighten out the cleanliness of their establishment.

I will not be going back, ever.
author: Zach K.

description:
Delicious food and a friendly staff. They have so many fresh options for juice too!
Intimate and bright this is the perfect place to go for a brunch date with a good friend or significant other.
author: L S.

description: Visiting the city, found this location on Yelp. We Were able to add name to wait list before we arrived, love that! Breakfast was delicious, would definitely return.
author: Charlotte H.

description: When every other restaurant had a long wait, we found this place and was glad we did! The food was so fresh, delicious, unique options, vegetarian-friendly, and the staff was very nice.
author: Josh L.

description: I'm puzzled by the high yelp score. Food mediocre, service brusque and almost unfriendly. Loud. Maybe it was an off day.
author: Cathy C.

description:
COME AND EAT ANYTHING HERE!!!
So so good!!! I had the carnivore omelette. I love the complimentary raisin biscuit with fresh mango and strawberry jam. 
Great service!! 
Promptly greeted, sat down and told about specials. Food was made and brought out piping hot. They checked on us each time to make sure cups were not empty and needs met. 
My overall opinion is awesome!!
author: Tish D.

description:
**Truth be told, I've actually had this review finished for a while now.  Like, a long while.  The only thing that held me back from posting was how many stars to give.  And the fear that friends/fellow Yelpers Sara P. and Vicky L. (as well as everyone else that loves Home Plate) would give me a ton of grief for saying that, outside of the scones, I wasn't as amazed as I had hoped.

With a very casual, mom-and-pop feel to the restaurant, Home Plate isn't nearly as trendy or fashionable as other places in the Marina.  However, for me, that just adds to the appeal.  Bottomless mimosas at Circa may (or may not) be the thing to do (and boy I hope it's not), but I'd much rather come to a place like this for brunch with friends.

Offering a slate of more traditional breakfast dishes (benedicts, waffles, pancakes, omelettes, hashes, etc.), it'd be fair to say Home Plate offers more homely breakfast plates.  Since we were planning on spending the rest of the day wine tasting in Napa, I wanted something heftier and ordered the CHUNKY CORNED BEEF HASH ($9.50).

Although there were some good things about the dish, I thought it was just okay.  On the plus side, the portion was pretty generous, the eggs were poached nicely, and the horseradish cream had just the right kick.  Yet, even despite all that corned beef, the dish felt light on flavor.  It was certainly meaty, but it felt like the dish (especially the potatoes) needed more seasoning (http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/home-plate-san-francisco#P6lVtarWiXYudw7G1hThxw).

Still, even though my dish was a little underwhelming, I would still come back to Home Plate again.  Partially to try my luck with another dish, but also to get another one of their awesome scones.  I don't mean to oversell them, but I will - they're one of the best I've had!  A little buttery, yet relatively light, and just straight up delicious.  You can keep the bottomless mimosa, I'd much rather have a couple of these instead (http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/home-plate-san-francisco#ywYRbwy4OkB03hzRWbXQUg).
author: Mike L.

description: Very cute restaurant, loved the setting. Service was below average but the food and portion sizes were great. I would definitely go back.
author: Sarah A.

description: I got food poisoning from the Corned Beef Benedict.
author: Tom D.

description:
Pretty tasty.

The potato-carrot hash cakes taste a lot like latkes (Jewish potato pancakes). Home Plate even serves them with apple sauce and sour cream (latkes are served with apple sauce & sour cream).

I ordered the Blackstone Benedict which is eggs benedict with tomato and bacon. The hollandaise  sauce was cold as was the bacon. Not much flavor either :(
author: Rachel R.

description: So good! Stumbled upon this place by accident. The food is awesome. Service is great. And the ambiance is peaceful and happy. Fantastic!
author: Prerona M.

description: I've been here with family several times and it's become disappointing more and more. They used to give two scones per person, now it's one. Their smoothies are good and so are their scones. Unfortunately, the food is more bland and less amount served. The ham is chewy and dry on their Eggs Benedict. The California scrambled had no flavour. Had to put a ton of salt and pepper. There was a tablespoon of crab. We've tried different dishes and a few repeatedly but it sad to see what is happening to their food. We will not be coming back again.
author: Nancy M.

description: Awesome breakfast. Came here three days in a row when I was in town. Something different everyday and all good. The Corned Beef Benedict was the favorite
author: Paul P.

description: I really don't get why this place has such a good rating: the service was very slow and inattentive and the food (burgers and an omelette) were nothing more than ok. There are much better places around.
author: Saar G.

description:
Concept is good. My food wasn't. 

The sausage had hard bits of bone and cartilage. The potato-carrot pancakes looked nothing like the pictures and I only needed one bite to decide not to commit further digestive resources. 

Good location though...
author: Mike M.

description:
We stayed at a hotel nearby and went here for breakfast. It is a smallish place, but we got there early so we where seated right away.

The food was great, very delicious and the portions where just right for us.
The waiters where very friendly, professional and service minded.

We also had some sandwiches to go, for a picnic lunch, with where very good, and packaged so that they didn't get neither soggy or dry in the bags.

Will definitely eat here again.
author: Morten K.

description: Cozy atmosphere with super fresh ingredients. I got New York scramble. Salmon and avocado were a delicious addition. Very friendly service.
author: Candice M.

description: I hadn't been to Home Plate for several years (living in the East Bay)....when I went this morning for breakfast I first thought wow, it looks so elegant.  I should have guessed from the giant size of the menu that quality food was no longer their priority.  Everything about our breakfasts was tasteless, barely warm, bland....and expensive!  I was embarrassed that I had brought friends from out of town.
author: Ann T.

description: Hands down the best scone I have ever had, and topped with delicious homemade jam. We had the Spanish scramble, the angry Benedict, waffles, and pancakes. Everything was fantastic, now I need to go lay down!!
author: Chanisa I.

description:
The original owner was the bomb. He made everything from scratch. Homemade scones, and fresh strawberry jam. 
Now I see they have a new owner. What a disappointment. Food was not spot on. Breakfast was boring. Not coming back
author: Wolfie M.

description: Lovely place for breakfast/brunch. Decor is very nice and all the breakfast items we ordered tasted great. Service was polite. Prices were reasonable. No wait as we came on a weekday around 10am.
author: R S.

description: They recently moved to this location, about 2 blocks from their old location. Great owners and great food. Ambience is a 1000 times better, and the food is excellent
author: Bill H.

description: A bit of a wait but that's because the food is delicious!!! This is a hidden Gem!!! Service was on point!!! Get the home made chicken sausage it was seasoned and cooked to perfection!! Got the polenta breakfast the best I have ever had!!!  Home made  scones are complimentary sample!!   Guess where we are eating tomorrow?? See you there!!!
author: Vanja S.

description:
Where you feel like home. 

If you frequently eat out like me, you yearn for a regular spot. If you live in the Marina, look no further than Home Plate. A small, neighborhood restaurant with regular brunch fare and affordable prices in a notable highbrow area, this is a gem. 

With freshly made juices and complimentary baked-to-order scones, how can you really go wrong? The food is nothing especially spectacular, but Home Plate is a good, dependable local business. I highly recommend the pastrami sandwich or waffles. The crab melt is good (made with real crab), but needed more salt and pepper. The carrot & celery juice and the cantaloupe juice are amazing - comparable to those $10 cold-pressed juices, but at a more affordable price. 

Most brunch-goers are families or couples, which is a great sign that this is a down-to-earth spot. Already eaten at Home Plate twice, and a meal for two (with drinks, tax, and tip) are often between $30-40. The restaurant seats about 20-30. Street parking is available.
author: Joanna S.

description:
Delicious fresh squeezed orange juice.  Not too long a wait, at least at 9 am. Now I'm not normally a scone fan (I usually find them too dry and dense)  but the complimentary scone was light, fluffy and more reminiscent of a cakey biscuit. 

The potato carrot pancakes were a delight.  The slight sweet notes from the carrots worked in perfect harmony with the earthy potato and tart sour cream. They could have been a bit crispier though. 

Angry Benedict: absolutely perfectly poached eggs.  Hash brown were thin and crispy, just the way I like them. The combination of the shrimp, hollandaise, jalapeño and spinach was delicious, although it could have stood to be "angrier", haha. 

Chunky corned beef: a little chunkier than expected, but that's probably because I was expecting your standard hash, just with a chunkier consistency.  These are literal cubes of corned beef hash, which were tasty, just unexpected. 

Service was great, polite,  cheerful and attentive. The prices were very reasonable,  especially for a brunch place in the city. Would definitely recommend!
author: Miiiiiiiiike S.

description: Delicious and fresh! My boyfriend and I came here after searching for nearby breakfast places. We settled on this one and were not disappointed. Ordered the fresh orange juice and banana power smoothie following dulche de leeche and banana/walnut pancakes. Everything was fresh and very tasty!
author: Miranda P.

description:
Rounding third and coming to Home Plate... Restaurant! :)
(okay, had to get that baseball reference out of the way).

Located on the ever busy Lombard Street, managed to
snag a nice parking space and thought I would have
to wait due to the popularity of this diner.  Well I lucked
out, missed the breakfast rush and was greeted
and seated immediately.

Cool factor... getting a complimentary scone with 2 spreads
and butter.  Very nice as you wait for your order.  I had the
eggs benedict (BTW, National Eggs Benedict Day is
April 16) and it was as expected.  Poached eggs, ham
on muffin covered in hollandaise sauce with a nice side
of hash browns.  Nicely plated and tasty too.

Notables... dining space is small but manages to handle
various number of customers.  On the wall, helpful
suggestions on what to order.  Service was friendly,
attentive with a smile during my visit. 

Afford yourself an opportunity for a nice sit down meal and
a scone as a starter.  You will safe crossing Home Plate...
Restaurant.
author: W L.

description:
On our first trip to SF & saw this gem on Yelp of course! We really try to steer clear of chain restaurants & love to support local. 
This is right across the street from IHOP- and you won't be disappointed. What a great menu spread! They had me at corned beef. And NO- none of that crap from a can. 
We had breakfast here twice.
Day 1- corned beef eggs benedict. Some bits were like jerky... tough to chew.
Day 2- was hesitant to order corned beef again- & I asked our server how the corned beef is in the corned hash. She said cut up in pieces. I was assuming tiny pieces. But, when my plate came- they were chunks! And YAY! The meat was tender! Super happy I made a great decision.
And since my hubby doesn't care for scones- I indulged in their dainty scones both mornings. The strawberry & mango jams were yummy. I just wish the butter was a bit more room temp.
Oh- there are communal tables & a clean bathroom.
author: Joanne P.

description: This is a busy weekday breakfast place for the value tourists staying on the Lombard corridor. The chicken sausage was the best part. Prices and portions are solid. Otherwise, I thought the carrot potato pancake had minimal carrot and was very greasy and doughy. Everything kind of lacked flavor.
author: Andrew K.

description:
Free scones are great, and they went all Noe Valley pretty in here. 

The benedicts, pancakes, club sandwich and omelettes  are all good. Don't try and be all 'healthy' and get a portobello sandwich. Huge mistake ( rubbery mushroom you can't bite through, dry, sliver of mozzarella=bad)

Still 4 stars because I probably ordered the one bad thing on the menu.
author: El B.

description: home plate is just okay. a casual breakfast spot in the marina with decent, relatively overpriced food for what it is. the space is small which results in a line anytime there's more than 10 people in there at a time (read - any weekends) but i'd save your money and head to ihop across the street. same quality food at a cheaper price point.
author: Alexandra K.

description:
Really enjoyed Home Plate for brunch this weekend! 

To start, the wait was only about 15 minutes at 11:45am on Sunday. You can write your name on a list and wait outside, wander around, until they call your name. The place is pretty small, but they move efficiently.

Free scone with entree purchase is huge, so you don't go crazy waiting for your food. The scone was delish, too! I got an omelette, which was enormous, I couldn't finish it (a rare occurrence). The potato-carrot pancakes you can get instead of hash browns were a cool change. 

My friend got a breakfast sandwich with sausage, egg, cheese on english muffin, and maybe he was super hungry, but he said it was awesome! 

Service is friendly, fast, and overall a very enjoyable place for breakfast! I'll go back for sure. The menu is so big, there's a lot to try!
author: MaryKate M.

description: Love it! Been here so many Saturdays and Sundays for The bottomless mimosas and amazing food!
author: Ben S.

description: I love this place!!! The food is always filled with flavors and the staffs are very nice!! I love their french toasts!!!!  I usually get the simple breakfast. Sunny side up eggs, sausage and hashbrows!! Everything is always cooked to perfection. I will definitely bring my grandparents here!!
author: Malisa W.

description:
A great place for breakfast if you're in the Cow Hollow section of San Francisco, along Lombard Street. They have the usual breakfast items- eggs, bacon, pancakes, omelets, frittatas. and hash- it's not the variety, they just do it better.
For example, you order orange juice, you get fresh-squeezed, as in onsite, the real deal. If you order the hash, instead of some half-burned, canned, Mary Kitchen style hash with diced mystery meat and potatoes, you get chunks of corned beef, potatoes, and green pepper, topped with two poached eggs, accompanied by a tasty horseradish cream and toast. 
Service was great. Every order gets you a scone and homemade jam to munch on while your order is prepared.
If you want to cheap out, by all means hit the IHOP across the street. I'll take Home Plate any day- a top-notch breakfast at a good price.
author: Mark M.

description: The decor is simple but does a good job of not making it seem like a little hole in the wall. Very homey feel, friendly staff. The food was just okay though.
author: Delilah C.

description:
Oh amazing. The BBC (bacon, banana, and chocolate) pancakes are not always on the regular menu, but if you ask real nice, they'll usually give them to you. Complementary homemade scones and jams and butter - people still do this?! I love everything about this place, from the kind servers, excellent chef staff, delicious food, comfortable atmosphere, and baseball decor, right down to the rotating cast of specials, and the ample customer-only bathroom. 

The things you should do when eating here include: 1) be super patient on a weekend because there is no chance you'll get in without putting your name on the list and waiting; 2) try not to over-order - it is really difficult!; 3) greet your fellow patrons kindly - it's a very small restaurant and you'll be cozy together while nomming; 4) order butter with your pancakes and enjoy the real maple syrup. 

This is the kind of breakfast place I remember fondly from my childhood, and I'm thrilled every time I go.
author: Austin J. A.

description: Interesting and different food along with lovely ambiance. Not terribly expensive. Everything was great including the service.
author: Reagan D.

description: My first time visiting San Fransisco with my family, Home plate was only like 5 minutes away so we gave it a try!!! Even though we had to wait outside for 20 minutes it was well worth it!! The food was so delicious!! I seriously never had pancakes taste so good!! My family and I where very pleased with the food and service!! The only thing is that it's so small in there!! Other then that everything was perfect!!
author: Diane U.

description: Stumbled up on this small restaurant on Lombard st. Large portions at decent price with Bonus biscuit and jam . Have the most fluffiest buttermilk pancake. We were the only ones in the restaurant but then became crowded quickly.
author: Michael M.

description: Highly recommend. The pink mimosas are delicious but what mimosa isn't right? The dolce de leche pancakes, yaaas!! The location is busy. The restaurant is super small if you have a large party please use patience. The wait is so worth it. The staff is amazingly kind and sweet. Come early!
author: Msi A.

description: Quick place to grab something filling for breakfast. It's a little small inside, so the earlier you get there the better. They have a large variety on their menu.
author: Cody J.

description:
Their HOME PLATE FRITTATA hits a home run.

Firstly, their complimentary HOUSEMADE SCONE is BOMB (http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/home-plate-san-francisco?select=FPyyA7eOppxMnZOoYhU-hg#XZUEaqtDifE7EXH-hqVMnQ). I'm not partial to scones because I find them to be dry, but this scone was very soft and pliant...for a scone. They had raisin scones that day, which is when I discovered that raisins don't tickle my fancy as being the best scone filler. Seems like I prefer soft squishy fruits in my scones. Nevertheless, the housemade mango and berry jams that accompanied the scone were great.

My roommate and I split two dishes. The first was the EGGS FLORENTINE with two poached eggs, spinach, and Hollandaise sauce on an English Muffin, served with a side of 2 potato-carrot pancakes or hash browns, $8.75 (http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/home-plate-san-francisco?select=FPyyA7eOppxMnZOoYhU-hg#TEm9p122fkesEyo34OE2RA). The poached eggs and Hollandaise sauce were good, but the English muffin was too tough, the spinach too bland. The spinach could have used a dose of garlic.

The second was the HOME PLATE FRITTATA, a 3-egg pancake-style omelette with homemade chicken sausage, bacon, mushroom, spinach, green onions, pine nuts, and cheddar cheese, served with 2 potato-carrot pancakes or hash browns, $8.95 (http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/home-plate-san-francisco?select=FPyyA7eOppxMnZOoYhU-hg#FPyyA7eOppxMnZOoYhU-hg). It also comes with wheat, white, rye, or sourdough toast. Who can deny a nice, hearty omelette generously stuffed with yummy things like homemade chicken sausage?

The potato-carrot pancakes come with dollops of applesauce and sour cream, which balance each other out. I enjoyed the pancakes, though my roommate preferred the hash browns.

Gawd, what better way to exacerbate my unintended brunch hiatus than to finish a brunch review :(

[[How to do SF brunch, Adele-style]]
Seek EVERYTHING (notably SOUFFLÉ PANCAKES and SMOKED SALMON TARTINE) at Griddle Fresh
Seek FRENCH TOAST at Park Chow (more affordable) or Zazie's (more unique)
Seek PANCAKES at Park Chow
Seek EGGS BENEDICT at Zazie's
Seek HASH BROWN SANDWICHES at Art's Cafe
Seek FRITTATAS at Home Plate
Seek HUEVOS RANCHEROS at Cafe Reverie
author: Adele F.

description: Favorite breakfast in the neighborhood, simple menu, friendly service, free scone, tasty food
author: Jonathan P.

description:
People talk a lot in their reviews about the free scones they give you with your meal and you know what, people SHOULD. It's these types of small gestures by restaurant owners that should say to all of us, "This is probably a great place, because they're doing nice little things like free scones."

Met some cousins here for brunch on a Saturday morning around 10 and everything was great. The wait was no more than 15 minutes, everyone's food was delicious (my chorizo scramble was so good), the food is not expensive, and you leave very happy and wanting to return. That's all anyone should need to know!
author: David B.

description:
I got an eggs Benedict with bacon and avocado and tomato and i loved it. my friend got a breakfast sandwich (which she is really picky about since she makes pretty awesome ones) She was so happy with it as well.

I tried to scones and I am not much of a scone person but it was a nice touch!

Price- pretty decent and not high for the area and sf in total
Food- delicious and fresh 
carrot potato pancakes- I did not understand the concept and was trying to switch them out for regular pancakes until I was told that it is more like a potato side (i tried them and loved them) I want to learn how to make them!

service- wonderful and flexible!

will be back for sure!
author: Sarah K.

description: First time eating with my daughter in San Fran.  Local on the street recommended Home Plate and it was awesome!  Opened the door and the place was packed...good sign.  Service was outstanding as was the food.  You won't be disappointed.
author: Mark L.

description: Absolutely horrible.  Corned beef hash had no potatoes.  Just big chunks of meat.  Gross.  Pancakes over cooked and nasty.  Eggs not cooked right.  Service sucks.
author: Tula C.

description:
Not usually big on brunch, but this place was decent and I'd def come back to try more on the menu. Quick service, standard breakfast fare that comes a free and delicious scone, fresh homemade juices and smoothies, and good portions for the price.

Ordered a crabcake Benedict and carrot juice, and my friend had the pastrami sandwich which looked tasty too:)
author: Nancy W.

description: This is one of my favorite breakfast place near the Marina! Love the scone! There are tons of menu options to choose from. People are very friendly, too. They could get busy during weekends and lunch time so try to avoid rash hours if you can.
author: Karla S.

description:
The food here was both filling and delicious. Upon finishing my meal I felt a small rustling in my coat and discovered a baseball. I then heard whisperings telling me to build a baseball field in an old farm. 

5/5 would eat here again
author: Cosmo R.

description:
If we are in the area, we go here for breakfast. The staff is very friendly and we have always
found the food to be good. Space is small and popular so there is usually a wait. Its reasonably 
priced and a very good value.
author: Peter F.

description:
This little gem in the city is so small and busy that there is a clipboard to sign in outside of the restaurant.  Pretty a one room cafe with a view of the three cooks no matter where you sit, this place has its own charm. The service was polite efficient and moderately friendly. This was a asian family owned and operated cafe.  The menu had several items that were not the norm and I tried one of them.

Hang Town Fry: a egg frittata with oysters, bacon, spinach and mushrooms served with a blueberry scone, toast and hash browns or potato pancakes.  This dish with a dab of ketchup and hot sauce was the most original breakfast dish I have had recently. The plentiful oysters with the crunch of the bacon and the sweetness of the ketchup was delish!  The blueberry scone looked very small but it was actually quite yummy served with home made mango and strawberry jam. I choose the potato pancakes which were disappointingly small and thin but freaking good, they were served with apple sauce and sour cream.  $9.50

Pancakes with walnuts, bananas and strawberries: big thick fluffy buttermilk goodness.  
The strawberries weren't ripe though.  $7.45

Strong coffee $2

This place is not much to look at but your stomach and pocket book will think your in Disneyland, highly recommended.
author: Douglas Y.

description: This has become a staple any time I find myself in the Marina on an early morning. It's nice and small but the food is excellent. It seems to be family owned and the servers are always extra attentive and polite.
author: Ann S.

description:
Fresh squeezed orange juice, complementary (and deliciously baked) scones with sides of raw honey and some of the best jam I have ever tasted, a HUGE menu , what's not to like! 

On to the best part... The meal! They allowed me to replace bacon with smoked salmon for the bacon, egg and cheese sandwich. Amazing! I had a side of hash browns that were crispy and delicious. The bacon is thick and perfectly cooked, the portions huge, everything about this place is noteworthy. I wish I could come back! But I live in Boston and m just visiting for a few days...
author: Caitlin F.

description:
I think its hilarious its locasted right across from an IHOP.  For those who want to support a mom and pops kinda of diner instead of a chain like IHOP, come here!

Come by 8am, that way parking nearby is free.  Plenty of parking avaiable on a weekday around the corner.  Dont park in front where the meters are marked yellow!

So here's what I had:

HOME-RUN SPECIAL - $8.50
Generic breakfast meal (eggs and sausages) that comes with a waffle.  I mean, the eggs and pork sausages were good and greasy, which is how I like them.  But the waffle wasn't all that special.  I should have gotten the potato carrot cakes.  Dont get this meal if you absolutely love waffles, because it says a lot when I didnt eat all of mine :-\

SCONES - Complimentary
I really appreciate these freshly house-made scones!  Especially beacuase they came with some house made jam, which was strawberry and mango when I went.  It's so fluffy and buttery...I absolutely enjoyed it!  Highlight of the meal!

Service would be rated 10 stars if I could!  Our server would often check on us and was super nice!  I appreciated him a lot!

Although I give this place a 3-star rating, I'd come back.  I love breakfast and still yet to try other items on their menu.  Sure its not as good as IHOP I admit, but I much rather support a local mom and pops kind of place.  It's conveniently located near my work too!
author: Tu-Anh N.

description:
Home Plate.. the name says it all! Overall WOW. As we came to the restaurant, we didn't wait too long for a table of 4. When you sit down, they bring waters and their homemade scones with raisins with sides of butter, strawberry jam, and mango jam. Delicious. I ordered full stack (3) of banana walnut pancakes topped with strawberries, the dish was larger than I expected, but nonetheless, was amazing. My mates ordered different types of omelets with hash browns, which they explained as being phenomenal. The presentation of each plate was beautiful, they set them up with garnishes of avocado or vegetables. As for food, I would say it was really top of the line.

The service was just as great. When we sat down, a waitress came over and got our drink and food orders. We had three waiters/waitresses coming over to our table consistently to make sure we don't need anything else and that our water and coffees were filled. They were very friendly and eager to get us anything we asked for. Loved this place, would highly recommend trying! This is the place for breakfast!
author: Steven P.

description: We went for breakfast about 9am on a Wednesday. We were seated right away by very welcoming staff. We ordered coffee and water and drink. The coffee was perfect. Got a ham and bacon omelette with wheat toast and sweet potato carrot pancakes (more like hashbrowns) that were pretty good. The omelette was huge and very tasty! The staff was very nice with great service. Highly recommended breakfast spot.
author: Tranor V.

description:
Home Plate is a very solid, no frills diner in the Marina. Portion sizes are large, service is extremely friendly and you can choose to linger or be in and out quickly. They tend to get a line on weekend mornings but move things along quickly. 

When you sit down, you automatically receive a scone with butter and two jams served to you. The scone is a good mix of flaky and buttery without being too sweet. It is nicely studded with raisins. The jams are the perfect complement to the scone. I usually got an iced tea, and unlike many other places, they are very good about refills. I don't like extra frills or additions in terms of flavor added to my tea, and there's is straight-up blacked iced tea served with a lemon. 

I got their veggie omelet pretty much every time we went. I asked for cheese on the side, as they don't skimp on anything there, and it was filling enough without being too cheesy. The omelet comes loaded with a mix of veggies. My one complaint is it can be a bit oily as well. My husband always got the Greek frittata with the carrot latke-type pancakes. He was always extremely satisfied and ready for a nap after!

For a convenient, low-key and filling breakfast, this is the ideal spot!
author: Jackie W.

description: After a few days of beating my wallet to death, I was in the mood for some basic breakfast fare. Yelp pulling through once again, brought us to Home Plate. I had a crab omelet that was fantastic, a tad bit under seasoned, but nothing I couldn't fix with a salt shaker. This was a perfect spot to sit back and relax after all the walking we had been doing. The coffee was fantastic and the chalkboard on the wall with the specials and some of the menu was a nice touch to look at and help you select what you wanted. Whoever they hire for their chalk art does a fantastic job. Need some classic breakfast with a few seafood options? this is your place.
author: Nick B.

description:
Went to Home Plate this past weekend, after relying on YELP reviews. Below is what I read and what I experienced -

 1. READ: The line moves fast, and you get served home made scones while in line.
     EXPERIENCED: It took over 45 minutes to get seated. No scones were offered.
 2. READ: Generous portions, amazing omelettes and poached eggs, delicious pancakes.
     EXPERIENCED: Portions were average. The all meat omelette had meat chunks that looked and tasted horrible. The All-veggie omelette had ZERO flavor. The 2 poached eggs were cooked in boiling water, served in a cup, and looked/tasted rather unappetizing. And finally the pancakes were raw inside, cooked a second time, yet tasted like hell.

Please guys, if you are giving a YELP review, be HONEST, not NICE or POLITE. Other people rely on your reviews, so make it honest and real. Our review is based not on any animosity or anything personal. The managers treated us well, so no problems there. Its just that the food was really, really bad. And I am usually the least picky of eaters, and very rarely complain. Never going back, and suggest that Home Plate needs to seriously improve their food standards.
author: Raj D.

description:
The scone was pretty good, but everything else was the reason I typically don't like diners.  

To tell the truth, I don't fully remember my visit to this restaurant, but Yelp keeps nagging me to write a review.  Then, when I started writing one and realized I couldn't remember much, it kept nagging me to "finish my review".  So here you have it... a pitiful review that is a testament to my terrible memory.
author: Jamaica Y.

description: Food was excellent we recommend it to anybody and service was excellent a lot of options on the menu to choose from
author: Brian M.

description:
This place is amazing! I came her with my boyfriend twice during one weekend we spent in SF visiting. Both times we came in were equally amazing. We were seating quickly and both times we went, it wasn't busy at all. While we waited for  food after ordering, we were given complimentary scones with 2 different types of jelly. They were delicious! I ordered the buttermilk pancakes w/ strawberries the first day and then a waffle the next day. Both plates were amazing and cooked to perfection. On both occasions my boyfriend ordered the Pacifica Omelette. It came with spinach, shrimp, and mushrooms, and he said it was the best omelette he had ever tasted. I personally don't like eggs or omelettes at all, but I even thought it was amazing after trying a bite off his plate. 

I can definitely see this becoming a regular place for us to come and eat on our future visits to San Francisco.
author: Marley K.

description:
average is the word, but I'd give this place 3.5 stars if I could. The food served here isn't awesome by any means. If you are looking for delectable food, you are in SF, you can definitely do better. Service was poor. I think you waiters and waitresses all forgot our order until we asked the first time to check up on it. Still, after checking the dishes took 10-15 minutes longer to come. oy vey.

the Redemptions:
(+) free scones with all breakfast. I love free, so this was pretty bomb diggity. when they say scone, they mean sweet biscuit, but details. served with butter and 2 jams (berry and apple). nothing too fantastic though, don't come here expecting love joy's.
(+) atmosphere.
this is what's really driving the 3.5 stars. as crappy as the service was and as mediocre as the food is, the restaurant is brightly lit and airy, I'd definitely like to spend some more Saturday/ Sunday mornings here.
(+) menu.
Home Plate offers up some creative breakfast options, even if the most remarkable ones are just fancy filled pancakes. refreshing!
(+) coffee.
how hard is it to get a brunch spot in sf to serve a decent cup of joe? pretty hard. home plate does well. 4 stars.

the Please Don't's:
(+) buckwheat pancakes.
tastes like cardboard. I got mine with bananas on top. still tasted like cardboard. No sauce comes with it. You can douse it in "maple syrup" all you won't but it'll still somehow taste like syrup on cardboard. disappointing fact of life. I ate the bananas, left the pancakes. at least the bananas were fresh!
author: Patricia K.

description:
We came for Saturday brunch, there was a 10 minute wait which wasn't bad. The place was small and we had to share a table with another couple. If i wanted to fully extend my arms to the right i couldn't. It wasn't uncomfortable but we could hear everything they were saying and we learned quite a bit about them. For example, their friends, an engagement, todds new gf, and a friend whom they considered a crackhead. Sandy said she enjoyed her meal, and then she looked over at mine and asked me what I was having.  
     
     I started off with the strawberry supreme smoothie. It had fresh strawberries, orange juice and honey. No ice, warm smoothie and was really tasty I wanted another. I ordered the Spanish scramble and had no complaints. My partner ordered the home run special. French toast, eggs, raw hash browns that he ate around - he said it was "cool". The gave us complimentary scones with a couple jams to dip them in. The strawberry jam was delicious. I regret not asking for a jar before leaving. 
     For a place called home run we expected baseball decor. Overall, 4/5 would come back again.
author: Amri Z.

description: This is one of my favorite brunch/breakfast places in San Francisco---Great service and food. You may have to wait a bit since it's popular, but it worth the wait. Salmon Benedict and OJ(best in SF) is simply a perfect way to start the day
author: Ethan A.

description: The food here did not disappoint and the service was excellent. We had the pancakes, but ever dish that passed by our table looked very well prepared. Great place to try if you are looking for a quick and tasty breakfast.
author: Tyler A.

description: A little hole in the wall family owned breakfast joint.  Super friendly staff and prompt service.  Food was absolutely amazing!  Their house made jam was amazing on the scones they gave.  Had an omelette and pancakes, which I highly recommend.  Will def be coming back here next time I'm in town!
author: Kyle P.

description:
Don't get me wrong. The food was excellent. My date and I shared French toast and eggs benedict. Yummy yummy yummy. 

However, when my girlfriend sat next to me on the same side, the busser, a workout machine with deep bags under his eyes and a strange look came over and said, "you cannot sit next to each other like this - this is a community table - someone else might sit here." Two couples, unknowing each other, sitting next to each other, when there were at least 5 other tables open... The  restaurant at this time, about 11 AM, was not all that busy. In fact, there was a table next to us, a "community table", that remained vacant the entire time we were there. And at another community table down the way, two girls were sitting next to each other. I said, "I understand, but the restaurant is not busy. It seems like it should be OK." But he was insistent and waited there looking strung out saying no you need to move. 

Buzz. Kill. I felt singled out and the gentleman and his wife sitting next to me looked at me after he said this and told me "that's messed up."

After that, the busser who had nothing else to do, kept giving us a very blank stare from the back of the kitchen. I felt very uncomfortable and wanted to leave on principle. But we were both too hungry to leave. The rest of the staff was very nice and awkwardly moved all her silverware back and repositioned the things on the table. I understand community seating and restaurants can have rules but this kind of interruption, especially so sourly put, gave me a bad taste in my mouth. 

To the restaurant, if you're reading this, just know that if the restaurant were to get busy, I'm pretty sure we would have no hesitation moving to accommodate more people. But it's paramount to make guess feel like guests. I hope you can fix this because your food is delicious.
author: Brian H.

description: I've died and gone to Eggs Benedict Heaven! A must for brunch when you're in San Francisco. It's small so sometimes there's a wait to get in but it's well worth it. Don't go to IHOP. Hop across the street to the Readers Pick for best weekend brunch in SF!!!
author: Mari E.

description:
Home plate has amazing food. The building itself is small, per traditional San Francisco. Get there early or get ready to put your name on the list. The staff is super nice and very busy. 
Definitely worth the wait!
author: Katie F.

description: Love the crab omelet and the most delicious breakfast in town. Very baby friendly!
author: Lindsey D.

description:
This place was delicious! The wait wasn't too long we arrived around 11, the wait was about 15 minutes, but it was Easter Sunday.  We ordered the Corned beef hash Benedict and the Pacifica Omelet. The Benedict was a special of the day but the Pacifica Omelet was on the regular menu.  We both loved our food, the corned beef hash benedict was so moist and soft, the beef melted in my mouth.  I didn't get to taste the Pacifica Omelet but I was told it was delicious.  

The employees were very friendly and attentive, always came by to fill our water! Which is something we really like.
author: Kristin I.

description: It's a small venue but the food is great and the service is fast and courteous. We got the California scramble- which was delicious and the eggs Benedict - also delicious. My daughter got the pancakes with strawberries and whipped cream. They were big and fluffy and fresh! Found this to be a perfect spot for a Sunday brunch that didn't take 3 hours long.
author: Kim B.

description:
Good option for having breakfast/ brunch! Liked it!  
Delicious food (we had omelette with shrimps/ scrambled eggs with shrimps), very reasonable prices (as for San Francisco). 
Place is rather small (up to 10 tables, most of them just for 2 people), so be ready to stand the line (especially on the weekend) - but it worth it!
author: Nata M.

description:
Amazing, inventive food at a reasonable price served by hunky staff.

There is almost always a wait, but it's so worth it.
author: Heather C.

description: Home Plate is easily my fav for brunch. You know. They quite get all things right but I'm still giving them 3 stars because of service. But it's a foodie's delight. Wonderful taste for my tacos and their Crab-Cake Benedict is a classic.
author: Jude M.

description: Lets just start off with saying that their strawberry and mango jam that is HOMEMADE is super delicious with their scones - so that's a must-order when coming. The service is super quick and attentive. The lady serving us was very gentle and friendly. I had the Marco Polo - which is eggs benedict with carrot and some sort of batter to create their healthy hashbrown-like pancakes. I wish I liked waking up early to try breakfast places, but I'm glad I got a chance to check out Home Plate. Parking wasn't too bad on a weekday too! The eggs were poached perfectly with the right amount of avocado because I love me my avocado! Eveyrthing was deliciuos and i do want to return one day :)
author: Amanda C.

description:
The lowdown without the fluff:

1. Complimentary scone.
GOOD. Comes out warm with sides of butter and 2 different kinds of jam (ketchup and mustard looking).

2. Typical breakfast. 
I had the almond french toast - which is french toast...with almonds. This was on their "specials" menu, but nothing spectacular or memorable in my book. Get this if you want carbs without protein (no sides come with this "special"). Other menu items consist of the usual eggs, bacon, sausage, pancake/waffle. Although they do serve eggs benedict which is impressive. 

3. Small
Super tiny claustrophobic breakfast restaurant which means wait time can be long on weekends or peak hours. 

They're located on the north side of Lombard. Good luck with parking. The service is ok. They were on top with water refills though so that's a plus. Other than that, no home run for Home Plate.
author: Steven N.

description:
Cool breakfast spot with free scones :)

Had breakfast here on a Sunday and there was a wait but they try to move people in and out as fast as they can. 

I got a frittata from the many options on the menu. The plate came with potato carrot pancakes. 

The scone was good and the potato carrot pancakes were solid. I love how they served them with sour cream, reminded me of a very similar dish my grandparents made.

The frittata was whatever.
author: Tim R.

description:
I had the Breakfast Starter with scrambled eggs, 2 potato-carrot pancakes, sourdough toast, and a chicken apple sausage; it was delicious! The sausage is sweet which is why I loved it. They also brought out a scone with strawberry and mango jam before the meal, and that was a nice little start. 

The prices here are relatively affordable, and the service and food here is great. I recommend eating here if you're looking for a nice little local breakfast place.
author: Bianca G.

description:
No idea why this is highly rated.  Perhaps the good reviews are only from tourists who stay at the nearby travel lodge or motels.

Seated quickly, however it took them 5 minutes to bring menus.  Got their complimentary infamous scones, which were hot, fresh, and delicious.

Bf received his entree--spicy shrimp Benedict.  There are 2 tiny shrimp almost the size of bay shrimp on each English muffin slice.  They were not spicy although the 2 thin slices of jalapeño are nice.  Flavor is lacking in the hollandiase sauce.  Do not order.

15 minutes later, they still haven't given me my dish, so I flag a waitress down (literally) and ask if my order had even been put in yet.  She said yes, just a few minutes.  I persist and inform her that my bf has had his food for 15min and I still don't have mine--I also ask for another scone while I wait, and she says it's $1.50.  5 min later after she checks with the kitchen she says my order was skipped.  The almond French toast arrives and the only thing that makes it almond are the almond slices on top.  Otherwise it's bland and needs to be covered in syrup.

Waitress gave 10% off, which is the only reason she received a tip.  Will NOT be returning.
author: Vanessa O.

description: Great brunch spot. Food was good, coffee was good, service was good, you know, I can't complain, really. Wish the place was a little bigger, and the wait was less, but they can't help that. I'm a fan.
author: Jason D.

description:
Not sure why this place doesn't have 5 stars...
Home Plate is exactly what you want from a weekend breakfast plus awesome homemade scone + jam while you wait for your breakfast! It's really well-priced in an area where nothing else is (Marina/Lombard), the staff is super friendly, and the wait is really reasonable.
author: Kerry G.

description:
I wish Home Plate was closer by me so I can come more often!!! I was here over the weekend for my second time. It looked like there was a semi large crowd gathered outside but we actually got seated super fast.. in about 10-15 min! That's rare for a brunch spot in SF these days! 

I'm sad that I had to pass up one the free scones cause those are the freaking devil! They made me a custom order - Garden frittata w/ roasted chicken! BOMB. I substituted the potatoes for fresh fruit.. only because I have a bridesmaid dress to get into this weekend! The BF got the Home Plate Frittata w/ their famous carrot potato pancakes! Of course I had to get torn into that & omggg... that apple sauce though!! 

From what I remember last time, their dulce de leche pancakes were orgasmic too! Everything here is orgasmic lol! The service is great, price was good, and the food was to die for. I am coming back asappp!
author: Michelle L.

description: Nice little spot, cozy in nature. The food was delicious and the service was great. I recommend this place if you like breakfast food and you're visiting SF. Then walk on over to the palace of fine art.
author: Victor S.

description:
There were many reasons why I chose to try Home Plate as my destination for brunch today. What sealed the deal for me knowing that it was the right choice was getting surprised with a delicious, warm scone with brilliant sauce before my order was swiftly delivered. 
With it being a noisy street and there being so many breakfast joins in the neighborhood, the competition is probably tough. I hope this place sticks around!
author: Jessica Y.

description:
This is a nice and cozy breakfast spot in the heart of San Francisco's Marina District. Our hotel was just a block away and decided to have our last meal here before heading back to Los Angeles. I've read great things and wanted to give it a try. Luckily, we were seated very promptly upon arrival, as we arrived around 8:30 on the day after 4th of July.
The complimentary scones with the fruit sauces were amazing. I got the smoked salmon Benedict, which was very delicious and quite filling. We also shared a buttermilk waffle, which was also delicious. The servers were great and checked up on us often to refill our coffee and get us everything we needed. I highly recommend this place for a simple yet satisfying breakfast if you're in the area.
author: Alp T.

description: Great place to have brunch. We waited for about 40 minutes because it's a smaller establishment but it was worth it. I had the Denver Omelette which was pretty solid. They provide a tasty biscuit which was quite flavorful with the two jams they provided. And the iced coffee served in a tall, skinny glass was pretty cool.
author: Juan T. K.

description:
Just revisited this Gem of a brunch spot after a few months of traveling...they remodeled!  The dinning area got a total face lift, easier flow & nice little counter-esq area when you first walk in & to cater to those of us who aren't afraid to go solo for those potato pancakes & chicken sausage patties! :) 

Same great menu, so thankful that didn't change!!!
author: Honey F.

description: Four reasons to love Home Plate following: complementary mini scone with jam ( rare and super appetizer for main breakfast dish) , build your own omelet  on the menu ( create what your crave for)  , fruit cup with impressive assortments of fruits ( not usual apples and banana) and buttermilk pancake (not too sweet or burned). Add to these prompt coffee refill and attentive service and we get a home run!
author: Ally M.

description:
A nice little place with solid food quality.  They had several very good looking specials, but many of the key menu staples are not Gluten-free, so two of our party couldn't have them.  The complimentary sconces were very cool (but not edible to half our party), but the homemade jam was the best.  

The food was fresh, service quick and the price as advertised.
author: Phil J.

description: Excellent service, great food, plenty of choices. We had the Garden omelette. The only thing that would make it better would be to have more spinach. However, this is just personal preference.
author: Elisa S.

description:
Great little place, yummy coffee, and fresh homemade scones! Breakfast was yummy too!

Glad we found it, we will be back!
author: Kevin H.

description: Omg love this place best egg Florentine ever had and the potato latkes out of this world . Definitely will be back to this place when stopping by SF! Great food n service awesome scones too
author: Eunice N.

description: Excellent breakfast! We tried the scones, Bangkok frittata, Crab Cake Benedict, California scramble, BBC pancake.  All were excellent!
author: Kerrie S.

description: Cute little family's own great and unique menu design, big portion, great price excellent service... Will come back again...
author: Ng K.

description: Our food came out very quickly and they even gave us freshly made scones with homemade jam as we waited. Not only was the food unique and delicious, but I definitely appreciated the nicely decorated, insta-worthy atmosphere. Eating here reminded me of the brunch places in New York City--but half the price! I will definitely be coming back with more friends to try more items on the menu. Thank you for the lovely experience!
author: Amanda L.

description: Excellent brunch - it's a hidden jewel across the street from of all places IHOP LOL! The fresh baked scones that come with your meal is to die for. I ordered today's special the Bangkok Frittata. Who would've thought the combination of lime with jalapeños in eggs would produce such deliciousness! Husband ordered the New York Scramble and the fresh avocado with the lox delightful. Sister ordered the Corn Beef Benedict and eggs made perfectly with real cornbread. The thin sliced potato carrot pancakes again Cute deliciousness! The maple bacon with red chili pepper need I even say more!!! The expediter was in our sight line and she put so much love and paid such attention to detail in every plate that went out to the customers - tasted it in our food too! It's experiences like this that validate why we love living in this city so much!
