author: June R.

description:
I could have sworn that I have reviewed this place before - but Yelp says no - so here goes.

Today was Thanksgiving  2014- we couldn't figure out any place that was open today - I was pretty sure Peter D's would be (on Broadway and Van Ness- oh and their blubbery pancakes are fantastic) , but though that MAYBE Backwood on Chestnut would be open, so we hedged our bets by driving by Blackwood first...nope - not open. 

On out way to Peter D's we passed Home Plate and saw the line - BINGO, at least we know they are open, and we had been here many years ago. I always remember the free scone.

We waited about 15- 20 mins, then got a table. I ordered the eggs benedict (you have a choice of turkey or ham, I chose ham - duh.)  I also ordered a $5.00 side of thick cut bacon with spice and maple syrup (not nearly as good as Millionaire's bacon from Blackwood & Sweep Maple, but pretty darn good - Hey it's B-A-C-O-N after all)

My BF ordered the pesto omelet with potato pancakes (not nearly enough pesto in the omelet BTY). 

The eggs on my bene were cooked to perfection, super loose yolk, and not a hint of snotty egg white. The ham on first appearance looked crappy - But was surprisingly delicious.

This place is solid on Brunch. Those scones are good, my only complaint was that the butter with the scone was served cold, and I wish they gave you more jelly with the scones.
author: Amy W.

description:
Started coming here over 20 years ago... 

I believe the awesome breakfast place with everything homemade is Chinese owned; at least I do spy an industrious chinese man at the omelette pan every time I come. 

It is all details with fresh and home-cooked everything here. Breakfasts run on the higher side of pricing, but the portions here.... wow.

I love the pancakes, omelettes, benedicts, anything with ham, potatoes, etc.

But the crack here (seriously) are always the homemade scones.
author: Jana C.

description: Came here for brunch with a 7 top. Service was fantastic! Everyone enjoyed their meal, but I think I scored the best dish. I ordered the Angry Benedict. I've been trying to raise my spicy bar little by little lately. So,  I added Cholula to it and it hit the spot. I'm was so happy to find something else other than my fav...Hang Town Fry. My son loved his happy face pancake so much, he ate it without any assistance. Do not forget the scones!
author: Evelyn K.

description: I LOVE this hidden treasure inside the Marina District of San Francisco. The lines are usually very long so you will have to hurry early at the door. It closes early too...about 1pm. They make fresh crescents, apple chicken sausages and jams. LOVE! LOVE! LOVE THIS PLACE! (I think I will make an order to go, right now.)
author: Tien L.

description:
Perfect breakfast spot - tiny but friendly and delish;-)
Three of us went for a jog and ended at Ft Mason park - Yelp directed us here where it exceeded our expectations. We ended up sharing a table family style with another couple and chatted sports;-)
They give you a tasty little scone while you wait and the coffee and decaf was good and hot. We had two frittatas and an omelet and all got the potato carrot pancakes - which are essentially a tasty latke. Definitely get frittatas ... And all around everything was great. Highly recommended ...
author: Kirsten N.

description: They give a lot of food here! Come hungry. The food was really good too. They give complimentary scones before your meal that were delicious. I chose four stars because while the service was pleasant, it took a while to get our order taken and refills on water. Overall, I wouldn't mind going again if I'm not in a hurry.
author: Josh C.

description: Great breakfast place that is about 2.5 miles from the GG bridge. The place is very cozy. They have about 8 tables that seat 2-4 people. The pancakes here are fluffier than your average pancake. HIGHLY RECOMMEND. To start off, they gave our table of 4 free scones while we waited for our breakfast orders. I wanted to get their cornbeef hash eggs Benedict, but they were cooking a new batch at the moment and it would be four hours until they would have more so I was recommended their "angry benedict" which had a more flavorful spicy hollandaise sauce w/shrimp. This angry benedict was better than any eggs benedict I've had before.
author: Jake S.

description: YUM! Great food and service. Started with an original mimosa and it was just fine. As a vegetarian I had no problems purchasing food from this menu. I got the eggs florentine and it was fantastic. The eggs were beautiful. (The French toast my friend got was good too!) they also served us complimentary scones with mango and strawberry purée... Nice touch. I will be back!!
author: Brooke F.

description: I didn't try the breakfast which every review and picture is based on. I ordered from Grub Hub, I was craving a club sandwich and I ordered the strawberry smoothie, with oj and honey, it was warm and I chilled it in the fridge at the temperature I desired. My fries were cold, unsalted, club sandwich had to much mayo it was drenched and inedible, well the hair I found in the sandwich also made it inedible.
author: Sarah T.

description: Dulce de leche pancakes! .... Fire fam! ... Pretty sure I came. Complimentary scones were fresh and delectable. Great service.
author: Juan F.

description: Love this place. Discovered this spot a year ago and loved it. The chorizo n egg is my fav. A must whenever we come visit SF...
author: Jesus A.

description:
Really nice brunch here! We were in a group of 6 and showed up around 9am on a Saturday. It was about a 15 min wait (there is a list on a clipboard at the door). 

So nice that the homemade scones come out right away. I was really hungry and it was nice to have something to munch on while we waited. The mango and strawberry jams are also homemade and both were excellent.

I got the carrot/celery juice which tasted fresh and the garden omelette (egg whites only) and the carrot/potato latkes. The latkes were really delicious--try them if you can! The food came out quickly and the service was polite. 

I like that the space has a traditional diner feel to it. It's not very big so I wouldn't recommend for a huge group.
author: Semuteh F.

description: We always find time to enjoy this breakfast haven. Home plate is full of home runs!!!-JSA
author: John A.

description:
We stopped here for breakfast and didn't regret it. With every breakfast entree you get a scone, and that alone would have made this stop great. It was warm and delicious, with a duo of jams served along side. From the menu we ordered the special scramble which was homemade chicken sausage scrambled with eggs, mushrooms, cheese, tomatoes, etc. The herbs in it gave it a greenish look and an elegant and aromatic flavor. 

I opted for the potato-carrot pancakes as a side and they were light and crispy and not too heavy, which I had been fearing. My husband got the French toast and it had excellent flavor and texture. His eggs over easy were cooked perfectly. 

They have an extensive brunch menu, and this wound be a great place to meet up with someone  The atmosphere is casual and the wait staff friendly. Yum!
author: Megan C.

description: So refreshing to find a reasonably-priced, non-ridiculously trendy brunch place in the Marina- and that is what makes Home Plate truly a gem. The free scones (as everyone has noted) were a great touch as well - and I found myself walking out completely full having only spent $8. Only complaints were the hash browns were a little bland, and there's no A//C or fans at all so we were HOT eating in the stuffy restaurant... I heard a few people around us commenting on the temperature as well. Then again, we came on one of the few days a year SF reaches above 80, so I'm sure it's not usually a problem. Will definitely be coming back!!
author: Catherine S.

description:
This place is great!!! Large variety for everyone's favorite choices. Well cooked (and we are PICKY when it comes to our eggs!) 
The seating is a little tight but not uncomfortable. It helps the the Devore was cute. Chalk board wall with the menus. But don't worry, you still get a regular menu as well. Wire frame light fixture with Edison bulbs. 
Staff is on it. I love service with a smile. 
My husband ordered the #1 which was eggs, hash browns and toast. Cooked perfect which again we are very picky about our eggs. 
I ordered the French Toast (I know not original, but my favorite). Again, cooked well, not a soggy piece!
Before the meal came, there was complimentary home made biscuits and jam. Very good especially when unexpected. 
All this for under $20 for 2 inSF!!!!!
Highly recommend stopping by and trying this place!
author: Dawn W.

description:
We stopped here for breakfast before a morning meeting. Gotta love a little nook like this on a busy street. 

Good food, clean place and nice people. 

Eggs were fluffy and plates were generous but not super-sized. 

Price was great too. I'd stop in here anything I need a quick tasty bit of breakfast!
author: cailyn m.

description: We were traveling through early on a Sunday morning looking for a local place open for breakfast at 7 am.  We found Home Plate with the ratings and menu choices.  We were the third party seated as soon as they opened at 7.  ALL three parties entered at the same time.  Well, parties 1 and 2 were handed menus, drink orders taken and served and the special scone served to them before our waiter rather threw the menus at our table.  We should have left at that point, but we both were hungry-lesson learned.  Fortunately we had reviewed the menu online before so we both knew what we wanted.  We ordered, one item was not available, okay that happens.  Ordered - beverages were delivered, no scones, food came out relatively quickly, still no scones.  So husband ordered a custom scramble - first observation - brown on the eggs.  Carrot and potato pancakes were okay - not crisp, rather mushy.  The shrimp in the scramble were cooked appropriately and had good flavor.  Still no scones.  The French toast description was far superior than the actual fruition.  Eh, it filled a belly.  The Home Plate special bacon was a waste.  Over cooked and actually charred on one side with maple syrup pour over it and chili flakes sprinkled on.  Again, still no scones.  You would think on Fathers Day you would be on top of your game.  Eh, lesson learned - go across the street to the IHOP for more consistent quality. Oh, and still no scones - even when repeatedly asked.
author: John Q. P.

description:
Great local breakfast. They literally have EVERYTHING you can imagine to eat for breakfast and usually the wait is not that long. They give you GREAT scones before your food gets in and the service is always very quick.

Don't waste your time across the street at Ihop- it is worth the wait to eat here!
author: Cristina R.

description: It was our first time coming to Home Plate. We came early in the morning, due to our early arrival in the city.
author: Bina Y.

description: Great food.. hot staff! Bangkok Frittata best thing on menu ... usually on the Special menu AND come see the hottest waiter in the Marina ...
author: Edmind A.

description: Good service. Very filling portions. Good food. Tiny spot so seating is hit or miss.  Friendly staff.  Always consistent
author: FreeDumb G.

description: We ate here on a Friday morning.  My husband had California Scramble and I had Eggs Benedict both very yummy!!! Busy, busy here! Cute little place.
author: Maryann N.

description: Wonderful friendly service, attentive and great food!!! Came on Sunday morning around 10:30 and didn't have to wait although it was busy! Would recommend to families, couples, take out, etc
author: Lindsay F.

description:
Let me start off by saying.. I LOVE BRUNCH. I can eat it all day if calories were nonexistent.  

I decided to bus out here with my friend so we wouldn't have to deal with parking. It was a little out of our way since we usually have brunch closer by the Sunset. Riding the 28 through GG Bridge during primetime tourist season was chaotic, but needless to say, it was worth it. 

The place is cozy so I'm not surprised about the wait. They give you complimentary scones with homemade jam (mango and strawberry) which were still warm. I ordered the roasted chicken omelette. You get to choose between hash browns or potato-carrot pancakes (with sour cream and apple sauce), and I got the latter because I've never tried them. They turned out smaller than I expected which only made me want more. We also split an order of almond french toast, which is a must try! It was moist and fluffy and must've been sent from heaven. 

The portions were huge and I wanted to finish my food but I couldn't -- first world problems much? This place is family-owned and our waitress chitchatted with us a bit, which both are pluses in my book. I had to wheel barrel my stomach out and walk it off at the pier. Anyways, the price was right, the food was scrumptious so I definitely want to come again!
author: Ashley L.

description:
Our little neighborhood brunch place.

Family run, super nice people, homemade biscuits, authentic food.
We come there pretty often.
author: Lionel F.

description: Typical diner and mediocre breakfast. I enjoyed the hot scones they serve before your meal. Omelet was standard. Found a small hair on my plate.
author: Melissa G.

description: Absolutely fantastic... Went here on a recommendation from a friend. Hole in the wall, but well worth it! Fast service. Food was excellent. I loved the Carrot Potato pancakes!
author: Shannon S.

description: This place came recommended on yelp so while I was in San Francisco my mother and I stopped here for breakfast. The food was awesome the service was great the price was reasonable. I would definitely recommend this place in San Francisco.
author: Natalie W.

description: I'm going to go ahead and give this place a 5-star review, for the food being very tasty, good portion sizes, and very reasonable prices, especially in the heart of the Marina with all the tourists.  A lot of their dishes are less than $10, which is excellent for a SF brunch place.  I like the little scone they give out with the breakfast entrees.  That little "freebie" really adds a nice touch/feeling to this place.  The service is very friendly.  I ordered the grilled shrimp breakfast plate, and I believe it was right around $10, which is amazing for a seafood plate in SF.  This is my favorite, go-to brunch place in SF.  I've never been on a weekend, so not sure how long the wait is.  But on a Tuesday morning around 10AM, I was able to walk in and get seated right away.  Their prices can't be beat for the quality of food!
author: Jennifer W.

description: Enjoyed a fast and yummy Sunday brunch on 7/12. We walked in and were able to be seated right away. Ordered the 500ml mimosa which was refreshing and just the perfect amount to keep us happy but not toasted. The complimentary scones served with mango and strawberry jam were fluffy and warm. The dulce de leche pancakes were so rich and almost too dense but I somehow finished them so they must have been good. The patty melt was melty and savory and just downright tasty. We weren't a fan of the chicken hash - preferring our hash with less chunky and smaller diced potatoes didn't quite understand the addition of cashews. Overall a great value for a tasty neighborhood brunch!
author: NJ A.

description:
We were staying right around the corner so parking was not a problem what-so-ever-thank-goodness.

The four of us arrived at prime brunch time - 10:30am.  There were a handful of parties including a larger one of 6+.  However, they left to check on another restaurant and we were seated soon after.

First of all, complimentary scone for each person.  Yum!  Fresh, warm, and yum!  It is a little bit dough-y but besides that the scone was fantastic.  We eagerly chomped that down and waited for our entrees to arrive.

I ordered the smoked salmon benedict ($9.75).  Not only were all of their benedicts pretty cheap, but the one I had was great too!  It was flavorful and not too salty.  I cannot imagine a better-tasting salmon benedict for that price.  The dish came with two potato pancakes (shredded potato and carrot, flattened out into a pancake) which was a great alternative to the hashbrowns.  Not amazing but crunchy and surprisingly not oily.

What a great way to start off a Sunday morning!
author: Patricia C.

description:
Breakfast diner with a baseball theme not far from Crissy Field and Presidio.  We were able to get a table with no wait on a Saturday at 8:30 am.

Enjoyed the chorizo omelette, though it was a bit spicy for my taste (and I generally like hot). The carrot potato pancake is unique and worth a try.  Overall a decent diner worth a stop if the wait is not too long.
author: Brad B.

description:
Simply amazing. 

The service was stellar, and I mean stellar. I have high expectations and they were met. My water glass was always full (I drink a TON of water) and I felt attended to but not stalked. Extremely friendly. 

The food was tasty. A good price for how much I got. 

Relaxed atmosphere. The room probably seats 30 people. Calm and cool. 

Curious combination of modern and old school baseball decor. Definitely feels like a brunch place. 

I would and will definitely come here again! I'd recommend this place for sure. Check it out! Now!
author: A C.

description:
3 and a half stars.

I have eaten here on multiple occasions and have found the food inconsistent, but generally good. My favorites are the homemade scones and the mini potato pancakes that are included with every order.
  
On this occasion however, it was kind of super surprising to me as I poked my fork through the hollandaise that they would serve an eggs benedict with a broken yolk. This almost seems sacrilegious to me, and unfortunately this benedict ended up tasting closer to something like a wet egg mcmuffin. I wish the waitress had asked me how my meal was so I could have mentioned it to her but she never did, even though there were only 2 other tables in the restaurant at 7:30am.
author: Mark Y.

description:
Normally I like this place, but today I was a bit disappointed. 

The only seat available was shoulder to shoulder with another table. However there was a larger table available, in which I requested to be seated. The server disallowed me the option of sitting at the requested table even though there was no waiting patrons at the time. What added insult to injury, was the observation of another patron seated at the same type of oversized table, that I requested.

If I pay the same, I should be treated the same. Not happy.
author: Senario J.

description: Lovely breakfast. Small facility but they put the food out to you quickly.  Expect to wait but worth it.  Delicious scone served first.  Frittata was one of the best I've ever had.  Hubby had the New York scramble and loved it too.  Friends had two different Benedict and said they enjoyed them too
author: Paula B.

description: Good neighborhood diner with many choices.  We had the French Toast and Corned Beef Hash, all excellent.  Service was great.  Will definitely be back when we're in town!!
author: Sherrie H.

description:
This place was so tasty that I didn't bother going anywhere else for breakfast during my weekend getaway in SF. I ate here two days in a row.

- Complimentary scone: Warm, moist, fluffy, delicious. Tasted fresh and came with two yummy jams, strawberry and mango (?) I believe. I preferred the strawberry but both were great. 

- Orange Juice: Oh so freshly squeezed! Best OJ I've had as of now. 

- New York Scramble: topped with salmon, avocado, sour cream, and more, this dish was a winner. I also had a side of hash browns and sourdough toast - standard but delicious. 

- Potato Carrot Pancakes: They taste better than they sound. Would recommend giving them a try.

- Grapefruit Juice: I tried this one the second time around after being very very impressed by the orange juice. This one was perfect as well - especially if you're a fan of grapefruit. Tangy yet sweet in all the right spots. 

- Triple Play French Toast: I enjoyed trying the 3 different types of bread. French toast was fluffy as well, and I had mine topped with strawberries. Fruit tasted very fresh. 

- Buttermilk Pancakes: These are stacked as f***. They're thick and filling, a little on the heavy side. I'm not a huge pancake fan so this was just okay. This was the only food item of mine that I couldn't quite finish. 

- I also sampled a bite of the bae's Steak & Eggs and I must add that the steak was very tasty.

- Service: Excellent. Waiters were attentive and brought us everything we needed without hesitation. 

- Atmosphere: The restaurant is small and a little bit dim, but by the end of my breakfast, those are the least of my worries. 

I'm not from SF, but I would come back for this place if I could. My mouth waters thinking about the food. *___*
author: Michelle L.

description:
This place is really amazing. The pancakes they serve with the meals are great, they give you free scones with your meal and their menu is really innovative with lots of specials. This place is everything you could hope for in a brunch place in the city. 

It is actually a bit mind blowing that there are so many places with lines out the door for brunch and we were able to be seated with no difficulty at such a great place. Well done all around.
author: Clayton V.

description: Get the crabmelt and add bacon.... wow. A good hole in the wall breakfast / brunch spot.
author: Ruben L.

description: Great cost benefit balance. A famous breakfast place for locals. Order the dulce de letche panckakes, you won't regret.
author: Hugo M.

description:
Kim and I borrow a car and head to San Francisco. We find a spot around Home Plate, add our name to the list, and wait outside in the early California sun.

Inside, it's a modest space - more cafe than diner - and I get to face the kitchen - which is always my favorite view.

"How often do you get to watch a kitchen full of Asians make breakfast?" I ask Kim. "Is that racist?"
"Probably," she says.

It's a flurry of activity back there, with folks poaching eggs, frying up sausages, baking scones, making omelettes, coffees, juices, Mimosas. The servers dashing about, topping off coffees, cleaning-up plates. Everything about this place is friendly and attentive and apparently it's paying off.

I know I'm in San Francisco when I'm finally dragging one of Home Plate's perfect little scones through their homemade jams. Sweet and delicious. Drinking some ice-coffee, waiting on Eggs Benedict and hash-browns. Life is good.

They got soy milk, so Kim is happy and chomping away at a plate of over-easy eggs, homemade sausages and fried polenta. On a good day, that polenta will blow your socks off.

There's plenty to choose from.Don't ask me because once I find something I like I usually stick to it. One of these days I'll branch out and try their potato carrot pancakes with sour cream.

Home Plate is definitely an institution at this point, and the perfect way to start a day of hilly San Francisco walking.
author: Eric C.

description:
FINALLY had the satisfaction of eating at this wonderful little spot. If I told you that I had been meaning to try this place out for twenty five years, would you believe me? Its true. I've always known that Home Plate was one of the best breakfast/brunch spots in The City; I worked next door for years when they were first making a name for themselves. Then, I moved away. But my wife and I were heading toward Marin and looking for breakfast, so...
If I was living in the Marina, I would eat here at least three times a week. The menu is extensive and the food looks (and is) delicious. I had the polenta with eggs and chicken sausage. Holy Cow! The polenta was so wonderful; melts in your mouth, full of flavor, wonderful. It is studded with pine nuts and bits of mushroom that give it a nice earthy flavor and you get two large squares that are more than plenty. The chicken sausage was quite tasty; very mildly seasoned and somewhat coarsely ground, so there is no mistaking it as chicken. I always give props to a breakfast joint that serves real, fresh squeezed OJ and that is definitely what you are getting here, Yay! My wife ordered the banana-nut pancakes with strawberries and blueberries (not topping or compote, FRESH berries) and they were fantastic; thick and fluffy and full of bananas. They could have been served with a bit more whipped cream, as it was a full-stack.
Service was great, but they have really crammed the maximum number of tables into a minimal space, so you'll probably get to know your fellow diners more than you might want to.
author: Jason E.

description: Nice breakfast waffle eggs and chicken apple sausage scones was a great touch. Very fast service and pretty good prices
author: Kristin K.

description: Heard great reviews from local hotels. I must admit the free scone was delicious. But regretted the visit after reading about the poor food safety score.
author: Esther R.

description: This place is a fantastic hidden gem. It´s hard to find a good breakfast place in Marina! Even harder to find one that serves fresh orange juice! (But do please add expresso) The omelettes are super good and service is great. Been here a couple of times and looking forward to trying out more.
author: Hanna A.

description:
This is no average diner.  The food is fantastic.

For lunch we had French toast almadine and a BLT with avocado on toasted sour dough bread with a fresh green salad. A delicious raisin scone accompanied each meal. Fresh, high quality, no-nonsense food here.

Location - 3 stars
Decor - 4 stars
Service - 5 stars
Food - 5 stars
Value - 5 stars
author: John D.

description:
If you want your eggs without a side of hipster and skinny jeans, this may be the spot for you.
Damn good breakfast, never a scene, and somehow much less expensive than it should be for San Francisco.
Always delightful, fast service.
author: Andy G.

description: This is a great little restaurant with delicious food. Everything was very fresh. Loved the homemade scones and fresh jam. We only stayed in San Francisco for 3days and went here for breakfast twice. I enjoyed some pancakes and the Spanish scrambler. My husband got the Angry Benedict and said it was amazing.
author: Shawna B.

description: This place offers great varieties of American breakfast. I love it. The one I'm having is Fritata special. Super delicious!
author: Thyra K.

description:
***4.5 stars***

when i lived in sf, i came here whenever i wanted good breakfast food.  even though i lived on the "other side of the hill" in pacific heights, i would gladly walk over the hill (or take the 22 bus if i was feeling lazy) just to come here and enjoy chef simon's breakfast fare.

specifically, this place is known for chef simon's homemade scones.  that is what brought me here the first time, many years ago, and that, in addition to their warm hospitality, is what continues to lure me here.

speaking of which, the staff has always been very kind and friendly to me, i guess b/c they recognize me from my many trips here.  i like how they keep a very small group of waitstaff so it feels like family whenever i come here.  always prompt, courteous, and accurate with my orders.

on my most recent trip here, i ordered the veggie omelet with egg whites.  of course, the first thing to arrive was the homemade scone, which was perfectly crumbly, not too dry, and baked to perfection, as always.  it came with the standard fruit jams to spread on the scone, which i believe are strawberry and mango flavoured.  next to arrive was my veggie omelet, which was big and fluffy, filled with oodles and oodles of veggies and some cheese.  on this day, my omelet appeared a bit undercooked as parts of the omelet (inside) were a little soft and runny.  but the omelet was still delicious and very filling.  my omelet came with their signature potato pancakes, which i absolutely love.  i also ordered a small bowl of fruit which was very fresh.

another scrumptious meal at my go-to restaurant.  wish they could open another shoppe in south bay so that i could have chef simon's homemade scones all the time!
author: Ellen L.

description: Started off with a home made scone with strawberry and mango sauce. AWESOME!  Followed by a spinach frittata and chorizo with scrambled eggs and potato pancakes. Quick and friendly service. Busy place but quiet enough to be ridiculed by my wife and our friend. Definitely worth a look if you are in the neighborhood.
author: Roberto A.

description: Very nice experience. Waiter was very attentive. Good was delicious. Would recommend if you are ever in the area.
author: Manuel A.

description:
I will definitely vouch for Home Plate as a great breakfast option in this area of San Francisco. As the other reviews noted, the free scones are a really nice touch. Delicious jelly options for the scones as well.

I went with the typical breakfast options of fried eggs, hasbrowns, and bacon.  A few of my friends had the more exotic options, which looked good as well.

One thing of note is that this place is small and you will most likely need to put your name on the list outside.  As for price, it's not as cheap as the IHOP across the street, but this is much fresher and made with better ingredients.  Service was friendly and efficient.
author: Michael N.

description: Has been our favorite breakfast spot in San Fransisco both times we have vacationed here. Great atmosphere and nice wait staff. The food has been top notch.
author: Doug H.

description: This place is just fantastic. If you're looking for the best breakfast establishment in the marina, look no further. I've had breakfast/brunch here 4 times and the food is always bomb, and the servers are very attentive. They also give you free biscuits and home made jam as a breakfast appetizer. Yum! This restaurant is however fairly small... Seating is limited. Do not try to bring a large group to weekend brunch. I tried to eat here last Sunday (Sunday after Halloween) and there was a line out the door. My friends and I decided to skip the line and go eat at Mel's across the street instead. Poor decision. Breakfast didn't even compete with home plate. Next time I will wait in line. It is worth it! Go Home Plate!
author: Ruthie G.

description: Fantastic place for brunch! It's a bit small, but does not take away from the amazing food and fast service. I think it's a great place to go if you're out and about on the hunt for some life changing breakfast! The many ways you can order your eggs is almost endless. It makes for a chance to try something new with a guarantee you'll love it!
author: Jasmine G.

description:
A diamond in the rough! We were gonna go to ihop across the street but when we got off the bus the line outside caught our attention! 

"WOW" 

What a great decision. The scone at the beginning was phenomenal! With the strawberry and Apple-Mango sauce  the warmth of the scone speechless! 

Make sure to order the Scramble Chorizo! I'm Mexican so to say that these were the best that I've had in 36 years. I mean it. The home made tortilla on the bottom just made that dish go to another level, "INSANELY DELISH! 

Make sure to order the freshly squeezed drinks, oh yeah the staff was FANTASTIC! Thank you Home Plate we will make this a tradition when we come back to San Fran. Much love from Arizona! God Bless! 

PS. The pancakes were soooo gooodddd!
author: David C.

description:
Best breakfast place I've been to hands down. 

Cutest little place with great fresh juices I had the honeydew, which could have been a bit colder but still delicious. 

The homemade jams were the best part -- for starters with the scones.. They just were the perfect introduction to what followed. 

I ordered the French toast which could have easily been shared with two other people and a side of bacon which also came with a good five pieces that could easily be shared. 

The staff was very attentive and provided great service.  Get there early because we luckily got there in time to not be on a waiting list. 

We were in and out within 40 min which is awesome time so we could see the city.  

Also tried the eggs Benedict and I don't know much about the dish since I've always been iffy to try it but I honestly loved it. Very scrumptious   

I will definitely visit again next time I'm in the San Fran area :)
author: Noemí C.

description: A cute little spot for some great breakfast! It can get quite busy though, and parking can be a hassle, but definitely worth it for the delicious food and polite, fast service. Everything tastes so fresh as well! I had the strawberry smoothie and the buttermilk waffles, and I loved them. The complimentary scones with mango and strawberry sauce are lovely too!
author: Melissa P.

description: An amazing breakfast place right across from an IHOP , service was great, the food was amazing , seating next to the kitchen gave me a chance to see the coordination between the kitchen staff and the freshness of the products they use in their dishes . Highly recommended
author: Mario N.

description:
I was definitely looking forward to their famous scones and man, that did not disappoint! Their scones came out fresh outta the oven, warm and fluffy. You would think that the scones would be hard, since that's what all scones are like, but these were more soft...like the consistency of a biscuit. Along with the scones came their house-made strawberry and peach jams....to die for!!! 

For my main brunch I ordered the fried polenta dish, which sounded delish! When I finally got my dish and started to eat it...I slowly began to dislike it. The fried polenta was too much polenta...barely an flavor...it was a bit hard to eat. The side of sausage to go with it was very delicious at least, so I relished that of course. But yeah, the fried polenta was not good. It seemed more like a side dish than a main dish. Some pple like it, but it was just not for me. 

Anyway, the staff was really friendly and the venue was homey like a diner. I definitely would come back again to try other dishes and as well as more of their complimentary scones!!!!
author: Michelle S.

description: One of my favorite brunch places in SF. Really nice staff and the food is consistently excellent. They give you a biscuit with jam as a complimentary dish. Suggest the Home Run Special or any of the pancakes and benedicts. Beware long lines in the morning because of tourists staying at motels nearby. Just come around 12-1pm to be more efficient.
author: Justin Y.

description: Great place. Quite busy and loud which was expected.  It's a "diner" but the food is well above average. Not the best pancakes I've ever had but good, shrimp frittata was about as good as a frittata can be. Omelette was american style with a sh#$load of fillings. Nice free biscuits and jam.  Average service but nice and for the price you can't expect more.  For what it claims to be(breakfast diner) it is a fantastic success! FYI, there is an ihop right across the street and if you go there instead you should be executed publicly
author: David S.

description:
I ate here 3 out of the 4 days I was in San Fran (visiting from Shanghai on business). I've been away from the USA for 12 years and hadn't had a real 'American' breakfast since 2000!

I'm so happy the motel I was staying at was directly across the street! First day was a Bacon & Chedder Omelette that had the perfect ratio of creamy-gooey cheddar to crisp bacon...the 2nd day I had a Grilled Cheese Sandwich, that was also had the same perfect ratio of cheese & bacon, and my last day to eat there was a Short Stack of Pancakes, and order of Homemade Chicken Sausage Patties and French Toast (I was a bit hungry, and didn't want to eat airplane food).

The service was always polite and courteous while being attentive. I noticed that the same asian chef was there every time I went, as well as the same lady. The lady made me feel like I was in an actual 'home' and not in a 'business'.

The fresh squeezed OJ and Grapefruit juice although a little dear ($5 for a large), was invigorating and hit the spot. Oh yes, the complimentary Homemade Scones with Mango and Strawberry sauce, a nice touch!

The bacon was soooo good I ordered 2 side orders, just because I knew that it may be years or even a decade before I have any like it (the bacon in China & Australia where I live just doesn't cut it for me).

Thanks to YELP for helping me find this place from abroad!
author: Mark I.

description: Food was so delicious, we had to go back the next day... We had the Spanish scramble, angry egg Benedict and French toast... Mmmmmm yes, the scones are delicious, service is fast and the potato carrot cake a as heavenly... Better than hash browns... And all under $25 with tip for two each day.
author: Alejandra P.

description:
Home-made Mango & Guava Jams. What more could you ask for?

Oh wait, maybe the homemade scones to accompany the homemade jams.

Ended up coming here with a slight wait on a weekend morning but it was all worth it. It's a small-ish type shop that serves good ol fashioned breakfasts. Got the french toast and a standard breakfast of sausage/eggs/potatoes, and both were delicious.

Friendly waitstaff and prices weren't through the roof, which is always a plus for popular places. Great place to come for brunch if you're in the Marina!
author: Andrew C.

description: Best breakfast in SF without breaking the bank. Scones taste like great grandma's biscuits! Homemade jellies are amazing too!
author: Jess M.

description:
Traditional diner fare, friendly service. We all left happy. 

Given the pricey nature of the Marina it's nice to find a down to earth place with friendly people. 

The Cobb salad I enjoyed was very fresh with ample ingredients. The egg dishes were equally good.  Keep in mind this is American (Traditional) and you'll be fine. 

And did I mention the friendly service? A nice welcome when we walked in the door and a helpful waitress. My water glass stayed full.
author: J. M.

description: Cozy place serving all day breakfast with very friendly service. The staff was cheerful and quick.
author: Nawee S.

description:
Quaint little brunch location minutes away from tourist hot spots (i.e. Painted Ladies).  For a Saturday, I greatly appreciated that we only had to wait literally 5 minutes!  I honestly think this place is a hidden gem that people should explore more. 

It is a bit small but the atmosphere is great for a sit down brunch.  The price is also very reasonable.  

I got the Crab Melt that came with fries and salad.  All were delicious but they are not shy with the dressing so I would recommend it to get it on the side.   Also, my meal came with complimentary scone which was fresh and hot!  Their apple and strawberry jams were delish! 

Only downfall is that it does not present itself to be the most cleanest joint...I stepped on something that was on the floor of where we sat but honestly I think they were trying to get ppl seated asap.  Also, there was a homeless person nearby that brought with them an unpleasant odor while we dined...but that's not the restaurants fault...

All in all, I say worthwhile place to checkout! I definitely want to go back and try their carrot potato pancakes and dulce de leche pancakes.
author: Shiori S.

description: Brunch for four was $80!. A waffle by itself was $7 and eggs with chorizo came with a homemade thick tortilla $12! But I have to say the food was really good that's why I give it a four star and staff was really nice.
author: Amber T.

description: Great breakfast!!!!.. We Loved the homemade scone they gave us to start with.. Extremely friendly staff.. A diamond in the rough for sure!!! Family owned and everything was spot on!!!  Give it a try..
author: Aaron D.

description:
Been here many many years ago....and a friend had decided to meet here for brunch last weekend.

Parking on the street sucks here.... $4.50 for a hour of parking.... Now I'm calling that a rip off... guess it is normal in SF.

Food is as I remembered it..... nothing special.... decent lunch/brunch place.  The thing that really stood out most was their scones!
author: Ashley L.

description: Possibly the best breakfast I have ever had at a restaurant. Got the crab omelette (special) and dulce de leche pancakes to share between two people. Both items were delicious! The service was quick and friendly! Definitely recommend eating here if you're in the neighborhood.
author: Kelsey R.

description:
Staff was really nice and professional 
Food was delicious and service was fast. 
Great local place with a mom and pop feel to it. I love local diners, this place is what makes San Francisco great.
author: Noel T.

description:
Found this place on Yelp and so glad I did! The food is amazing! It is a small place and doesn't look much from the outside but is lovely inside. Clean, fresh and welcoming! 

We are very fussy and hard to please when it comes to eateries but we have definitely found our breakfast place for the next week while we are here! 

I definitely recommend Home Plate! Five stars and deserves each of them!
author: Mary L.

description:
Scones? Scones anyone? They have delicious complimentary homemade scones before your breakfast, served with homemade mango and strawberry puree'. I'll take a dozen please!!

This place is great, food is amazing, coffee is fantastic and i'm not a big fan of coffee. Staff is wonderful and i can't wait to go back. I had Eggs Blackstone which is Benedict but instead of ham, they put BACON on it, and just enough hollandaise to flavor it..not drown it. Eggs, poached to perfection with a little side of hash browns. 
He had this chorizo scramble served on top of a corn tortilla bread...hello FLAVOR!

We love to visit SF and this place will definitely be our breakfast choice! Thanks so much for such great hospitality.
author: Lesley B.

description: Family Owned restaurant.  Excellent food, well priced,  big portions & outstanding service.
author: Bersalin T.

description:
We went to breakfast this morning and it was delicious! We got the home plate breakfast which included your choice of French toast, pancakes or waffles, choice of meat and eggs for $9.95, which by the way I shared with my 5 year old son. I had the French toast with the homemade chicken sausage which was delish! We had fresh squeezed orange juice and my husband the carrot and celery juice. They gave us 2 complimentary scones with homemade jam and they were so good!! Usually I'm not a scone fan since they seem heavy but these were just right.

It's a smaller place but cozy and the staff demonstrated excellent customer service.

Hopefully we can make it one last time before we head out. Many other things I want to try.
author: Pauline J.

description: The scones, potato carrot pancakes, everything tastes great! Really fresh and home made! Would definitely visit again the next time we are in San Francisco!
author: Zia A.

description: I adore this place! The food is perfection. The service is stellar. The quality of the food and atmosphere are fantastic. The wait is well worth it.
author: Megan N.

description:
I really need to try some other things on the menu, but I always end up going for the benedicts every single time. My favorite is either the Marco Polo or the Smoked Salmon Benedict. 

I also love their free scones and homemade jams! All in all, its a good (little) breakfast place. It feels very hole in the wall in that it doesn't look that fancy from outside, but the food is great and really hits the spot every single time...at least for me.
author: Elaine Y.

description:
The best breakfast place I've ever been to. Period. This place is amazing! However, I knocked off a star because it took at least half an hour for our food to come (for 4 people) and they also forgot to give us scones after telling us to wait 5 minutes for them to bake a fresh new batch. And while we were ordering, they also notified us that they ran out of the carrot potato pancakes (I was super bummed out). Other than those things, when the food arrived, we were all very pleased. I ordered the Marco Polo Eggs Benedict which was fantastic. 

And just like the many reviews that have stated this before: their scones are AMAZING. I'm a baker myself, and I always get so excited whenever I find places that really know how to make scones or any other baked good and know how to make it WELL. Their scones and the homemade jams (strawberry and apple) were the cherries on top of the cake.
author: Grace S.

description:
One of my favorite breakfast spots in the city.

Prices are affordable.

What you need to try there is the scone, best in the world with plum or strawberry jam, sooo good.
author: Nadia A.

description:
I LOVE THIS PLACE!! 

I never finish my food, but the day i went to Home Plate i ate everything on my plate. The service was great, our food was good, and the prices were reasonable. Next time i visit the bay area i'll definitely be returning to Home Plate.
author: Kellie U.

description:
Mehhh. It was ok but nothing special.  Took family here for breakfast based on yelp reviews and found service a bit poor and food less than stellar. 

I looked at an empty coffee cup quite a bit although I saw others getting refills (must have been my Seahawks jersey).  A couple of us had different types of french toast that looked incredible on the menu and might have been if they had allowed the bread any time to soak at all.  Unfortunately the toast was pretty dry and flavorless.

My wife had a breakfast sandwich which she enjoyed and my youngest son had a traditional bacon and eggs dish which was good but nothing special.  What was irritating is the dishes came out randomly.  My wife had her sandwich about 5 minutes before my boy got his breakfast.  A couple of minutes later my french toast showed up and then a few minutes after that the last plate arrived.  I understand serving food when it is hot, but the timing seemed better on most of the other tables (but not all).

When I go out to eat with others, I like to eat at the same time as them which is probably why the vast majority of kitchens time meals to be served together.  Home Plate seems to need to work on this.  

With all the great restaurants available I would probably give something else a try.
author: Bill D.

description: Phenomenal and free scones served upon being seated. Terrific chorizo scrambled eggs with even more fantastic potato/carrot pancakes which you should not pass up. No wonder this place has a line on Lombard
author: Alfonso L.

description:
I've definitely had 3 or 4 MUCH better experiences here since my 2009 visit.  I just read and deleted the last review that I wrote and decided to start from scratch since the ownership to this restaurant has changed hands since my 2009 review.  

Why I like this place:  Fresh, traditional breakfast and brunch items offered here at a reasonable price (many menu items under $10, not including beverages).  Efficient and friendly staff, which allows for quick turnaround on tables.  

What I recommend :   THE HOME PLATE SPECIAL (eggs, made to order; pancakes and breakfast meat)

Why I recommend these:  A value deal on a simple, traditional big American breakfast for under $10
author: Hiromi N.

description: Complimentary scones! So good with the mango and guava jams. Sadly, the benedict and scramble I had were sub-par. Definitely not worth the 10 dollars. Really like the hash and the potato carrot pancakes. Come here for the sides, not the entrees, I guess. Or, maybe, it's just the breakfast.
author: Ruobin W.

description:
Delectable breakfast. It was so nice, I ate here twice! Try to pesto omelette! Good coffee as well and a complimentary scone.

The jam/preserves are delicious as well.
author: Joseph P.

description:
What an awesome spot for brunch! Highly recommend it!

Came here with 3 others on a beautiful Sunday afternoon. I had their special "angry Benedict," which included shrimp, spinach, jalapeños and their spicy hollandaise sauce. I highly recommend this dish! The portion was extremely generous, as I wasn't able to finish even half... Probably because I chugged tons of water and freshly brewed iced coffee. 

Love how they provide you with their freshly baked scones with mango and apple sauce. Very nice touch!

Service was excellent. I really hope this place gets on open table to make reservations easier!
author: Anastasia N.

description:
Home Plate

Slide into Home Plate for a home run meal!!
Yes....I sure did have that home run meal today!!

Home Plate is a small Breakfast / Brunch / Lunch restaurant.  This place has been around for over 25 years and continues to operate it's business with high standards.  For a restaurant that's been around for over 25 years you can hardly tell that it's even a year old.  The place is nice and clean, kind of small...but makes you feel a home.  The kitchen is somewhat in plane view, the serving counters are as if you had a serving counter at home leading to the dining room.  

What makes this place different from many other restaurants are their homemade Scones and Jam.  For some reason Scones are not my top on my list, but today the Scone I had may have changed all that.

So....as I was looking for a good place for some Breakfast...I had encountered Home Plate.  Researched it a little bit on Yelp....averages 4 stars....Hey....love my Yelpers!!  Thanks You!!

I walked in and was greeted and seated.  I think I went at the right time as there was no line to wait in.
I started out with a large freshly squeezed orange juice while looking over the menu.

I decided on the Home Run special.
This came with:
2 Eggs cooked anyway you wanted it.  (sunny side up for me).
Choice of Buttermilk Pancakes, Waffle or French Toast.  (I was craving French Toast).

http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/kesgk8dCRyg3qRDYpuAKGg?select=8uRVpAoXk29bIdkKCF-2bA

You also had a choice of Bacon, Ham, Turkey, Pork Sausage Links, Homemade Chicken Sausage Patties or Andouille Sausage.  I chose the Andouille Sausage (Spicy Sausage).
In addition I had asked for a side of Hash Browns.

This would complete my order.

Shortly they had brought me a homemade Scone and some of their homemade Jams.  Ummm.....Yummm!!  No, I normally do not eat Scones, but maybe I should start.  This was truly fabulous!!
Not too heavy...actually it is pretty lite and the homemade jam was a perfect compliment for the scone.

http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/kesgk8dCRyg3qRDYpuAKGg?select=y712NhUtD959zlGOa_5icQ

Perfect timing....just finished my scone and my eggs arrive.  Two eggs sunny side up, Andouille sausage and hash browns on one plate and French Toast topped off with some powder sugar on another  plate.  Ahh....where do I begin....I love my eggs to run so I started with the eggs and sure enough I got the yoke spewing out onto my hash browns!!  Perfect placement!!  Eggs were nice and fresh, sausage was tasty not too spicy and my hash browns with a little salt added made this an awesome dish.  Everything was cooked to perfection!!  I think I cleaned that plate off and asked for another glass of Orange Juice.  Next the French Toast....taste as expected....this has not failed me yet.  OMG!!  I am in breakfast heaven.

http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/kesgk8dCRyg3qRDYpuAKGg?select=uaA380j9KTmIX2xLs1qWdQ

The one thing I did miss was the Mimosa.  They were offering a "Make your own Mimosa"....you get a bottle of sparkling wine and your choice of fresh squeezed orange juice or grapefruit juice.  That is next on my list.

Overall, the place is very clean, service was excellent and food was cooked to perfection.  Hash Browns were maybe a point above average....rating a 4 star.  
I will return for more!!
author: Alan L.

description: Great food and even better people! They are very organized and efficient.  You won't be disappointed.
author: Leo S.

description:
I came here based on the reviews, and didn't want to visit a chain like the IHOP across the street but was woefully disappointed. 

The coffee tasted like run of the mill Folger's and the scones were pretty dry and flavorless. They certainly looked tasty but fell very flat. The homemade jams were very good though so I was keeping hope alive...

When breakfast came out everything looked and tasted like it came from the IHOP across the street - a mediocre chain restaurant. The service was pretty good but there are soooo many better breakfast places! The butter had a sourness to it I just couldn't appreciate... I LOVE sourdough bread, especially when I'm in SF, but this just tasted weird. 

In retrospect I would've preferred the IHOP across the street - and I don't like IHOP.
author: Jeff L.

description: This place is my favorite breakfast spot in the city! The service is great, the food is perfect. Be sure to try the carrot pancakes (which are actually more of a fritter) instead of the hash browns, they are delicious. Hash browns are really good too! They have a bloody mary that uses a Korean sake type alcohol rather than vodka, packs a nice punch and tastes a good too!. The scrambles are a perfect amount of food, with great flavor. The chorizo and eggs are served on a home made corn tortilla with just the right amount of spice. It is a small space but the wait is not very long. Best breakfast in the city, and won't break the bank!
author: Lala H.

description: This place was legit!  These people know how to run a restaurant. We ordered and were shocked that as we waited for our food we were brought the best scones ever. And to top it off, they're served with homemade strawberry and mango jams. The scones were so great, we ordered some for the drive home!  I had the crab omelette which was LOADED with real crab. I had the potato and carrot pancakes on the side. They were served with dollops of sour cream and fresh apple sauce. Everyone else's food was just as great as mine!  We will return!
author: Dee M.

description:
In the world of breakfast joints- it is difficult to put a twist on the simple egg. Home plate has figured out how to make a simple meal interesting. Unique fritattas, fresh juices(honeydew melon!), and great scones that come with the meal. Fast and pleasant service.
Thanks for a great meal!
author: Matt C.

description:
I should probably preface this review by saying that I'm probably not allowed back here.  No, not because I stumbled in drunk at 7 AM, or because I started a food fight.

It was because I was laughing so hard I was crying, and the poor waitress had to come back several times to try and take my order.  Why?  http://hellodadandmom.wordpress.com/2011/12/02/iphony/

What's great about this place:

+ Small, homey, comfortable little (almost divey) breakfast and lunch nook.
+ NOT Mel's or IHOP.
+ Delicious homemade chicken apple sausage (in Boyfriend's Meat Lover's Omelette, which was humongous).
+ Very, very reasonable prices (most items were under $10, portion sizes were pretty big).
+ Even more delicious potato-carrot pancakes, which were thin and served with a dollop of sour cream and applesauce.
+ The most delicious part was the raisin scone that they give you before your meal.  I think they change it up every once in awhile (I read from another Yelper that they had cranberry-orange).  They also give you fruit jam with it, and this time it was strawberry and mango.
+ Service.  Despite my inability to clearly voice my breakfast item choices through my bouts of laughter, the waitress was very patient and kind.

What's mediocre:

+ Smoked salmon bagel.  It's just a plain bagel with way too much cream cheese slathered on.  I could've gotten this elsewhere for like $5-6, and it wouldn't have tasted so oddly-mushy-like.

I'm so excited this place is about two blocks away from my flat.  WFH days will have a new special meaning in my life now.  What a win!
author: Tori S.

description:
So disappointing!!! This was my one breakfast out last week, and I'm kind of mad i wasted it on this place.

I was excited to try this place because of the many great reviews, and  the menu had some interesting options.
I was wavering between a few dishes, and the server told me the crab cake benedict was her absolute favorite dish.
 She assured me that the crab cake was full of crab, and not filler. She did say they weren't greasy, and that was true. I was very happy about that, but they were totally bland. The crab was mushy, and didn't taste fresh. I had the hollandaise on the side, and it wasn't good either. The english muffin was barely toasted, and went mostly uneaten.
 I did like the carrot potato pancakes on the side, and the free scone was delicious.

We also tried one pumpkin pancake, and one buttermilk pancake. Except for a few bites, the pumpkin pancake was inedible. The edges were black, but the middle was totally raw. Another dish uneaten...

My husband's corned beef hash was mostly potatoes. Bland, unseasoned, undercooked potatoes, with a few bites of chewy meat.

This was a completely unsatisfying breakfast.
author: Amanda G.

description: Quick good food, attentive, what more do you need besides longer hours.  We got there at 1:30 and they closed at 2PM the first time we went there.  No problems.
author: Jaymey J.

description: Well... Let me say that I ate at Mama's the morning before which is hard to match up to.  I ordered the crab scramble at Home plate, mine was just ok if But I found a small black hair in the middle of the carrot potato cake. :( My Friends had shrimp eggs bene and chorizo fritatta everyone else seemed to be quite content. I will say the  Orange juice was really fresh and yummy and the complimentary scone made my entire visit!  Is it too much to ask for the cook to wear a hair net?  I totally get that it just happens and it's an accident but its still really gross!
author: Venessa V.

description: It's a diner so I review it as such. Probably the best diner in all of SF! Really, the wait is worth it and there's a reason why there's usually a line. Busy spot with limited tables but the service is great. They're attentive and spot on with timing. The complimentary scone and jams is great and you can't complain about their sweet and savory dishes. Great weekend breakfast/brunch spot, not much else to say!
author: Tammie B.

description: Hands down one of the best breakfast places in sf, snd definitely in the marina! Their fresh scones are awesome and come complimentary for everyone at the table. Get there early to avoid lines on the weekend!
author: Stephanie L.

description: Open on Christmas! Food was absolutely amazing!! Delicious scones. Home Plate comes highly recommended.
author: Joanna P.

description: My boyfriend and I mistakenly found ourselves at a "high-end" cafe up the street from Home Plate. We paid for our coffees and kept venturing. That's when we found this place. It was exactly what we were looking for. During the wait to be seated we walked down 5 businesses and grabbed a cup of coffee at Berekka (equally as amazing). The complimentary scones were an awesome touch and both the boyfriend's and I's food was fresh and satisfying.
author: Summer S.

description:
Not all places in the Marina are snobby, superficial, and pretentious. This is one of the few that doesn't live up to the Marina stereotype. 
Not a popped collar, pink polo wearin', fratboy leftover d-bag from the Matrix Fillmore in sight! 

We had a Sunday brunch here with our friends Randi and Hans. No wait to get seated but a full restaurant! (nice)

Homely feeling inside, some old school baseball pictures on the wall. The service was friendly. Shortly after we ordered, the best scones I've had came out on our table. Warm and soft, they came with this homemade berry jam. (http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/kesgk8dCRyg3qRDYpuAKGg?select=WA4IgKzODjNHfOAdt9rovA)

I ordered their Hangtown (http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/kesgk8dCRyg3qRDYpuAKGg?select=pL-c-TxXiF49U5ILsH67hA) - after watching Anthony Bourdain eat an oyster and bacon frittata I wanted one too. The croissant tasted like Pillsbury's. My plate also came with a potato carrot pancake that reminded me of a latke. 

Joyce ordered this (http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/kesgk8dCRyg3qRDYpuAKGg?select=U_AuiF_Y4okhvM_XS4w6og) and it was hella good. Light and fluffy pancakes with fresh berries. The fresh whipped cream were like pillows puffs. I liked these pancakes better than Stacks. 

The prices are great. Great place for a Sunday' brunch for 4 and they didn't rush us to leave.
author: Earl G.

description:
YUM!! BEST BREAKFAST EVERRRRRR

1 liter mimosas for me and my bestie - yes, we finished them all..

2 orders of the roasted chicken omlette, two days of our 4 day stay in SF...
It was THAT good - fantastic!

and those carrot potato latkas - oh baby. yummmm

and last but not least...my absolute favorite part of the meal - THOSE SCONES!!! wow, so fresh, so crumbly...so tasty...if i could have them every day i would.

Such a small crowded neighborhood joint that backs a LOT of flavor and satisfaction. 

love love love
author: Shannan M.

description: Great place for brunch. Mainly breakfast food, great mimosa prices. Food was delicious! Small, intimate atmosphere. Waited out front after putting our name on the waiting list sitting on the window.
author: Eva M.

description: Great place for breakfast and I love the freshly baked scone! Typical american breakfast offered and they tastes pretty good. friendly staff and price is reasonable. We will be back again!
author: William C.

description: Crazy long wait. Meh service from overwhelmed servers. Decent food. The fresh juice is a nice touch and the pancakes are great, but it's not worth the 30-45 minute wait just to sit down.
author: Will C.

description: If giving a restaurant under a one star was possible I would have for this experience. After waiting over an hour for a supposedly 10 min wait my friends and I were crammed into a table better suited for two guests than our five. We ordered immediately but had to ask repeatedly for water over a twenty minute period and our water glasses were never refilled. We also had to request our complimentary scones. They brought out one too few and we had to request another after five minutes of trying to get the waiters attention. In addition, all of our food came out at very different times. My friend's pancakes were barely cooked. They ended up double charging one of our cards and the staff was not at all apologetic. This breakfast was a nightmare and I am now sitting by my friend, writhing in stomach pain, because her uncooked pancakes and bacon.
author: Tara B.

description: So delicious! Not too much food to. I ordered the huevos rancheros and it came with one home made tortilla, two eggs, a delicious sauce and black beans. The have potato carrot  pancakes that are thin and very yummy for a side. Highly recommend!
author: Maren R.

description: Awesome fresh options with friendly helpful staff. My go to place for breakfast when in SF
author: Craig T.

description: My breakfast there was perfect. I had two eggs with toasts and hash browns, everything was warm and good, only for $7. I really appreciated the complimentary scone they gave me. Their jam and juice were very tasty too.
author: Maureen R.

description: Delicious! Great food, potato carrot pancake is very good, so are their omelettes. If you are in the area definitely worth going.
author: Bre V.

description: Mostly the same old breakfast stuff. No vegetarian sausage or unique vegetarian options. Hash Browns tasted faintly of bacon, hence 2 stars.
author: K K.

description:
I ordered polenta. Didn't expect it would be so good: creamy, but with paper and mushrooms, I hate deep fried thinks, but this was not oily, just perfect)) And I've got the best scramble eggs I've tried ever: I asked to make it fluffy and it was ))) 
Coffee unfortunately wasn't good, but food was so good that I could get coffee in other place and be very happy
The thinks I felt a little bit not happy about:
1) Scone was just ok =( Well... to be honest, it wasn't the best I've tried. But it was ok with eggs
2) Jam, butter etc. was so limited in super small "bowls" (don't know how to name thinks where jam, ketchup etc are served). Maybe I'm spoiled but it felt like I've got the last spoon of their jam =)
But! I was pretty happy about quality of the food, atmosphere was very relaxed and cozy, service was nice. I would go there many more times ))
author: Madina I.

description:
I don't understand why people give this place such great reviews. I think that since it is located near quite a few hotels, most of these reviews have been written by happy tourists. When I visited, I certainly did not see anyone who looked like locals eating there. 

The menu is extensive, but the food is bland and unimpressive. My partner and I shared hash browns, carrot cakes, bacon, scrambled eggs and banana walnut pancakes. Everything was quite boring and nothing special. The scones however were delicious, but hardly any reason to wait in line to eat. 

The service was extremely poor. You are served by all of the staff as opposed to just one waitress/waiter. This may seem like a very good idea which would boost the amount of service each table receives. However, my experience speaks otherwise. At first the staff were too attentive, barely allowing any time to review the menu. Then, once our meals were served, it was very difficult to grab their attention. Furthermore, they neglected to remove used dishes from our table and instead placed new dishes on top of the others and brought new cups rather than refilling (or removing) the others. Lastly, they didn't bring their famous scones till the end of the meal. 

The worst part of my experience was their lack of accommodation. I attempted to make a few changes to some of their meals to accommodate my dietary restrictions without any success.  Not only were they inflexible but their was no expression of sympathy or apologies and the service that followed was hostile. 

Terrible place, I will never go again. 

TLDR

Food = common, bland, nothing special (scones are good)
Customer Service = hectic, disorganized, inconsistent, not willing to make accommodations on meals
Overall = very poor, won't go there again
author: Katherine M.

description:
I have been coming here for years.  I thought I Yelped about them already but apparently I was wrong because tonight Yelp kindly notified me by throwing a giant notification in my face on the home page. 

Anyways, Home Plate is, hands down, THE best place for a traditional, quality breakfast.  If you're the type of breakfast person that wants quantity over quality for your money, go across the street because there is an International House of Pancakes (IHOP) located DIRECTLY ACROSS THE STREET.  That should give you an idea of how much better Home Plate is when they have a fucking IHOP right across the street and still manage to consistently have patrons willing to wait, at times, over an hour, to eat at their small family joint instead.

Eggs Benedict.  Bomb.
All-star Bacon?  Just order it. 
The Waffles here shouldn't even be called waffles, because they're in a class of their own.  Even if you have eaten at a spot that had Mount Everest waffles, you'll be eating Neil Armstrong waffles at Home Plate. 

All in all, whatever you order on the menu, you will not be disappointed.  In fact, when you first timers sit down and place your order,  you'll be given a scone to eat to pass the time while your order is being prepared.  Delicious right?  Yeah, those are made from SCRATCH by the same people who are serving you and making your order.  Do I really need to say more?
author: Alex S.

description:
Loooong wait.  Coming from a small town, waiting for a table this long is something new to me.  So, I would have to rate something if the wait is worth it.  My answer is no.  Don't get me wrong, the food and the service were good.  It's just that when you're hungry, you don't want to wait 45min to 1 hour for breakfast - dinner maybe, but not breakfast.  It's definitely something that should be considered when deciding to go here or not. 
Why so many stars then?  The food was good.  The service was SUPER friendly!
author: L R.

description:
Let me start with what works: 
- coffee was delicious and it kept coming
- complimentary scones and homemade jams 
- service was right on since moment we signed up til end

What didn't work: 
- Potato carrot pancakes were greasy and cold;
- waffles did not compare to our fav place in San Pedro;
- .75 charge for salsa... That's just blasphemy!!!  It's not right. It wasn't even salsa, it was pico de gallo and the size they gave me was just enough for 2 bites. Sorry for the rant, salsa is big for me.  

I just wasn't impressed.  The food was okay, but not to return again.  I'm only in San Francisco once or twice a year, I gotta make the food count.
author: Marisol C.

description: I had the Chorizo and eggs and it was bomb.  She had an omelette with shrimp and  avocado.  Kids had french toast.  Really good stuff.  I liked the complimentary scones too.  Amercan express is not accepted which was disappointing.  Luckily, we had other payment options.  Street parking wasn't too hard to find.  I would definitely go back.
author: Bryan D.

description: So good. Potato/carrot cakes were unique and yummy. Ample portions and everything was yummy. Only complaint is the place is very small inside.
author: India G.

description: Great! Came here after a rude experience at Brixton. Came here with some friends visiting from LA. This place was pretty small but luckily we were able to get a table. You just put your name on a list & they scratch off the names. Food- delicious. I ordered the salmon eggs Benedict with potato carrot pancakes. It was delicious. Customer service- great, polite. However, it did take a while for our food to get here but that's understandable for a weekend. We also ordered mimosas, which weren't very strong but that's how I like it so I loved it. Hash browns were delicious and not very greasy so that's a plus. A lot of people recommended the potato carrot pancake but I wasn't really fan. Everything else was good, especially the biscuits! So, don't forget to order those. Great experience and clean dining. Loved it. I will recommend this place to friends.
author: Annette Y.

description: This place was adorable! We got in right before the rush Sunday morning (10am or so). It's got a fresh feel inside and the staff is extremely friendly and attentive.
author: Kara Y.

description:
I had a chorizo plate here... and it was mediocre to be honest.  My girlfriend and her friends' plates however were good, hence the four stars!  I'm sure I just got a bad batch.  Also it didn't help that my car got broken into on the pierce street garage during our meal, but I'm not gonna let that stop me from telling you all that the food is good and the service is speedy!

Complementary scones and jam were pretty awesome too!
author: Robert C.

description:
Went on a Monday for brunch. 
Had 2 eggs breakfast. 
It came with a biscuit that was one of the best.
author: Ying S.

description: Came here for breakfast the day after the 4th of July. We were lucky enough to be seated right away despite the limited space. Ordered the Home Plate Frittata with hash browns and sourdough bread. Everything was tasty and was a nice change of pace from the typical breakfast chains. Our servers were great and were always making sure our coffee and water cups were always filled. I would come back here again on my next visit to SF
author: Fred P.

description:
Great breakfast joint.  Family owned.  Across the street from Ihop and Mels Drive in.  Pretty much the same menu but what I enjoyed here compared to the rest is that this place is very genuine.  Fresh ingredients.  Not over salted or sweetened dishes.  I love how they give you free scones before your meal.  The scones are so yummy!  It taste like the fluffy butter biscuit with raisins.  Delicious!  They serve with home made jam!  YUM... I wish the scone was bigger!

I ordered the Crab Omelet...OH BOY!  It was perfect!  Eggs, Avocado, provolone cheese and huge chunks of crab. OMG divine!  Couldn't ask for a better breakfast! 

Highly recommend this place.  I promise you will become a fan :)
author: Ying F.

description:
Perfect breakfast on a business trip. Filling and not greasy. I had the veggie omelette- their potato carrot pancakes (kinda like a latke) were awesome and the omelette was fantastic. Plus, my coffee never got below full! 

Very friendly staff, great food, not breakin the bank, I'd come here again!
author: Andrew P.

description: I love this place. If I could, I would have breakfast here every morning to start my day.  This place is quick and efficient and good every time.  I love the customer service and the fresh squeezed OJ.  The free scones are so delightful as well :)
author: Nicole H.

description: We came here for breakfast on our way to the Golden Gate Bridge area. My husband got the New York scramble which had eggs, smoked salmon, cream cheese, and avocados with a side of hashbrowns and freshly squeezed orange juice. He absolutely loved it! I got some coffee and the California scramble which had eggs, lump crab meat, avocados, and sour cream with hashbrowns. It was so delicious. Our server was very friendly and the ambiance was laid back with LOTS of options for breakfast and lunch only. If you want really good and fresh food at a local spot, definitely give this place a try!
author: Heather A.

description: The food is delicious! Minus one star because it took a long time to get our food (though for Sunday brunch it's to be expected). Plus it's nice that they give you pre-meal scones! The carrot/potato pancakes are delicious!
author: Karen D.

description: I absolutely love this place. This is my default brunch place in San Francisco. The complementary scones and the omelettes are super tasty. I personally love their grilled shrimp scramble.
author: Umashankar N.

description:
The family was looking for a breakfast spot walking distance from our hotel Good ol' trusty yelp helped us find this place.  Right across the street from an IHOP?  The only time I like a chain restaurant like IHOP or Denny's is when there is nothing else around.

We made the right call.  Home Plate was charming, inviting, friendly and delicious. The menu had your traditional breakfast items plus a few really cool twists. The crab cake Eggs Benedict were outstanding.  So were the potato/carrot pancakes (think latkes, not maple syrup). Fresh squeezed juices, yummy crepes, complementary scones, all were wonderful. 

A great breakfast place.
author: Mike M.

description: Always wanted to try their breakfasts and I did! The scones were delish with the mango and strawberry purée - nice pair up! The servers were attentive with excellent customer service; I've had the roasted chicken omelette and that tasted delish !! I'm coming back for more!
author: Ginalorie D.

description: This place is a hidden gem. There was 4 in our party and we each enjoyed our food. The pancakes and French toast were delicious . Omelettes hash browns excellent. Big portions good prices.The place is small and expect to wait. It's worth it!
author: Marie L.

description: This is a hidden gem on Lombard.  You'd walk by, look in, and think nothing of it.  However, I think this is the best breakfast spot in the marina.  There will always be a line, but they turn tables quickly.  I think the restaurant is owned by a small family, and they are just about as sweet as can be.  Always greet you with a big smile.  I've tried everything on the menu from eggs benedict to pancakes, but my favorite thing is how they let you make your own scramble.  The complimentary scone is also a treat.  Plus, the price is right. With tip, you're looking at about a $12 breakfast.
author: Mary S.

description: Best breakfast place in the city, and best kept secret too. Love the homemade muffin and jam as an amuse bouche. And I dont even eat it usually. The polenta mushroom and eggs is to die for. The staff is always amazing and they keep having me coming back for more. Cant believe I forgot to do a review after all these years
author: Thierry H.

description: Fantastic breakfast place! Our party of 4 arrived at the perfect time and got seated immediately. I had the Denver omelet with hash browns, wheat toast, the scone, fresh salsa, and fresh orange juice. I don't tend to love restaurant on letters much but this omelette was so creamy and cooked perfectly. I loved it! Salsa was super fresh and added some perfect texture to the omelette. The portion sizes are rather large and we probably could have shared two omelettes. Service was fantastic. Would come again in a heartbeat!
author: Amanda L.

description: Wow !! Great service and the food was even better. The jam that came with the scones was a bite of mango heaven
author: Moni M.

description: Best breakfast we had in a long time. Highly recommend!  Nice morning walk from the Wharf.
author: Dan D.

description: Went there with two friends, we all ordered different meals and equally enjoyed them. The staff was friendly and location is convenient.
author: Viola B.

description:
Home Plate is a neighborhood gem that is hidden and undervalued. 
Friendly waitstaff and prices were reasonable. 

THE FOOD
It has better than average brunch, and their Benedicts are delicious.   
Fresh mimosas by the glass or liter. 
The best part is they serve free freshly baked scones w home made jelly! 

I would rather eat here than wait for Park Chow any day.
author: Lily S.

description: The food was brought out incredibly fast and the service was friendly. The complimentary fresh baked scones were amazing! I usually dislike scones because I find them to be dry but these were warm and soft. For food, my bf and I shared the crab cakes benedict and California scramble (I think this was the name.. but it was basically crab and avocado with scrambled eggs). The food was good, but not great.
author: Helen D.

description: We went to this place to try it for the first time.  I didn't think it was all that. My wife liked it. She had the crab omelette. I had a ham and cheese scramble. They do give you a fresh baked scone which was good. My wife wants go back.
author: Rick L.

description:
Heart this place!
Went with the gal pals to get brunch, was very tasty and reasonable.

Got 2 eggs with hash brown, bacon and toast.....tasty.
Shared a liter ($24) of mimosas with the ladies. I would say there are at least 9-12 flute sized glasses in there, well worth the money.

Easy to get in and out, good service, good food and drink, good value. I'd come back again!
author: Rachel R.

description: The quality has definitely improved over the years since coming here, the service is good, the only thing is that it takes a little time to get your food, understandable. Small kitchen and always busy. The food is great and they even treat you with small scones and some of their jams, warm and delicious.
author: Tommy F.

description:
Don't get me wrong, the food is pretty decent, but the service has always taken FOREVER. I'm sitting at the place as I write this and we've been waiting for 30 minutes. 
It's not even crowded today. What's going on?
author: Carlos R.
