description: Awesome breakfast with great service! I was standing outside looking at the menu when I guy leaving said "go in, it's the best breakfast in town" I'm glad I did! Will defiantly come back!
author: Hui L.

description:
The food and service at Home Plate is astounding, a real gem of a "greasy spoon", which of course it really isn't.

I had ordered a Crab omelet (nary any crabmeat or flavor) at Eggheads in Fort Bragg (north coast Mendocino area) a few weeks back, well, Home Plate's Crab omelet vindicated my previous outing for eggs and shellfish. Home plate's version was filled with 4 oz or more of delicious, buttery crab, they even threw in a side order of hollandaise at no charge.

The soft-spoken Asian servers were so attentive, so cute, so sweet, I felt like I had my own personal breakfast geisha attending to all of my early morning gastronomique needs.

Plus, they serve you yummy and complimentary raisin scones with 2 types of home-made jams, AWESOME!!!

I can understand why the place has lines around the corner for breakfast.
This place rocks my world, will definitely revisit when we come back to SF in August.
author: Kevin W.

description: I haven't been here in a while, so not sure if it's the same ownership / management as when I did. But this place has the best breakfast in San Francisco. Fantastic food. I love those scones and that incredible jam.
author: Peter K.

description:
Came her today to have brunch.  The wait was not long for a small restaurant.  I ordered the smoked salmon poached eggs with carrot potato pancake on the side.  I was delicious and tasty.  I also ordered the cafe mocha which was served in a tall glass with whipped cream.  What surprised me was the complimentary scone they served with jam and butter.  It was warm and very fresh.
The atmosphere was cozy and laid back.  I enjoyed the time there on a nice Saturday morning, before starting the day.
author: Monica C.

description: Clean, fresh food, & pleasant  environment. Friendly & attentive staff. Tasty bacon cooked very well my food was prepared just as I requested . Will return . Oh, for what it's worth the restrooms are clean as well, tells a little  about the establishment.
author: Ron P.

description: When I go to SF I stay in any hotel of Lombard st. And always were curious about the food at home plate just because is always full, so I get there and I order the frittata home plate, my husband get the eggs Benedict and yess was very good! Plus the warm scones!! Services was good and fast... A good destination for breakfast if you are staying around!
author: Celeste B.

description: One of the best places to have breakfast in the city- this brunch place serves you the right amount of food. We ordered the chicken omelette and the shrimp omelette which were delicious. But what we loved more were the side dishes that came with it. The scones that they served before breakfast was fresh and tasted amazing, and their potato carrot pancakes were delicious. The omelettes had generous amount of cheese and other ingredients. The staff who served us were really friendly and refilled us with coffee, butter, mustard whenever we asked for it. And at the end of the meal, you don't have to pay a hefty amount so you are left satisfied financially as well
author: Fatema M.

description: This is the best "bang for your buck" dining I've done in awhile. It's so affordable and a great locals spot. I ordered the BBC pancakes. Banana. Bacon and Chocolate chips. A perfect sweet meets savory breakfast. The only reason they get 4 stars rather than 5 is because their scones aren't my style. I'm a bit of a scone snob and these were much fluffier than a traditional scone should be. But that being said, the scones are free! So if I were able, I would give it 4.5 stars.
author: Vanessa L.

description:
Boyfriend was getting hungry on the way to the Golden Gate bridge..and when he's hungry he wants to eat NOW.

The weather was terrible - hailing and all sorts of torrential downpours so I quickly yelped a place and looked up and saw it so we pulled over.  So glad we did.

We had to wait about 5 minutes as the place is TINY but it was worth the wait.  The food was delicious and hit the spot.  I had the Marco Polo eggs benedict.  Turkey and avocado...YUM.  He had a bacon and egg breakfast sandwich that we inhaled.  Freshly squeezed OJ and free scones with jam..LOVE LOVE LOVE all for really cheap.

Definitely a hidden gem and winner.  Plus they're Thai operated.  Gotta support the peeps!
author: Michelle K.

description: I love this place!  First, they are one of the few restaurants that use real ingredients.  Everything is made fresh and to order.  Second, the service is excellent.  They are always coming round to fill coffee and check up on you.  Third, who gives you home baked scones for free with any order.  Even if you just come in for coffee and juice, they still give you scones.  Every time we come to SF we make it a point to stop here for breakfast.
author: Tony F.

description: I highly recommend Hone Plate for breakfast. The staff is extremely nice and prompt. The food is really good and you won't leave hungry. It is a quaint place so you may  have a small wait to get seated but worth it!
author: Cathy C.

description: This is fabulous.  I highly recommend it.   The food is great and the service is wonderful.   Do not miss this jewel.
author: Robin B.

description:
It's been a while since I slid into Home Plate, but I think I may have been called out this time. The umpire is being conferred on this one. Let's look at the instant replay, shall we?

I was on my way up to Corte Madera for a writing workshop last week (no wisecracks, please) when I realized I had about an hour before I had to be there. I was debating between coming here for a quick breakfast or hoping against hope that I could make it to Sam's in Tiburon for one of their famous hangtown fries while I sunned myself on the deck. But the sun had yet to make an appearance, and I was feeling like I was already having bad traffic karma on Lombard. Home Plate, it is.

The compact place looks the same all these years later. The cook with the little white cap looks the same. It was crowded with chair-banging customers, including a horsey Asian girl who seemed to think her hoodie was flattering to her overstuffed figure. It's not, honey. Lay off the free scones. Well, much to my temporary delight, I noticed on the menu that they indeed serve a Hangtown Fry for $7.50 complete with oysters, bacon bits, mushroom slices and green onions. OK, that was what I ordered.

But first came their famous homemade scone with a little cup of a fruit compote (see my photo). I never did ask what flavor it was, but my guess was guava since it was purplish. It didn't matter because it was tasty as was the tiny scone flecked with raisins. Things looked up until I got the hangtown fry (see my photo). Pretty underwhelming with nothing terribly fresh-tasting in it. The eggs had a bit of a soupy texture even though it was edible enough. My favorite parts of the dish were on the sides - the crescent roll and the too-small potato-carrot pancakes.

OK, it was probably a mistake to order the hangtown fry just because I had a Sam's-inspired hankering. Sticking with the basics was probably my best bet. But you certainly get service with a smile and spark-plug energy from the waitress. Oh, the umpire is making his final call. Yelper interference, he shouts. Coach, I've been benched!

FOOD - 3 stars...passable breakfast fare...I wouldn't try the riskier dishes
AMBIANCE - 3 stars...it's the same small place it's been for years
SERVICE - 4 stars...a great waitress...service with a smile
TOTAL - 3 stars...not a destination place, but I could've done worse ...YOU'RE SAFE!
author: Ed U.

description:
Absolutely, hands down the best American breakfast in San Francisco!!
An unassuming exterior can't hide this storefront jewel.  The menu is varied and the presentation A+++.  It's well worth the wait.
author: Nancy I.

description: We LOVED this place. Super nice staff who went way out of their way to accommodate 9 adults and 2 small children in this rather small restaurant. All of the food we ordered was great, The dulce de leche pancakes were a hands down favorite, close behind were the Bangkok Frittata and the pesto omlette. Coffee, scones and homemade preserves were fabulous. Deserves every one of the 5 stars!
author: Brekkie D.

description: Great spot to grab a solid breakfast!  They surprise you with some nice scones and a neat menus that offers some non-traditional diner items.
author: Michael S.

description:
Great service! the OJ is fresh - not from a bottle - makes all the difference. Good expansive menu, especially breakfast items. They give complementary fresh baked scones with homemade jam - delicious!

The eggs were a little runny (undercooked even for over-easy) hence taking off a star for that. Would still go there again!!
author: Mo S.

description:
Great breakfast... 

Big portions, fast and friendly service. Try the thai frittata with carrot/potato pancakes and spicy sausages added. Delicious! Refilled coffee mug all the time.

Would not hesitate a second to come back next time we're in sf.
author: Henrik O.

description: Perfect scones! Otherwise, average food. The service was fast but they rubbed me the wrong way by hovering over me throughout my visit. It seemed they were definitely trying to process me out quickly because they pressured me to order quickly and pay quickly.  I even felt pressured to eat quickly. Dining out should be relaxing but I was frustrated.
author: Brandon V.

description: Love this breakfast spot. Always good specials and the best eggs Benedict around! Our go to place for a great breakfast
author: Gabe W.

description: Free freshly baked scones and homemade jam!? What!? Unheard of, unless you're at Bobby Flay's famous brunch. Somewhat of a hidden gem and very easily overlooked in the Marina along the busy Lombard Street. Go early, sign up on the sheet, and be prepared to wait for a table in the tiny dining space. The food is amazing, portions are plentiful, and more importantly, the coffee is superb!
author: Mansi A.

description: I absolutely love this little diner. I am a local so I just walk on over there, however I'm sure those driving will have a bit of trouble finding parking. Everything is great here. From their complementary homemade scones to their huge omelettes! Staff is very friendly and attentive as well. Thanks Home Plate!
author: Ariella E.

description: Awesome eggs florentine with a complimentary scone to start.  We split 500ml of pink mimosa and it was a game changer.
author: David W.

description:
The nicest people in San Francisco ! ! ! The food is amazing. The amount of food they put on the plate will hold you for the whole day. Once again, great people, I forgot my cellphone on the table and they chased me outside to give it to me back. 

Thanks to everyone that works there, hopefully see you soon ! ! !
author: Dragan P.

description: My daughter and I had breakfast on our first morning in San Francisco. We had to wait to get in, but once in, we had a great breakfast, severed by friendly people.  It was worth the wait.
author: Louise W.

description: Very good food. Big breakfast menu with interesting combinations. Reasonable prices. Great service.
author: Geoff J.

description: Delicious! My only complaint is that I left that afternoon and couldn't return the next morning! I got the Turkey Famous, and my husband and son each got the Home Plate Run. It was all very good, very quick. We had a short wait to sit, but it was worth it.
author: Steph D.

description:
In town for a few days, I looked up breakfast places next to my hotel and found Home Plate only a few blocks away.  

On the specials insert, they had an item I've never seen before - Bangkok Frittata.  I've never seen anything like it so naturally that's what I ordered.  I don't know, I had to be the only one that ordered that because I saw it generated a lot of lively discussions in the back.

Anyway, it was amazing.  Absolutely delicious.  Who would have thunk it, but combo of Thai spices and ingredients in an Italian setting actually rocks.  The potato carrot pancakes were also great.  I think I might actually come back here two more times for the remaining two days I am here because I cannot imagine this dish was easy to pull off, but the chef clearly has to chops to pull of just about anything.
author: Vadim G.

description: Small dining area (you're lucky if there's no wait) but worth it if there is - friendly, prompt service and such a fresh, high quality, tasty and well prepared breakfast!  Complimentary scones while you wait (with homemade jams) and many diverse options including several styles of eggs benedict, seafood inspired dishes, home plate specials (pancake/waffle or french toast with eggs and meat) and super-stuffed omelettes.  Carrot/potato pancakes are a must try and we didn't have the dulce de leche pancakes but they sounded delicious.
author: Liz S.

description: Oh hell yes.  Found this on a best brunch list and because of aforementioned list figured it would be a cutesy, brunch-y looking place.  Was surprised to get there and find an old-school-looking diner.  A bit of a wait at Saturday around 11 but only like 10 minutes.  Staff was pleasant, seated us and gave us our scones.  So far so good.  Then the magic.  We shared a couple of things- the chorizo scrambled eggs which were great, but the best thing was the crab avocado sandwich which I believe was a special.  Basically like an avocado toast on steroids.  Served as a closed sandwich on perfectly lightly toasted buttered bread, a TON of crab, avocado and delightfully seasoned.  I am so very sad I live in New York and can't go back next weekend go get another.
author: Jennifer B.

description: Very very good food. Great service. Next time we come back to SF we will definitely come back. Thank you Home Plate
author: Jim H.

description: I just love this place, and the friendly staff. I come here often, two or three times a week, and I enjoy the consistency of the quality of the food and the service. Breakfast Starter and the Garden Omelet are my go to breakfast dishes. With the complimentary scone, an egg dish with substitute of freshly cut fruit I leave the place happy and satisfied. Courteous and friendly staff makes all this experience even better!
author: Hakan E.

description:
If you love brunch, this place is sure to hit a home run with it's home plate frittata and just about anything.  The warm, fluffy scones with sweet assorted preserves made of strawberry and mango are complimentary and scrumptious!  None of the stale, hard, and dry scones that you find elsewhere comes close to the ones at Home Plate.  Let's not forget the delicious potato-carrot pancakes, which are like latkes, served with apple sauce and sour cream.  The orange juice sweetens the meal along with a variety of specials.  

Service is fast and friendly.  The ambiance is small, cozy and homey.  The lines can make you wait a bit, but turnover is fast and not as bad as the other places in the city.
author: Jenny L.

description:
This is a small little place and there was a line outside when we got there. I was afraid there would be a long wait, but about 5 mins later we were in. The restaurant is pretty small and packed tightly, but it's not obtrusive or uncomfortable. The service was great and the food arrived extremely fast. 

I had the SPECIAL SCRAMBLE, which comes with Home Plate chicken sausage, mushrooms, green onions, cheddar cheese, tomatoes, herbs & your choice of hash browns or potato pancakes. I chose the potato pancakes. The nice added bonus was the fact that you're given a free & warm mini scone with a small dish that has mango and strawberry jam. 

Everything was hot & steaming and delicious! 

Thanks Home Plate! Your meal kicked off a day at Alcatraz and Coit Tower off nicely & many thanks to the thousands of Yelpers who rated this place.
author: Darren K.

description:
This place is so good that when I need a hangover cure of protein, fat, and all that is mother-loving great, I drive all the way out from my neighborhood, circle the entire area for a parking spot, cuss out yuppies in Priuses (Priii?) trying to take my spot, and dropkick Gucci/LV-wearing MILFs on the street blocking the way with their oversized luxury baby strollers to my destination. 

Seriously, it's that good.  The first time I had a bite of their crab cake benedict, I think my heart exploded from the hollandaise flooding its fatty goodness throughout my body, while my mouth simultaneously orgasmed from the shock of such a delicious, hot, steaming crispy-salty-savory-smooth-piece-of-melt-in-your-mouth-nirvana.

Great service, to boot, but the place is really small and tables are packed.  This inevitably results in you getting bunched next to recent college grads who are treating it like sorority gossip night while you check your pants to see if you made a stain through your shorts from the awesome food sex you're having.  Kinda embarrassing, but hey, I'm not from the hood so I just play it off with a bro-five to anyone who notices.
author: Sam W.

description: I used to love this place, but I went this morning and the service was terrible. Terrible to the point that I doubt I'll be back. Food is decent, but not enough to to recover from the bad taste the service left in my mouth. Our server never brought out scones. When we asked about them after our food had come out, he threw some on a plate without butter or jam. I had to ask for the butter. My toddler's eggs never came out, but we were still charged for them. Most decent places would bring a toddler's simple order out first, but clearly there was no consideration here. I ordered medium OJ, received a small, but was still charged for the medium plus the eggs that we never received. It was just an unpleasant experience with never an acknowledgement, smile, or even a word from our server. Luckily there was a sweet female server that offered to refill our coffee, otherwise I'd say we had pretty much no service at all. What a shame. Will definitely stop recommending this place to friends and visitors.
author: Naomi W.

description: Unexpectedly good. This place is not flashy and we would not have gone in if it hadn't been right across from the cheap hotel we were staying at. The food is good and quick. The service is great. The place is small, but they move people in and out quickly. There was a line both mornings we went, but you never had to wait more then 20 minutes.
author: Kristin K.

description: We got to the restaurant and were seated in a place for for we were two. Five minutes later a party of five Cayman and they asked us to move I said no the guy kept insisting but I did not move from that point on the service was terrible and the people were miserable
author: Rob D.

description:
I was there on dec 22, 2013...

service was very nice and friendly....
I had eggs benedict with turkey and food was very delicious....
coffee was good....

definitely we are coming back....
author: Bidik T.

description: What a cute little spot!  The portions were huge!  The scones were delicious and so were the jams. My only complaint is the portions could have been smaller to make it a little more affordable. The toasted almond French toast was very tasty.
author: Gretchen G.

description: I'm not sure how this place earned four stars but I can honestly say that 2 stars is the best I can offer for my breakfast. It started out well with great scones, but my eggs and bacon weren't good quality, locally sourced tasting like I enjoy and my toast wasn't hot enough to melt my butter. I also had hash browns that were oily and under seasoned. I might have caught them on an off day, but I really didn't enjoy the food enough to try it a second time.
author: Ann J.

description: After immersing ourselves in rehabbed houses and restaurants only to be hit with their associated prices, Home Plate was a very refreshing escape. The food and staff was amazing and I highly recommend stopping by for a breakfast that tastes great, was cooked perfectly, and doesn't require frills to artificially inflate prices.
author: Jonathan K.

description: Awesome service.  Amazing food. Can't beat the price.   The only thing bad is that there can be a long wait.  But believe me.. its worth it!!
author: John G.

description:
Great little family business. Never got to come here in the past, but the current family (a thai family) are friendly and efficient. 

The (complementary) mini scones served with strawberry and mango preserves (in a yin/yang plate) are delightful. 

The potato-carrot pancakes are very good. Wish they were bigger/thicker. Perfect with the sour cream and apple sauce on top.

Standard breakfast fare including omelets, pancakes and various benedicts (regular, crab, florentine, smoked salmon) are well done, with the key ingredient - the hollandaise sauce done correctly. I got the Steak and eggs today and everything was done well, the steak was cooked perfectly medium, the eggs were fluffy and the hash browns nice and crispy. 

Place is small and can get crowded so expect to wait (usually not long) and be patient as the food comes quickly as soon as you do get a seat.
author: Dom L.

description:
I very rarely write reviews, but after leaving this restaurant today shaking mad, I had to say something. An hour after being seated, my husband and I's food came to the table, but we were still waiting for my son's food. At this point I lost my patience and had to say something to the waitress. She proceeded to explain that it was a full house, and that I had to see where she was coming from. Honestly I didn't care at that point. Waiting 1 hour for breakfast food that is just average is totally unacceptable! I don't even wait that long at fancy restaurants!! We left with our food to go, paying full price, and with a hungry 4 year old with no food!!
The one star is for the average food.
Needless to say I will never be eating at this place again, especially since there are SO MANY more wonderful places to eat in the city.
author: Cat F.

description:
Decent place, but not the best I've ever had. Having said that, I do think this place offers solid breakfast food at good prices. 

The menu offered a wide variety of items and they had a number of tasty looking specials on the white board.
author: Stacy B.

description: No frill, inexpensive breakfast and brunch spot! The menu is huge, lots of variety, generous portions, reasonable pricing and free scones with homemade jam to start you off...What could be better? We didn't even have to wait in line for a table. I also noticed that they had a variety of juices and also had alcoholic beverages on the menu. Will most definitely be back!
author: Adrianna C.

description:
Yummy breakfast joint!!

Family Owned. Original owners sold the business to another Family and the Customer Service Courtesy has not decreased.

They come w/ complimenary homemade scones...yum!!

Home-Run Special - Waffle, Short Stack of Pancake or French Toast, 2 Eggs any style, 2 strips of applewood smoked bacon, ham, turkey, pork sausage link, spicy andouille sausage, or Home Plate chicken sausage patty - $8.25

Garden Special - Tomatoes, mushcrooms, spinach, onions, green onions, avocado, cheddar cheese, serve with potato-carrot pancakes or hash brown & toast - $8.50

Complimentary Homemade Scones
http://static1.px.yelpcdn.com/bphoto/gLui8Ko4HXr_u-STM6t7eA/l

Home-Run Special
http://static1.px.yelpcdn.com/bphoto/DhWs87zka2CL1gNZqsBobA/l

Garden Omelette
http://static1.px.yelpcdn.com/bphoto/3cLwZ8-JrCMEO2rCqZKT_g/l

(Thursday, January 28, 2010)
author: Kenny C.

description: I absolutely love this place. It's small but despite the size, the service and the taste of the food is absolutely incredible. I came with a family of four, and waited about the same time as iHop, which is across the street. We got in and got scones before our meal came. The scones were great and definitely a family favorite. With waffles, pancakes, and French toast around the table, we left Home Plate with happy tummies.
author: Jordan W.

description:
You'd probably think you'd stumbled into a Chinese restaurant seeing that 90% of the staff are Asian. However, this breakfast establishment is far from Chinese, and American as they come. I don't think there is a private lot, so you'll have to find metered parking nearby. The meters also take credit cards.

The restaurant is a bit small, and when we stopped by (Sat. morning), it was quite busy. However, we were fortunate enough to be seated right away, since there is a waiting list system and those on the list have to wait outside amongst the chilling morning air. 

Everything about our experience went smoothly. From the excellent service to the delicious food. The complimentary appetizer scones were amazing. We considered buying some for the road. We ordered traditional omelet and pancake breakfast dishes with the usual side dishes of potatoes, sausage, bacon, etc. The food tasted fresh, hot, and satisfying. 

The prices were similar to most mid-scale breakfast restaurants, around $10 per person.
author: Andy P.

description:
Hands down the best corned beef ive ever had in my life. They make it in strips! You've never had corned beef like this.

Go and eat it!
author: A B.

description: A great value for breakfast. A short walk from our hotel, and we just wanted quality breakfast food that didn't break the bank. Perfect, everything was delicious! Quick service, and loved those scones with jam.
author: Robin B.

description:
A friend of mine recommend this breakfast joint while on a trip to the City. We were out late, so craving some delicious food to get our energy up.

It was a short wait because we had a large group, but as we sat down they gave us homemade Biscuits or Scones? that were to die for. We got Mimosas and fresh squeezed juice. It was really refreshing to get something different than coffee and bacon.

The service was very good, and it a pretty clean bathroom as well (always important while in San Francisco). The carrot pancakes were very good, and I believe I had the chorizo breakfast burrito which was very good as well. Best place for breakfast in the Marina in my opinion so far!
author: Mike H.

description: Great food! The service was very good. If you are in the San Fran area check this place out.
author: Gina G.

description:
I've been wanting to go to this place for quite some time after reading the reviews and 2 weeks ago I was finally able to go here! Lucky enough to snag a seat before a big crowd came in. 

Their scones..... are amazing! Not to mention it's free. They're freshly baked, not too sweet and melts in your mouth. 

I had the crab omelet for brunch and it was good! Very generous with the crab meat my only complaint was I almost missed out on the avocado because it was all on one end of the omelet. But nevertheless, the egg was cooked perfectly well and the potato-carrot pancake that came with it was tasty.
author: Gordon O.

description:
Wanted a quick delicious breakfast in San Fran while vacationing with 3 picky kids. They had traditional breakfast options as well as some unusual ones that sounded DELICIOUS! If only I could have tried more options. The free scones were yummy, I wish they gave more. Fresh squeezed orange juice... YUM! Same goes for the chorizo, home plate run, pancakes, hash browns... I do recommend asking for bacon well done, only if you tend to like crispy bacon (like myself.)
Cute small place, plenty of cheap parking around. I enjoyed it!
author: Gaby M.

description: This place was pretty good.  I visited it because II was at the motel next door.  I had a waffle with chocolate chips on top plus strawberries and whipped creme.  My friend had an omelet and hash browns.  He thought it was okay good, nothing too special.  WHy is juice so expensive in SF? It was $5 for a cup of orange juice.  They also offer watermelon juice which is a plus.
author: Chloe K.

description: This was amazingly good food, especially the complimentary Blueberry scones!  Decor is a little simple, but staff and food were A+.
author: Amber D.

description: Some friends and I do a sojourn in the Marin Headlands once a season.  Home Plate is always our meet up point in the morning and going there has become a fun ritual.  Service is fast, food plentiful and tasty.  I usually get an omelette to stock up on protein for the hike.  Prices are also very reasonable (usually around $10 including tip for an omelette).
author: Seth E.

description:
So it was about 8:00am...i had just woke up from a strange dream of being served king crab legs and then driving onto a bridge and making a strange u-turn...

I got out of bed, and drove to pick up my friend Dee. She needed some help with an errand and I was available so sure why not. So we decided to grab some breakfast.

She had suggested Home Plate. I ordered a Blackstone Benedict? I believe that is what it was called. Its basically like eggs benedict. But its a poached egg over bacon and tomato with hollaindase sauce. Dee ordered the polenta with eggs and sausage.

Whats neat is that have serve you scones before your dishes. The scones were nice and tasty. And very shortly thereafter our dishes arrived. I cut into my Blackstone and watched the yolk pour out from that poached egg. It was beautiful...i love watching half cooked eggs open up with that runny yolk..It was pretty good. Next to my benedict was 2 potato carrot pancakes. These things were really really salty. Next time I will opt for regular pancakes instead.

I got to try some of Dee's polenta, and it had nice pieces of mushroom in there. The polenta is cooked over a pan so taht it has a nice light crunch when you bite into it.

Service is good, food is pretty good. I'll definitely come back sometime again..but taht depends when I decide to wake up that early for breakfast again. Other than the salty pancakes I had, the service really brought them that extra star. I'm thinking 3 star in my head but since they were so nice, and came around twice to fill up my coffee that definitely deserves an extra star.

Thank you Dee for the good breakfast, and thank you Home Plate for the tasty eggy goodness.
author: phillip w.

description:
03.25.12

Ahh, Sunday morning after a storm. The air is fresh, the ground is wet, and there are smiles on pedestrians. Me, I was just hungry.

In comes Home Plate. Two cups of coffee (with multiple refills), a home plate frittata, and a crab benedict and we were on our way to be amongst the happy campers on the street.

Super low key, quick and friendly service, and the most non-Marina place in the Marina that you can find. Like!

Total damage for two: $33
author: Jenny L.

description: Just what a brunch should be - delicious, fast service, inexpensive, and comforting! Got the crab melt special sandwich here while suffering a particularly nasty hangover, and it was very good. Side fries and salad were good too, and the complimentary scone was such a wonderful surprise- didn't see it advertised on the menu and it and the jams it came with were really tasty. Definitely coming back here again, better than the other brunch spots in the surrounding area.
author: Sarah B.

description: Love this place. Gotta get the fresh baked scones every single time.  Be prepared to wait because there place is very small. It's family run so leave a big tip!
author: Christian H.

description:
Just had breakfast on Friday at this cute little cafe in the Marina. Being from New Orleans I love Mom and Pop restaurants also. We had no wait time, wonderful service, and it's a very clean restaurant. We had almond French toast, a shrimp omelette and an American breakfast. Their complimentary scone while you wait for your meal was a pleasant touch also. it was delicious.  Prices were great too! 

My friend that I was with discovered this place about a month ago while walking down Lombard St. I'm so glad she stumbled upon it! I highly recommend Home Plate and plan to return the next time I'm in San Francisco.
author: Jeannette N.

description:
This is my go-to place for breakfast in the marina. Home Plate is run by a very nice Asian family and I've gone so many times they know what I want before I even enter. The little raisin scones as well as two types of jam they give you as an appetizer for you breakfast are to die for. You may also buy their scones for $1.00 each if you want them in bulk for some extra for your meal(they are worth it). 

I get the banana-walnut pancakes. I like my syrup very very hot, and they bring me a little side dish with syrup that is nice and hot for my liking. The prices are very reasonable for being down by the marina. I would recommend this to anyone in the area, and those on Lombard who don't wait to eat an the IHOP across the street.
author: Patrick M.

description:
This cute diner is absolutely amazing!!

I took my friend here for brunch and we both enjoyed it immensely.  There's a clipboard right outside the door to write your name down, so do that right away because it gets busy!

My friend and I both agreed that our favorites of the day were the scones and the potato-carrot pancakes! 
The scones were still warm and they came with 2 kinds of jam: mango and strawberry! I could've eaten a whole basket of them! 
The potato-carrot pancakes were a pleasant surprise as well! I didn't really know what to expect...were they like regular pancakes with bits of potato and carrot mixed in? Turns out they were more like hashbrowns, but better! They come with an apple sauce plus sour cream and let me tell you, eat the pancakes with it!! I don't even like sour cream, but it tasted mighty scrumptious! 

I got a veggie omelet and I enjoyed it a lot! It's big, so I barely finished half. It was generously stuffed, so you definitely get your money's worth.

The inside is pretty cool cause they have old school baseball photos and articles, as well as gorgeous framed photos of places around San Francisco! I approve! :)

The staff is nice enough. They made sure our water glasses were filled!

The only complaint I have was that it was cold. My friend and I were seated right by the door, so whenever people would come in or leave, I'd get a blast of cold air. I guess you can't be picky though since it was the next table available and you don't want to wait around for a "better" table.

I'm coming back for sure!!
author: Kei H.

description: It's a good breakfast place if you are in the area. I'm not a huge breakfast fan but the scones were really good and so was the French toast. Not too expensive either so you can get a good meal for a good price.
author: Jeremy L.

description: You will definitely be a member of the clean plate club here. I certainly was. Get anything with the homemade chicken sausage, it's delicious!
author: Moe O.

description:
Man oh man is this place great. American breakfast served up by the nicest Thai folks you'll ever meet. This small restaurant  is a gem. An assortment of pancakes, waffles along with standard egg dishes can be had here. And homemade scones - yummy & warm. But, beware - the secret about this place is out and sometimes, you'll have to wait to get a table.

Two thumbs, waaaaaay up! :)
author: Danny L.

description: I seriously don't understand why this place has so many stars. I went here for lunch while visiting the area and really wished I had gone somewhere else. My server was nice and the scone was tasty, but that's where it stops. The food was under cooked and bland.
author: Laura W.

description:
Finally got to try this place out since I don't live nearby, got here at 8.30 on Sunday and there was no line. I guess we made it at the right time because about 30mins later they started to get busy!

We ordered crab cake Benedict with potato pancake, breakfast starter with chicken Apple sausage and OJ. Everything were great. Poach eggs in Benedict were cook perfect, OJ was really fresh and the sausage was so good that I had to order another one as a side order :-)

Complimentary scone was super yummy. Normally I hate scone because it's always dry but here was soft and their Apple and raspberry sauce were good too.

I also love their potato pancake. 

We were lucky to find a meter parking spot really close to the restaurant and it was free on Sunday!!  Oh forgot to mention that service was awesome too :-) thank you

Very satisfied!!!!!!
author: Sirikanya p.

description:
I love breakfast....and you can't miss out on this breakfast!!!!!
Make sure to get there early on the weekends and your have a bit of time.  
The service is great,  selection of breakfast food is outstanding...you wont be disappointed.
author: Quinn S.

description: This place was amazing! Service was fast, friendly and attentive! Try the crab omelette, it was delicious!
author: Andrew P.

description:
I usually know my hood.  In fact, I usually have a pretty darn good opinion of where to eat locally.  Having been a HUGE fan of Hard Knox Cafe in the Dogpatch near my old hood of Potrero, Home Plate has a few similar elements that I enjoyed at this establishment as well.

The service is super friendly and attentive.  My coffee never got cold or low.  My water was always filled.  The food came out on time, and all of it with a smile and a nod.  

The food was also just as pleasing.  Chorizo, plentiful. Bananas and walnuts in the pancakes, blended to perfection.  My Turkey Famous, satisfying and not terribly filling.  

Looking for a local food place with a VERY short wait and extremely satisfying food?  Come on here and fast.  Don't worry, tho.  You won't have to slide in, you're always safe going here!
author: Andy S.

description: As we read the menu, we were given a freshly baked scone with 2 flavors of jam. YUM. I had an egg white omelet with chicken, avocado, mushrooms, salsa, tomatillo sauce and jack cheese, and it came with 2 potato-carrot pancakes topped with sour cream and applesauce. The pancakes stole the show (so good! don't pass those up...) but the omelet was delicious, too. My boyfriend ordered French toast, scrambled eggs and toast and wasn't really blown away, but in all fairness, who orders boring French toast and scrambled eggs!? #rookie
author: Brianna T.

description: there were two of us that went in for breakfast.The owner of the restaurant Gave us  table  and gave us menus. we were waiting about five minutes to order when he came over and said he had a party for 5 that he could fit at are table that just came in. he want us to  move to an awful table in the middle of the restaurant I said no. he kept insisting. I told him I was not moving.  he didn't come back for 15 minutes to take are order and were very nasty to us. when the food finally did come it was cold. The best part about this restaurant was getting up walking out the door and closing it behind us. if I could give it No stars I would.
author: Bruce B.

description:
We where on our way to the SF bridge and do some sight seeing, but before we did that ..breakfast was on my mind. Decided to stop at I hop since I didn't know of any good local spots to eat. Trying to find parking I looked across the street and I see a little spot called "Home Plate" . Caught my attention and drove around the block a couple of times until I found a parking spot. 

I walk in and noticed it was a small family owned restaurant. I had nothing to lose so I decided to try it out. I wrote down my name in a paper pad outside the restaurant. The restaurant was packed but it was only about 10 minutes until we where sat down.

The menu had a lot of food to choose from , but the breakfast stood out. I ordered French toast with Strawberries and ham. I couldn't resist but I had to order a mimosa. Delicious! My friend ordered a Home-Run special..decent breakfast and the price was great! 

May I say that the scones where awesome!! I can eat those with coffee and ill be good. The fresh strawberry and mango jam where delicious! 

Ill def. come back here when I go back up North.
author: Claudia V.

description:
Very crowded on the weekends, and there's limited seating. Came here on a Sunday at 2:00 pm and there were at least 5 other groups waiting outside for a table, so we ended up going to the iHop across the street for our hangover cures.

Still interested, we came back the next Wednesday and there was a table waiting for us. Free scones with homemade jam and I was sold! The omelettes were fantastic and stuffed full of vegetables, and the service was great. Never had an empty glass of water or coffee the entire time we were there. 

Pros: Great prices, awesome service, and good food.

Cons: Limited seating & small dining area
author: Brian K.

description: We had a huge breakfast and it all was great. Coffee and banana supreme great. Waffle and fruit wonderful. Eggs Bacon chicken apple sausage and hash browns all good. The complimentary scones were great.
author: SJ O.

description: This place is a gem! Nice home/family feel, and it's filled with locals who are willing to wait outside to be seated despite several other breakfast/brunch places within view. Obviously that's got to mean something, and it did! Absolutely delicious food! The fresh baked scones and hand made tortillas were an extra special touch! Quick, friendly, and attentive service. A must stop breakfast place if you're in the area!
author: Tim R.

description: We were looking for a good breakfast place outside the hotel while staying in San Francisco. We found this place on Yelp and were glad we did! Service was good and fast and food was incredible! Almond French toast, yes please!
author: Tracy M.

description: Terrible place. Food wasnt fresh. Decor was terrible.
author: Joaquin R.

description:
Came here twice for lunch, both times very satisfied.  

I love the freshly squeezed juices here.  I tried the orange and grapefruit juices and I love them both!  The homemade scones were awesome with the sauces that they provided, however I wish they were warmer next time they come out.  I would recommend the omelet and hash browns.  I don't like the potato-carrot pancakes though, but that is just personal preference.  The food here is very comforting and the ingredients are definitely fresh.  I recommend trying out this place for breakfast because it's a gem hidden in the city :)
author: Matt M.

description:
I saw this tiny little breakfast cafe here on Yelp and decided to give it try today.  
Wow, was I impressed!  The waitstaff were very friendly, the food was inexpensive, delicious and served quickly.  I even left my hat inside and my waiter chased me down two blocks to return it. 
I will definitely be coming back.
author: Charles M.

description: this place is awsome, really friendly service ,and the pancakes were excellent, highly recommend
author: Tyron T.

description: Visiting the area from NJ and decided to try this place out. Hands down the best breakfast I've ever had, I never wrote a Yelp review but after having breakfast here I thought it was that necessary, I'm actually in the place waiting for the check as I write this. Service was great and I recommend the Eggs with Shrimp, along with the Bangkok frittata.
author: Yanush A.

description: Got there before the 3 p.m. closing. Haven't been here since waaaaay back with the first original owners (probably 30 years ago!)~ Scones are still being served and were warm, fresh, and fairly delicious with seemingly homemade jams to accompany. The rest of the food was ok. They're putting in the effort to be a good brunch spot, but my potato-carrot pancakes were flat and soggy, frittata needed salt. Dining mate was underwhelmed by their combo. Better than your average iHop or Denny's, but not worth the long drive and search for parking.
author: T. W.

description:
Definitely don't judge a book by it's cover here.  Small little restaurant that seems to have been here forever.  They have a huge breakfast menu - but when I ever was scrolling down the page and saw......Fritata - decision was made. 

Apparently this is popular in California but I've never seen a fritata on a menu over here on the East Coast.  Maybe it's the whole trend of paleo living (which is why I've been eating fritatas).  Anyways I got a fritata that had homemade chicken sausage in it, along with some veggies, and cheese - amazing.

Not sure how you get homemade chicken sausage but this place pulls it off.  It was so so good.  

And don't forget about the homemade scones that come complimentary.  Homeplate was my perfect brunch place.  Can you come to Boston?
author: Kelsey S.

description: A great breakfast place! Probably my new favorite in the city. Their crab omelette was phenomenal and great service as well. I would highly recommend this place for breakfast/brunch if you are visiting San Francisco.
author: Dana M.

description: Best brunch place in the city by far!! The complimentary scones are amazing and the menu range is awesome and a bit overwhelming in a good way! Portions are big and the service is great! Get there early though because this place is packed and popular:)
author: Heide B.

description:
Decent little spot in the Marina. Nothing special but good old fashion breakfast food. Prices were acceptable as well as the portions. I got the corned beef hash and was happy with it. Big portions of meat and potatoes! 

My girlfriend got the oatmeal and was very happy. Also the complimentary scones were delicious. They should make those bigger and I would have had that as my breakfast. 

All in all I would recommend.
author: Andrew D.

description: Our first breakfast at Home Plate and it was worth every penny. From the bottomless coffee to the complimentary fresh scones to the actual breakfast all added up to a 5 star experience.
author: Detlef P.

description: nice breakfast place..gave homemade scones with meal. I liked the eggs over easy I ordered with the spicy śausage and toast.
author: j. l.

description:
There are no scones better than what Home Plate serves. Absolutely the best in the US! The dunge crab benedict - perfect! And now, the Angry Benedict - prawns with spicy, hot sauce! Fantastic!

Service - exemplary.  Price - reasonable. One of SF's BEST!
author: J G.

description:
Simply the best brunch I had in San Francisco.
Omelettes and pancakes are so good!!!
Every time you go they offer you small hot scones with delicious jam.
The bad point is that you usually have to wait because it is a small busy place.
author: Fabien L.

description:
It has been a long while since my last visit and I am not sure why. I always liked this place!

Friday, 1/6/12, 11AM and Home Plate has a few seats available. Not the case on weekends, and justifiably so!

Nothing fancy in the decor; in fact viewed from the outside it looks like an average "Mission" joint, only HP is in the Marina district. You don't get too much of a hint (unless you are reading the reviews) of what is to come until you sit down. Don't you love it when your server brings the menu and asks if anyone wants coffee / tea etc.?

Everyone already knows that and it is great to have some coffee to drink while you are looking at the menu. By the way, I ordered decaf (I know! I have ruined my elite standing as a reviewer with extraordinary taste buds - and taste; but then I have been given the ultimatum; quit the caffeine or start a regimen of tranquilizers by YOU KNOW WHO) and when the coffee arrived I thought for sure I was going to have to remind the server my of my order. Three cups of coffee and she (seemingly) selected cups randomly and put them on the table. Before I could smile and ask, she smiled at me and said; "decaf!" I love it.

Great selection of breakfast possiblities, and I'll mention just a few. Pancakes;buttermilk, corn, oatmeal, buckwheat
Potato / carrot pancakes
Plenty of egg options
Cantaloupe juice??  You have to just love** seeing that even if you don't order it
Scones, which by the way everyone at the table gets a free one to enjoy while waiting for their order, that are quite good.

The service, food and the pleasant demeanor are all superior which adds up to a FIVE star experience. 
If you are able to do a weekday visit you should, however if you can only go on the weekend I say, go, the wait is worth it.

I did mention the great service right?
PS
**Among the individuals sitting at my table was the infamous "Jeff The Brooklyn Bully" He really enjoyed himself, and he is a tough critic. The only flaw he would have found; the above mentioned Cantaloupe juice. I put my thumb over his menu covering up the words that would have sent him screaming into the street. Of course it would have been his loss. Double loss actually, his wallet was in his jacket on the back of the chair.
author: robert g.

description:
I'll be honest. I really expected an American setting of a restaurant. To my surprise, this place is owned and run by Asians (nice find!).

I came here today with a bunch of my friends today for brunch on a wet late morning. I was taken back a bit by the small size of the restaurant, but I love the coziness it emits. I ordered the crab omelette with the potato-carrot cakes and wheat toast. The portion size (not only for my dish, but for all of our plates) was huge. The food tasted great and it was well worth the cost. The one compliment I have is that I was pleasantly surprised at the abundance of crabmeat in my omelette; I guess that's what filled me up so quickly.

Another plus? Each entree comes with a free scone with jams. Delish!!
author: Bonita K.

description:
Had sunday brunch here with a signif and a couple of friends.  The wait was a bit longer because there was six of us, and they can seat twenty people, maybe. 

Once we were seated, we ordered smoothies and juice drinks around.  Warning: the smalls are REALLY small, like shot-like small.  The medium is good sized, water sized.  And the smoothies were put in the large cups.  The juices are really fresh squeezed and a nice opening to a brunch.

After ordering, they brought out fresh raisin scones that practically melt in your mouth with a side of homemade mango and guava jam.  If anything, go for the scones, they are to die for.  I would order a box of those if i could.

In any case, I got the home platter with a thin crisp waffle, two sausage links, and scrambled eggs.  The syrup was liquidy like maple syrup, but I'm not sure if it was.  The waffle was very good, soft and crisp.  The sausage and eggs were sausage and eggs - wouldn't say they were super special.

Overall, everyone seemed to enjoy their meal and it was a good experience.  Would recommend looking at the specials board because they had some good stuff there as well.
author: My An V.

description:
Oh fellow yelpers, how could you steer a girl so wrong! This place is awful! It started out bad and only got worse. In fact, I can only recall one other place in the city where I had a breakfast that was worse than what I had at Home Plate (see Americana Grill on Balboa--ICK). 

For starters, we signed in on the clipboard and the guy said it would probably be about 10 minutes. So my boyfriend popped in to the antique store next door while we waited. About 5 minutes later the guy said the table was ready but because we both weren't there he had to give it to the people next on the list. I told him that my boyfriend was just next door, but it didn't matter. I have no tolerance for dumb, and when establishments put in place illogical and backward policies, I say you can keep your damn food. 

When we finally were seated, I noticed that the floor was filthy, and when one of the servers dropped a ketchup bottle on the floor and then simply put it back on the table, we knew not to touch the ketchup bottle. 

At this point, we got our scones, which are included with everything. The scones were very good--not too heavy or buttery. And then we waited. And waited some more. And waited a while more. My boyfriend finally got his food, and then our neighbor table got their food, and then a few more minutes went by and I finally got my food. My garden omelet, which I asked for well done and came out runny, was completely flavorless, save for the slight flavor of the oil in which it was cooked and the sour cream that came with the flat and equally flavorless potato carrot pancakes. My boyfriend's pumpkin pancakes were so burned they were almost black, so he asked for another. The second time they came out they were still raw in the middle! 

The servers were very nice and they did take the pancakes off the check, which was a nice gesture. But by the time we finally got our check, we were so over this experience. 

If you just want to grab a couple scones, this might be a good place for a swing-by. But otherwise, the IHOP across the street probably has better food (and this is spoken by someone who, as a rule, does not eat at chain restaurants).
author: Amy B.

description: Read Yelp reviews, excellent place for breakfast, not too long of a wait to get in, free scones served with breakfast, they were very tasty, had the eggs Benedict with ham and hash browns, eggs and Hollandaise sauce were perfect, rest of the party enjoyed their meals also, I would definitely go back again
author: Don E.

description: Everything was delicious particularly the potato carrot pancakes, served with sour cream and applesauce. Even the coffee was great.  The homemade chicken sausage was unique and tasty too.
author: Monica G.

description:
Warm homemade scones.  Yes, warm homemade scones.  They serve them to you as an appetizer to your breakfast. 

"Appetizer to breakfast?", you ask.

Yes, appetizer to breakfast.  Complete with a homemade compote and butter.

Everything on the menu here is good.  But everything on the chalkboard menu is even better!

One particular morning, I ordered the crab cakes benedict.  Lump crab cakes!  My meal was singing :)

Parking in this area can be a bit challenging and if you arrive at the wrong time you may encounter the clipboard line.  But, if you're looking for a down home (asian-run) breakfast spot, try Homeplate!
author: Rochelle D.

description: In a neighborhood known for having a reputation of being a little pretentious, Home Plate is anything but.  It's a cozy little diner with maybe 10-12 tables max, and feels like a home cooked breakfast.  I ordered my staple 2 eggs over easy with hashbrowns (perfectly crisped), and the bacon was also crispy to perfection.  Yum.  Definitely my #1 breakfast spot in the Marina/Cow Hollow.
author: Mel G.

description:
DELICIOUS!!
Scones are the same since I last wnt here which was 10 years ago- no joke. The only reason it was off my radar simply was I was no longer in the neighborhood.

There lies nothing on the breakfast menu over 9 dollars and they have an amazing breakfast menu - 2 pages to be exact. 

 Frittatas are fantastic.

 Service is warm.

 So the place is cozy but totally worth the wait.

 Highly recommended.

The end.
author: Athena S.

description: Complimentary scone with jams was delicious. Coffee was sub par. Two eggs / "potato pancakes" (thin potato patties) / chicken apple sausage / English muffin although a Simple breakfast was perfect.
author: Adam P.

description: Excellent service.  They start you off with homemade scones and fruit butter--uber delicious.  They have a pretty comprehensive brunch menu; there is sure to be something for everyone.  I definitely had a hard time deciding what to get.  The space is kind of small, so there may be a short wait.
author: Jess H.

description:
Scones, hello folks I said scones!!!!
This cafe is a GEM we always eat breakfast here when in the city, service is very friendly and they always remember us when we come back. Food is awesome love their omelets and their almond French toast. My coffee cup is always full.
author: Dom P.

description: A wonderful spot for breakfast.  Great food, generous portions, reasonable pricing and great service.  The complimentary scone was delicious!
author: Jody H.

description:
Yum, I've loved this place since I moved to San Francisco and while it may not be the best brunch spot in the entire city, they have some really fantastic food and very affordably priced. 

I give this place five stars for the great combo of chill vibe, good prices, and those awesome scones are just one of the many great eats here.

The Potato Carrot Pancakes are great and the omlettes are pretty solid too.

Over the ten-plus years I've been going here I've had all sorts of menu items and everything is pretty solid.  It may not have the best ambiance and can get crowded, but for a chill brunch and if you happen to be in the Marina, this is definitely my fave spot in the hood!
author: Gene X.

description: I had the eggs florentine and added ham - it was pretty standard.  They have the potato carrot pancakes which was just ok.  Nothing that special.  They also serve a scone for free!  That's just ok too.  My husband got the chicken hash which lacked flavor - it was basically a big scramble.
author: Meredith K.

description: Home Plate is so good! They just renovated and the inside is super cute (you wouldn't assume from the outside). They give you free scones with your meal that are delicious! Outside of that, you can't go wrong. Everything on the menu is great and they also have great service. Can't wait to go back!
author: Ashley S.

description: Great place for great home made food in San Francisco! Excellent frittata and home made scones! It's an excellent little eatery on Lombard street.
author: Marcel V.

description: Sweet, friendly service.  Great crab melt sandwich special.  Love the fresh cantaloupe juice.  Tasty Scramble Special with sourdough toast and potato carrot pancakes.  We'll be back for more.
author: Geri S.

description: Been here a bunch for breakfast/brunch. Consistently a wait time on the weekends but it usually doesn't take too long. Our favorite part is the free warm scone at the beginning of the meal. Portions are pretty large for a reasonable price, but service is sometimes hit or miss. Definitely get the potato-carrot pancakes/latkes as your choice of side.
author: Ryan E.

description:
Excellent! 
My boyfriend and I went here for breakfast yesterday after I have had this place bookmarked for over a year. 

The mister had some type of chicken omlette thing that he loved- and I had a special which was crab cake Benedict, which was on point! We shared a chicken sausage which was very yummy as well. The staff was friendly and the wait for a table wasn't too long. 

This is a perfect place for Sunday breakfast or a hangover rescue site. I will definitely be back. :D nom(3).
author: Stacy S.

description: Nice place for breakfast in the Marina. I had the Marco Polo, which is eggs benedict with tomatoes, avocado, and turkey. Absolutely delicious! I wasn't too excited with the potato and carrot pancakes though. They were really flat and a little oily for my liking. My boyfriend got eggs benedict as well but had hash browns on the side. The hash browns weren't too exciting for him either. They need better sides here. Other than that, great place.
author: Hana K.

description: Nice family owned business that was walking distance to our location, Days Inn. Ordered the Marco Polo. Poached eggs turkey, avocado, tomato, on an english muffin. Shared a buttermilk waffle. Free scones with sauce while waiting for food. No complaints at all. It only took us a few mins. I can understand how it could feel crowded inside here but no problem for us. Had a mimosa as well. Staff was very courteous and friendly. I would come back here next time I'm in SF and actually wake up early (heard the lines for waiting can be long) for breakfast.
author: Jason P.

description:
Everything was good. Nothing was spectacular, except I'd like to put in a good word for the complimentary scones served at the beginning of the meal. They were just perfect. 

I got the eggs benedict with spicy sauce - I recommend getting it on the side as not to overwhelm yourself. It was thick and tasty, but better to dip. 

I also asked for just 1 pancake, which they don't do, but did for me. It was sweet of them. The pancake was delicious. 

Stop by and you'll enjoy yourself, but you probably won't make it your favorite.
author: Jeff M.

description: Bummer. I read all the great reviews and must have hit it on an off day.  Our food arrived in three phases, so we did not start eating at the same time or even close. I had a frittata, which was unremarkable. It felt like the place must have changed hands or the cook was off.
author: David W.

description: Beyond fantastic service! Food was fast and delicious! My server was "KONG" according to my ticket but the two servers were a well-oiled choreographed team! I will be back next visit to SF!!
author: Mighty M.

description: Fantastic brunch place on Lombard. Nothing fancy, just good diner cooking. From benedicts to frittatas you really can't go wrong. Most of the entrees come with potato carrot pancakes served with a dollop of applesauce and sour cream which are delicious, much like latkes. Complimentary scones with house made mango and strawberry jam adds a nice touch as well.
author: Ed L.

description:
You see that IHOP across the street? That place doesn't exist. It's your imagination. Why? Because the pure awesomeness of this restaurant outshines anything within a couple blocks. And that's just because of the food. 

You can definitely tell that this place has quality at work. I've been here for breakfast a couple times, and I love their omelettes...they're enormous compared to other diners, and the ingredients always taste fresh.

Their scones are also delicious, always fresh and gourmet, served with jam and butter.

And their hot chocolate is legit:  Steamed Milk + Ghirardelli Hot Chocolate.

While the place may seem small in comparison to an IHOP or a Mel's Drive-in, the food and service are incomparable. The owners of this place are always polite, and I've never experienced anything under exceptional service. 

Also, like others have said, the quality of the food is incredible for the low price. This place is just wonderful.
author: Yi-Xin C.

description: I dig these mom and pop restaurants. It almost has the comfort of home, cept for the fact that I have to wear pants here. Anyway, got the frittata which fueled me up for the day.
author: John B.

description: The quality of the food and service are exceptional... ESPECIALLY for the incredibly low price. There's an IHOP across the street, but don't even think about going there. The pancakes here are considerably better and they're created with excellent ingredients. Home Plate does everything with care.
author: Reggie C.

description:
I was pleasantly surprised with this place!

Food: We both ordered Breakfast Starter.  This comes with two eggs, meat (bacon, sausage, or ham), potato-carrot pancakes or hashed potatoes, scone with jam, and bread!  My scramble eggs were perfectly cooked as I requested (soft).  And, wow!  The scone was really delicious with homemade jam!  The little potato-carrot pancakes were a nice addition to the plate.  Overall, very satisfying breakfast!

Services: Very friendly and quick.  Our order was immediately taken.  Coffee and scone came first really quickly.  While we were enjoying the delicious scone, they prepared the rest.  Upon finishing the scone, they brought eggs/meat/pancakes/bread.  Very organized and efficient service!  The servers were all nice and friendly.

Venue:  Cozy little place.  We took a table by the window.  With a lot of sunshine, breakfast tasted better!          

I would highly recommend this place!
author: M Y.

description: One word to describe this place-AWESOME!  They start with a menu in which it is hard to make a decision. I watched plates being delivered to other tables to help my choice. Shall I have pancakes with a mound REAL FRESH BLUEBERRIES poured on top, the meaty omelet that is bulging full, French toast...?  I decide on the 2 eggs with potato and carrot pancakes with HOMEMADE chicken sausage (are you kiddin me!). My mouth started watering just thinking of the meal I was about to have.  They bring coffe and homemade scones with homemade apple and berry jam!  Yummmy!  They should sell that jam and those scones-both were complimentary. My breakfast arrived and it did not disappoint.  I was reluctant to share but I did give up a bite of my chicken sausage to my wonderful spouse. He deserves it. The meal was OUTSTANDING. This place is one of San Francisco's hidden treasures! We are visiting from Seattle and we would most definitely come back for another great breakfast! Thumbs Up!
author: M M.

description: Really bad customer service for mediocre food.  I went to breakfast by myself and ordered bacon & eggs and 1 slice of french toast.  The food was okay.  I immediately told the waitress that I had ordered only 1 slice of French toast not a full order with 6 pieces.  She told me she had to check with the manager and came back and told me she had to charge me for the full order that they don't do side orders if she was unclear with my order she should have asked me.  I told her I wanted to speak with the manager I spoke with the manager explained that there was a misunderstanding, why would I order 2 full meals for myself?  She told me that she was going to charge me for the full order, 6 pieces of French toast plus the bacon & eggs. $28, I've worked at restaurants it would cost them nothing to take that off my bill.  Horrible customer service; I am telling everyone I know in the neighborhood about my bad experience; one person tells 10 people and so on.
author: Giselle R.

description: Great little spot in SF, fun walk from the marina. scones coffee and the home plate scrambles are worth checking out
author: Jessica N.

description:
Not sure how I missed Home Plate all of these years, but it has become my "go-to" breakfast/brunch place. Though the space is small and the chairs not made for anyone with back issues, the food is great, plentiful, and reasonably priced. Fresh ingredients, and many man options for veg-heads and non-beef eaters. They even have chicken hash, FFS!!! 
I have brought friends from all over the world to this place, and everyone loves it. The staff is especially friendly, even when  the house is packed. Yesterday two friends and I sat and yakked for about 3 hours, and the staff kept filling our coffee and water...and never gave us a dirty look lol. (We left an extra tip for the extra hospitality, FYI). I know that this was a business previously owned by others, but I for one have been really happy with Home Plate. Oh and they give complimentary scones for all!
author: roz A.

description:
I was in Apple Store purgatory and needed to kill time while those assholes at the Chestnut store fixed my computer for the 3rd time that week and decided to grab a bite here. I can not say enough about how great this place is. It literally made my day. No, my week. Check it. 

They start you off with a complimentary fresh scone that is light and fluffy and delightful served with 2 sensational homemade fruit spreads: mango and strawberry. Hello?! You had me at the scone. I ordered Eggs Blackstone, an awesome Benedict variation that is often hard to find at other brunch spots. The hollandaise was perfection, creamy with just a hint of lemon. The best I've had in a while. Maybe ever. 

Service was attentive. The environment clean and casual. The wait was about 10 minutes. And the food was so good, I could even ignore the inanities of the 6 blond sorority girls sitting next to me.  How did I live in SF for all those years and miss this place? Maybe because I think the Marina is full of d-bags and steer clear, but please DO NOT let that stop you from brunching here. You won't regret it.
author: Jennifer J.

description:
Best breakfast in San Francisco. This is no frills, no bs; just good friggin' food at a mom and pop. Hipsters keep out, please.

I've been coming here since I was 5 years old and enjoying their scones and potato carrot pancakes for the past 20 years.
author: R C.

description: The Angry Benedict, one of their specials, is great! Service was fast and the prices were reasonable. Clearly a great choice for brunch.
author: Christina D.

description: Hot blueberry scones !! And they are complimentary this is cool little brunch spot and gets pretty busy on the weekend but the food was good and even though they are busy they still come check on you. Basic good American breakfast joint
author: christina a.

description: You can never go wrong with Home Plate.  The best thing there is their scones and homemade jam.  I used to just by the scones to go when they were fresh out of the oven.  My friend and i went before a day in napa to give us a good base.  He had one of their specials with pancakes and sausage while i had the polenta.  The great thing was that they let him substitute the regular pancakes for the special pumpkin ones!! yay!!  My polenta was cooked perfectly.  Crispy and brown on the outside and smooth on the inside.  My new favorite thing from them!
author: Susan Z.

description:
I love this place.  They give you homemade free raisin scones with homemade fruit jelly that is just delicious.

Also, their prices are very reasonable for their food.  I order their home plate combo which has pancakes with fruit, bacon, and eggs, for $10ish.  This place is a gem in the Marina and you should try them out if you're around.
author: J L.

description: Very enjoyable breakfast.  It's small so it's not good for large groups.  Very good wait staff that always made sure our coffees and waters were full.  The omelets are delicious!
author: Ryan C.

description:
This is a ok place to grab brunch in the Marina. You can see IHOP across the street and unfortunately I think some of IHOPs problems are rubbing off on the food here. I'm not opposed to coming here again since it's a little less hectic at the weekend than some of the other brunch spots int he Marina.

I wish the food blew me away but it really doesn't. I live four blocks away and I can't say that my first instinct is to always come here for brunch on the weekend.
author: Bryan B.

description: Outstanding in San Francisco for breakfast! Loved the food, service and value. Had breakfast there every morning all week.
author: David M.

description:
Hit for the cycle.

Home run: Pumpkin pancakes.

Should send a thank you note to whomever came up with the brilliant idea to infuse this breakfast staple with a hint of gourd. Two large and thick cakes are yours for the low price of seven bucks. Came with pecans on top. Brilliant.

Triple: Scones.

Gratis with everything. Got three. They are good. Dangerously good. Had one more than planned. Almost had them all.

Double: Grilled chicken sandwich.

Country Italian bread added that little extra something. Same with the slices of avocado. Salad on the side. Very good. Cheese and pesto aioli available if that's your thing.

Single: House granola.

Apricot pistachio flavored. Nonfat yogurt. Medley of strawberries, blueberries and bananas. Tasted good. Just not enough of everything for the price.

All was devoured after my seventh annual U.S. Half. One could say you eat to run. I'm more in the run to eat camp. Great run. Great food.
author: Jason B.

description: Amazing breakfast/brunch spot! We came here for Easter brunch and thankfully we only had to wait about twenty minutes. Their homemade biscuits (that come with each meal) were delicious and their mango and raspberry homemade jam went great with it. My family got the french toast special to share and it melted in my mouth. I had the garden omelette with the potato-carrot pancakes... it was delicious. The restaurant had great natural light coming through the front windows. Oh and the prices are amazingly cheap for such an expensive city. I look forward to coming here again!
author: Megan B.

description:
For the price you aren't going to do any better, 5 stars for the price for sure! Family owned and run you can tell that they care about how good of service you get. Everyone is very friendly. When we sat down they took our drink order and set down these very tasty scones and some lovely home made jam. I ordered the eggs benedict, the person with me had a oyster omelet. 

Our drinks came and my orange juice was very tasty, lots of pulp may have been fresh squeezed. My friends mocha was very chocolatey and delicious. Eventually our food came and it looked pretty dodgy. My eggs benedict was very plain looking and her oyster omelet looked more like a frittata. But once we started eating the flavors were there, my eggs benedict having a suprisingly delightful dash of green onion and her oyster omelet being very tasty with oyster-a-plenty. Suprisingly good for an unplanned walk-in. The best part? All of it was only $25.00! If you find ourself hungry and in the neighborhood... GO EAT THERE!
author: Patti P.

description:
What a disappointment. I used to go here a few years ago. had lunch today. I ordered the same thing I always got.... Hangtown Fry with extra oysters.
It used to come with 6-8 whole oysters; however today it had two oysters chopped up, one mushroom, half dozen pieces of ham and no bacon. The potato pancakes were half the size they used to be. I will not return.
author: Jan N.

description:
Best breakfast/brunch in the marina. Hands-down.

I've tried a lot of places for breakfast/brunch in this area and this spot takes the french toast. The fresh-squeezed honeydew juice is amazing and if you're in the mood, they also have great soju bloody marys. However, I highly recommend the crab cake Eggs Benedict. The carrot pancakes are also delicious, especially when served with some applesauce and creme. 

Smaller place so you may have to wait a bit but the line usually moves quickly.
author: Henry P.

description:
Service is great, but the wait & parking sucks on the weekend.  

Waffle is just like Dewars waffle cone. Brings me back to LOngIsland days.

HomeRun special is a bargain with all the traditional stuff. 

Chorizo and Juevos is note worthy, as well.
author: Biff M.

description: Skip this place if you are touring. Place nickel and dimes you not very sympathetic for any substitution anything extra they will charge. service sucks go somewhere else if you can.
author: Don V.

description: Recommended by the staff at Hotel Del Sol as their "go to" breakfast place.  We had to wait about 15 minutes to get in.  According to an area local in line with us, it was a short wait compared to typical wait times.  The "short wait" was worth it.  This small restaurant was the epitome of excellent service and very fresh food.  My wife had the Blackstone Eggs Benedict with tomatoes that tasted as if they were fresh picked from the vine. I had the Home Plate Frittata with fresh spinach, chicken sausage, mushrooms, etc. Before our order came to the table, one of the staff brought us fresh scones with 2 types of homemade jellies.  So far I've used the word "fresh" 4 times in this review (oops... make it 5 times).  This place defines "local", "family run", "fresh", "caring service", "quaint" (as in small).  Breakfast is not usually a meal that garners such praise but in the case of Home Plate, it is well deserved.  Home Plate hit a Home Run in my book!
author: Guy Q.

description: Small and busy but fast friendly service and really lovely food. Husband had eggs Benedict and I had buttermilk waffle with stawberries. The coffee was fresh and the orange juice was Devine. Would highly recommend. Would return but we're just visiting!
author: Meredith C.

description:
It sure isn't fancy, so I wondered, why would anyone wait outside in the cold to eat here? I never figured it out.  I found nothing special about the food or service so unless you are starving or there is no waiting list, I would not bother. This neighborhood breakfast place is so small that customers sign up outside and wait.  

I did not expect a gourmet restaurant judging by the storefront appearance, but that is no excuse to serve a professionally poached egg that is visibly runny. No amount of free scones compensates for a horrible first impression. The coffee tended toward the chicory and the tables were as close together as possible in the cramped dining area. The staff was always around, but we still had trouble getting our entire order completed. The food was fresh, but not properly cooked or attractively plated, the scones were the sweet/crumbly type and the place looked like someone's kitchen. Sorry, but I wouldn't take anyone I was trying to impress.  It's strictly a neighborhood convenience.
author: Lynn S.

description:
An interesting little family run place that always has a good line for it. The place is a small little French American breakfast place that has savory scones. The portions are small but what one gets is pretty nice.

The place is pretty small so don't plan on bring strollers or a group larger than 4.
author: M C.

description: This place was cool and quaint, they offered good food and great atmosphere. The good stuff on the menu cost more but it's well worth it. Belly full but them hungry!
author: Enrique C.

description:
I really liked this place. The servers were very attentive and nice. You get so much food for the price. It's ridiculous. We all got crab omelets and not only was it a 3 egg omelet, it also had toast, hash browns, and a blueberry biscuit. Oi. It lasted a couple meals.

Only thing I didn't like was that the crab was overly fishy for the eggs. The crab eaten separate made it a bit better. Definitely will have to try some of their other offerings!
author: Lily K.

description: Really good place for breakfast. Good selection of breakfasts and you always get a newly baked scones on the house. Easy and very friendly staff and very reasonable prices. We stayed at a hotel close by and had our breakfast at Home Plate every morning.
author: Pär O.

description: Very welcoming and prompt with their service. Best breakfast I've bad in town yet. No complaints
author: Sam S.

description: Amazing service and breakfast! I had the Turkey Famous and it was absolutely delicious. Definitely one of their best ones. The guy next to me even asked me what I was eating because it looked so good. Way to go! Keep it up!
author: Katharina E.

description: Mediocre- The Eggs Benedict was good. Not a bad place to stop in for a quick bite to eat early in the morning, but there is just so many better places to go that are close to here. If there weren't maybe the review would be a little higher.
author: Kevin J.

description:
Best breakfast in San Francisco
The food is amazing. I think I will never have a more perfectly cooked omelet. There was no runnyness and yet it was little and fluffy. Interestingly I had the roasted chicken omelet but without the chicken because I'm vegetarian, Avocado, mushrooms and green onions and cheese is to me the perfect omelet. Top it off with a little salsa and some potato and carrot latkas on the side makes for one amazing meal. To my surprise, you get a fresh scone with butter and homemade jam to start.  
Other notables are the coffee is decent, didn't seem like there gets to be to much of a line, and the staff is friendly and attentive.
I'm just disappointed it took me 5 years to discover this gem. I can't wait to go back and try more of the menu.
author: Trevis C.

description: Hit the spot after my first 5k. Nice small breakfast joint.
author: Theresa D.
