description: The fresh scones and home-made jam was the best breakfast starter I've had in a long time!
author: Muhammad Y.

description: We showed up and there was a pretty extensive line which is usually a good sign, they flew thru the list pretty fast I think we ended up waiting less than 10min. Our order was taken quickly and we got coffee even faster.  We were then given complimentary scones with homemade jam. Our food came fast and was amazing, very large portions. The prices were very reasonable also. Can't wait to go back.
author: Trisha C.

description: Great place for breakfast. Nothing fancy - typical diner - but food is well prepared and generous. Try the potato-carrot pancakes - unusual and delicious. Definitely a great place for a solid breakfast in the area.
author: Edwina P.

description:
Love it Love it Love it! I went alone to dine but the atmosphere is great and I was one of the few lucky alone diner who got to eat by themselves. I ordered the Eggs Benedict. SO yummy. Got the hash browns with it, I would whine that it was not enough but I was stuffed by the time I left. So they know good portions.

I also ordered coffee, I need strong coffee so this is my only complaint. Watery coffee. But they refilled me every two seconds so that made me very happy. They were extremely busy on a Sunday afternoon (expected) but they did not rush me out but they were super quick and efficient. 

Oh, I know people don't like to talk about this but the bathroom, Very Clean. I used to hear a saying, "You wanna know if the food is good? Check the bathroom!" Good advice :D
author: Rüsh A.

description:
This little unpretentious cafe location was only one block west of our hotel. 

Home Plate's complimentary raisin scones and carrot hash-browns were refreshing as well as filling after so much expensive and gimmicky food a tourist~newbie like me herded endless city blocks to eat... all weekend! I usually correlate an irony to the end of my "vacation" trips. I'm glad this one came in the form of a last minute 'Home Plate' discovery. 

..oh yea! Did I mention my bill came out to 19.79? *points to birthyear* Coincidence??
author: Saul S.

description:
When we think of the bestest carb-loaded brunch spot, Home Plate always comes to mind

Pay homage to the parking gods to find a spot in the Marina & once karma has smiled, it's off to fill our bellies w/ the most scrumptious brunchy diner fare

Start off w/ the Pep Supreme Smoothie w/ oj, nanners, & honey

Indulge on homemade (& free) Scones & Jam while we wait on the standard orders:

I opt for the Cornmeal Buttermilk Pancakes which are fluffy & oh-so-filling, with just that kick of cornmeal to add that bit-o-crunch

Buddies opt for the Buttermilk Waffles & I swear they are made w/ cake flour - they are so light & airy & just a hint of sweetness you find in those yummy cakes from premium bakeries

Sis opts for the Spinach Frittata w/ its huge & fluffy eggs lovingly enveloping the (nasty - bleh, bleh) spinach that she so dearly loves & is paired w/ a Potato-Carrot Pancake & homemade roll or toast

Another side of Potato-Carrot Pancakes for the table w/ sour cream & apple compote to dip & we're in heaven, stuffed to the gills, & ready for our naps
author: Adrienne G.

description: Yelp brought us to Home Plate and I owe all Yelp reviewers a huge thank you! My family and I were in town for a wedding and searched for a breakfast spot near our hotel and this one popped up. The food was so excellent, we ended up sharing all of our breakfasts family style. Excellent, excellent food! If you go here for the first time, I highly recommend asking your server for some guidance on what to try in regards to what's popular.
author: Jessica S.

description: Perfect little grease-spoon diner that is clean and offers complimentary scones. I got an egg white chicken sausage omelette and it was quite delicious! :) Service is nice, attentive, and prompt - I got my coffee re-filled maybe 5 times while I was there. Will definitely be coming back here soon for another classic American breakfast experience.
author: Jennifer Hom C.

description: Beyond amazing! Left satisfied and ready to go back as soon as possible. It's in the marina but is super chill. It's not the party brunch spot but the food makes you forget about the bottomless mimosa places. Plus the service was phenomenal.
author: Kayla L.

description: It was ok. Scones were good, mimosas too of course.. I ordered the special California scramble and my other ordered the polenta. Mine was decent, but they forgot my toast. However the polenta was not good at all, no flavor at all to it. The waitress could have been a little more helpful, and the potato-carrot pancakes tasted a little old. With maybe a new recipe for those, I think they would be great!
author: Mandy L.

description: Overall great food! This is where you come for lots of breakfast entree options but very reasonably priced. They also give you yummy breakfast muffins to start.
author: S T.

description: All things considered, the best for breakfast!  The complementary scone with the breakfast entry and all that came with it including the service were excellent!
author: William Z.

description:
Take a California-style diner and try to make it the best possible diner, and you would have Home Plate. A large menu with seemingly infinite variations on the traditional favorites like waffles, pancakes and french toast, plus the Mexican faves, heuvos rancheros, chorizon and eggs, etc. Omelettes and Eggs every way, of course. All done with a health-conscious approach, like not pre-buttering your toast and offering both freshly made cantelope and honeydew juice as well as the usual juices. 

Large portions, I couldn't finish the mound of chorizo & eggs I was served. Fresh-baked scones with every meal adds a nice touch. Servers were super nice and accomodating (and fast). Everyone working hard to get the food to your table ASAP.

Minor complaints: only unsalted butter and a little more care in preparing the fruit salad would make it perfect. 

The real issue is the wait, because this is a small place that virtually everyone can enjoy. Even at 10:30 am on a Monday we had a short wait, and the wait on Sunday morning was too daunting for us. Still, with the sun streaming through the big, south-facing windows, it might well be worth the wait!
author: Paul E.

description:
LOVE THIS PLACE! 

Little, if any wait. The scones are amazing. The service is very friendly. And the food is delicious.

I take all my visiting family and friends here for a breakfast treat. And Home Plate never disappoints.
author: Emily B.

description: I am an everyday yelp reader for years. Today I realized what I want to add stars to this place and signed up for a first review. Perfect crab cakes and very helpful staff.
author: Igor B.

description: Scones and carrot potato pancakes rock.  I always get the turkey famous.  Its turkey and avocado and poached eggs... you can't go wrong.
author: Julie B.

description: I had the waffles with banana and whip cream and an egg sandwich.  It also came with blueberry scones with butter and jelly.  My boyfriend split the waffles with me and he had the bacon and grilled cheese sandwich.  Everything was amazing.  Really good scones, waffles were delicious, egg sandwich was good.  I would definitely go again when I'm in San Francisco.
author: Carlotta F.

description:
the trick is to go in early- very small place, best for small parties! 

home plate opens up at 7, so when I looked at the clock and rolled out of bed to get there by 815- many tables to choose from!  The menu has your typical breakfast and brunch items, but the taste and the service makes this place kick! I was really looking forward to a delicious waffle, but their machine was broken so I settled for a short stack pancakes with blueberries- a great choice. The pancakes were the perfect amount of fluff and two were filling enough! 

I have been wanting to go here for a long time, and even though I just had your everyday pancakes, I look forward to going again and trying more things on their menu! 

Oh, and while you are sipping on your coffee, juice or water- they bring you complimentary scones and jam while you wait! 

I recommend this place for the quick service, the inexpensive prices and great taste.
author: Alexa V.

description: Yummy complimentary scone with fresh jam!  Such a great start.  Had to order the corned beef hash and hash browns.  Corned beef has was okay, but the hash browns were cooked perfectly, light and crispy on the outside, soft and moist on the inside.  My friend ordered the Angry Bennedict.  I took a bite.  Delicious!  Overall, a nice inexpensive place to go for breakfast.
author: Jayce O.

description: Been here a few times. The scones, the scones, the SCONES! are to die for! :) Breakfast was great too. Reasonably priced but its a very small place so you have to really plan on having breakfast there like, the night before. You have to get there early especially if its on a weekend, otherwise you'll starve. The food being as good as it is but considering the size of the place it simply equates a very long wait time. Nothing we could do about that. OH actually, if you don't mind killing a bit of the hunger with a scone then you can buy that off them while you wait. That was my solution the last time I was there. I'll definitely be back on my next trip to SF.
author: Angel T.

description: Had a crab cake sandwich and chocolate chip banana bacon pancakes.  Both were very good.  Friendly staff quaint charming little place.
author: Robert W.

description: I had the roast chicken omelet. Lots of chicken in the omelet, unfortunately, way over cooked chicken. The cubed chicken was so precisely cubed, I hope it wasn't from a can. Hash browns were nice n crisp, but my first taste was what seemed very stale oil. I would eat here again. I would probably try an omelet with their homemade chicken sausage.
author: Mark J.

description:
Sigh...no longer one of my go-to breakfast places.

They really messed up.  I don't like reading reviews where the reviewer dumps on a place because of one bad experience, and I try not to write reviews like that unless I think there is an indication of ongoing problem--and that's the case here.

Our food shows up and looks fine, but my friend's pancakes were undercooked.  I mean really undercooked--raw and gooey on the inside.  No big deal, really--we were not upset, just asked for it to be fixed.  She did not even ask for new pancakes, just asked for the pancakes to be thrown back on the fire.  These things happen.  The waitress says sure and off she goes.  No problem.

But then she comes back and says...wait for it...the cook wants to see the pancakes.  Kind of implying we are making this up.  Strike 1, Home Plate.

Off go the pancakes, the rest of us are eating, the waitress comes back and says a whole new batch of pancakes are being cooked.  OK, fine.  

Time goes by.  We are almost done with our food, except for J, still waiting.  The waitress is walking over with the pancakes and then...turns around and goes back to the kitchen.  I can hear her say, hey you forgot the blueberries and butter.  Good catch...but then she walks away and starts serving other tables, and more than 5 more minutes go by.  Strike 2.

Finally, we are all done with our food and J says, look, no need to wait for me.  I'll get the food boxed up.  So the pancakes, which STILL HAVE NOT ARRIVED, we ask them to put them in the box to go.  

And on the way home, she goes to eat the pancakes...which are still underdone.  The same as the first batch.  Strike 3!

Look, as I said, I don't want to hammer a place for one bad experience.  But this was real bad, not just in the mistake but the way the problem was handled.  There was nothing really wrong with my food but my whole meal was ruined by the experience.  And as I think about it, this place is not quite as good it used to be.  Really, one single piece of toast with a full $8.50 breakfast?  And the potato pancakes seem smaller and not as tasty.  The warm mini-scones are still good, but I noticed the table next to us got their's late.

I think this place has fallen off from where it was.  I'm not sure I'd tell you to avoid it, yet, but I will.  

Home Plate, strike 3, you are out.  Sorry.
author: Kirk F.

description: This restaurant is great for a fun and homey breakfast place with scrumptious food that will fill you up and leave you satisfied. Their scones are delicious and taste great with anything on the menu (there is a lot to choose from and you can never go wrong with any meal choice!). Go here if you're looking for a relaxing breakfast with a homey touch. P.S: I got the eggs Florentine and they were perfectly done; I finished my meal in less than 5 minutes it was so good!
author: Kayla K.

description: Love their fresh home made food! You can taste the fresh and yummy! they serve American food which is similar to IHOP across the street, but there is a huge difference in ingredients that you can taste. They are always busy and it is worth for waiting!
author: Diana L.

description: A variety choices of breadfast. Big Portion and a homemade scone to start.
author: Yang Y.

description: Favorite breakfast in the Marina. Great food, free homemade scones, cozy diner-like ambiance, great service, reasonable price.
author: Lindsay B.

description: I really like this place.  I liked the good service, good coffee, crispy potato pancakes and the fresh made scone.  The angry eggs benedict was a bit of a miss.  The sauce was way, way too cold and my eggs were undone...not a big fan of my food drowning in runny egg-whites.  I was in town for a friend's wedding so I've only eaten here once...if I were a local I would come back but stay far away from the eggs benedict.
author: Pat O.

description: Super tasty cheap breakfast.  Short wait.  Delicious free scones and a creative menu with high-quality ingredients.  The huevos rancheros and breakfast combos hit the spot. Avoid the IHOP across the street and try Home Plate.
author: Kim K.

description: We got there just in time. Only a couple tables were filled a little before 9 on a week day. By the time we ordered there were only a couple of tables left. Good food, good portions, and fast service. I would call the scone that is served complimentary more of a biscuit with raisins, but it was very tasty and a nice start to a great breakfast.
author: Laurie L.

description: Great food, service....fast and very clean.  All that I look for in a bfast place.   I'll be back
author: Al S.

description: Down to earth atmosphere. Yummy food and they give you free blubbery scone with very yummy jams. Service is good and attentive. Food is reasonably priced for the marina area. Had almond French toast - yum. Coffee is good too.
author: Qiqi W.

description: Great restaurant!  Excellent staff.  Yummy scones.  What else matters?
author: Carb Q.

description: Came here on yelp recommendation--wasn't disappointed. Meal began with complimentary warm scones served with homemade jams. Food was tasty. The chicken sausage patties were great! Only negatives were my boyfriend's food came out more than 5 minutes before mine when we ordered at the same time. It may have been a random mistake though.  The food made up for it though!
author: Kelly H.

description: Super down to earth breakfast place with amazing food. There scones are the best gift one could have before brunch. Frittatas, Pancakes, Omelettes are all delicious. Mushroom pesto spinach omellete was especially delicious.
author: Nitin G.

description: The free scones are the best! and the jelly that comes with it? hell yeah. Been here twice and the food is good and the portions are big! I recommend the chicken apple sausage.  The place is reasonably priced considering it's in the marina and way better than that Ihop stuff across the street.  One down side though, $5 orange juice -_-
author: Alex G.

description:
Great find. 

In town in business and was looking for good breakfast. The Bangkok Frittata special was above and beyond.
author: Chris C.

description: I was looking for a place to grab brunch before meeting up with some friends. Although I was concerned about the noise level from Lombard St (since it's a main boulevard) but the place was actually quite lovely. As soon as I walked in, they cleared off a table for me. I was greeted with very friendly service, delicious food, and tons of refills of coffee!
author: Marc H.

description: Although this place doesn't look like much from the street, you could tell by the line outside that this place would have good grub.  Came for breakfast on a Sunday morning and was not disappointed.  Had an amazing chorizo frittata that included mushrooms and avocado and came with hash browns and toast.  You also get a scone for free before your meal, which is a nice touch.
author: Dustin M.

description: A friend and I were hesitant about stopping in at Home Plate for a quick brunch but I'm glad we did. Despite being located in the Marina (and you'll be reminded by the constant "WOO!"-ing of the Marina girls), this restaurant stands up to its expectation and delivers a solid brunch. To start my meal, I ordered orange juice (my friend got tea) and we were surprised when two pastries (complimentary of the house) were brought out to us with a side of jam. What other place in SF do you know does that? It was such a nice way to start our meal off while we waited for our entrees. I ordered a salmon eggs benedict and found it quite tasty. I don't have any complaints about the food; the portion was right and the price was extreemly low. Our tab for the meal wasn't more than $20 and we were both very satisfied. I'll be coming back, glad I could stop in!
author: Tommy C.

description: In a word--delicious. Omelet was light and fluffy. Ingredients were fresh. Service was lightning quick. Even better, there was no wait to be seated. Would definitely come again.
author: Brooks A.

description:
This place is definitely a find. The potato carrot pancakes were amazing...crab omelette was fantastic and the best was definitely the bloody Mary mixed with soju... Nice, spicy and so yummy!!!

And the scones... One free with each entree, fresh and melt in your mouth. The homemade strawberry jam was so so good
author: Vilay K.

description:
The ownership has changed!  It's no longer the great place that it once was.  Now, instead of the old, mom-and-pop, cozy hole-in-the-wall feel, it's run by young people trying to turn it into a "hip" restaurant.  No apple butter!  Different items on the menu.  It's just not the same.  

Don't be fooled!  Consider yourself warned!
author: Matt P.

description: When we went in we had a large party that was split up into two separate tables to accommodate us. The wait was pretty long, but we expected that and it was worth it! I went for the pancakes and a side of the All-Star Bacon. Before our breakfast arrived they brought out some fresh-out-of-the-oven blueberry scones with sides of homemade jams that were excellent! Once we got our breakfast, the All-Star Bacon knocked my socks off! It was thick-sliced bacon cooked with chili flakes and drenched in maple syrup. With every delicious chew I told myself that the bacon would be bringing me back. And it will...oh indeed it will (commence evil laughter)...
author: Tessa M.

description: I was on a girl's trip staying in the area. The hotel owner recommended Home Plate...all three of us loved the food. The scones were a lovely surprise, we loved the potato carrot cakes and I had a spinach/pine nuts omelet that was out of this world. They did remember us and by the 3rd day they even knew our orders...extensive menu. Very nice people. Loved it!
author: Carrie F.

description: my wife and I went there for breakfast this morning . awesome food. I had the angry benedict and she had the potato carrot pancakes. totally delicious and the home made scones were fresh and the mango jam was the bomb. thanx home plate next time we are in the city we will be back !
author: Jeff G.

description: I really like this hole in the wall brunch place out in the marina. Lines aren't as long as other brunch places in sf and the prices are very cheap. The best thing about this place are the to die for scones. These are the best scones I've ever had in my life.. And I never eat scones.
author: Maria D.

description: Miserable bunch.  Food was fine, but the service was sour.  Maybe it was just a bad day for the staff, I would give it another shot.
author: Dan S.

description: Service was good and friendly even though it was very busy. Everybody was pleased with their food. We all ordered simple meals, eggs and hash browns, but everybody got their eggs just as they were ordered, and the scones were a nice treat!
author: Justin P.

description: Best breakfast in the SF. I've been here numerous times and never been disappointed. They make awesome scones served with homemade jelly.
author: gina b.

description: I just came from home plate. Inside it sounded like I was eating in a power plant. The food was tasteless. The hash browns were ok. I love the pork store. I feel like I cheated on them today.
author: dave d.

description: the scone was great and for free.....great variety but average to me. Not too sure is worth waiting outside for 30-60 min to get a seat. Coffee is very good, if you get a refill. nope, not coming back.
author: Andre S.

description: This is a good, but not a great breakfast place. It certainly isn't worth a 20 minute or more wait.  I had a very good  spinach and mushroom omelet, but it  wasn't  better than a place with no wait.  The pork sausages my husband had were definitely undercooked and of poor quality.  The pancakes although overdone were tasty, but the waffle was unexceptional.
author: Penny D.

description:
One of the best breakfasts I have ever had.

Three egg bacon and cheddar omlette was superb, the hash browns perfectly cooked, fresh squeezed orange juice delicious and the coffee was always filled up.

The service was top notch as well and prices were very fair. You will definitely not leave hungry as the portions are very big. 

Must stop in if you are in the area.
author: Robert L.

description: Nicest and friendliest staff.  Food is amazing.  Great for families too.  Just get there early.
author: Dan G.

description:
I've lived in the Marina for 3 years and NEVER been here... mostly because Lombard street freaks me out and I never branch out from my normal brunch spots. I will definitely be back, this place was yummy!
First things first, we were sat immediately which is a big deal for a good brunch spot in San Fran. They brought us out complimentary scones with a homemade berry jam which was AWESOME. This sent me in the right direction of happy and held me over of my starvation crankiness. Definitelty will be back for the mimosas and to try other breakfast items!
author: Sarah A.

description: Went out of our way to visit the Home Plate. It was a good breakfast with good service. A good choice in the Marina area.
author: Evan M.

description: Scones were good, hash was disappointing, omelet was average.  Service was good. Jams served with scones were fantastic. Gets crowded quick.
author: April M.

description: We shared the smoked salmon Benedict. It was spot on. Even better was the sconces and Jams that came with them :-)
author: Sky M.

description: Went here for the first time early Monday morning, had to find an early breakfast place after getting off work. Great service, friendly, potato carrot pancakes were good on the side, but so were the hash browns. It'll be difficult what to choose to get on the side next time. Nice to get that complimentary scone with each breakfast plate. I got the scramble with the andouille sausage, it was pretty good, hit the spot. Pretty large portions. The boyfriend's roasted chicken omelette was just ok, my scramble was better :) Will be back to try other things after work sometime.
author: Danielle S.

description: Didn't like having to wait outside but it's popular and busy so I understand. Food was good and service prompt.
author: Bryan G.

description: My husband and I were looking for a good breakfast place and stumbled upon Home Plate.  They open at 7am, but they let us in a few minutes before.  Their freshly baked scones are delicious!  We ordered crab omelette and crab cake benedict.  Both are really good, but we both liked the crab omelette better.  We highly recommend this place not only for the food, but for excellent service as well!
author: Gem G.

description:
So, just in case it's not apparent yet, my main goal in finding places to eat/drink/hang out in the marina, is that they are un-marina. Having only found a few, I am happy to report that I can add Home Plate to that list. 

The menu is beyond extensive, the food incredibly basic and delicious and the service was quick and efficient. The best part is the delicious homemade scones they give you with every meal. Additionally, they make  the sausages there, and all the food was light, yet filling.
author: Clay T.

description: Good job yelp reviewers, this place was great!!!  Put your name on the list and you have to wait outside because it's a small place but worth the wait!  They bring you scones with every entree order, and YUMMMY these are delicious, along with the jelly they bring with it.  My husband wasn't as excited, he said they're "just biscuits", but I personally loved them.  We went two days in a row and I have to say the veggie omelet and crab omelet both were fantastic, and each had about half a avocado in them, so delicious.   And the carrot potato pancakes and also pretty yummy. They come with sour cream and apple sauce, very strange combo but it works, and not a crumb was left.  Food is served very quickly so eat up your scone and coffee because your meal will be right behind it.  Great no-frills breakfast spot :-)
author: Michelle M.

description: Absolutely loved my food every time I came here. I'm still waiting to try the pancakes and waffles I've stuck to the scrambles or omelets which did not disappoint at all! The complimentary scone is nice and the jams are really good. The portions are pretty big too. Definitely recommend if you're in the city!
author: Laura V.

description:
plastered on the windows of this modest hole in wall are rave reviews throughout the years from various sources for the scones, the potato pancakes, etc.  That was pretty much the most impressive thing about this place.  The food is reasonably priced for the area, but the fare is unimpressive. My meal was okay -  staying at home and cooking the same would have been about comparable or better in taste.  I generally judge brunch places by their bacon and am pretty easy to please as bacon goes but here - the bacon was a no go.  i also tried my friend's "special omelette"...it was indeed quite special and definitely not for me. 

The decor was cool - I liked how they used chinese paper placemats and there's a somewhat novel feel to the "chinese run breakfast joint", but you could get that (and better food) at the hamburger haven in the richmond.
author: Shinny L.

description:
YUM

This place is awesome, and everyone who I have brought here loves it too!  Really good scones that come with brunch- great potato pancakes- I have never had a bad time or meal here ever!!!

I live for Brunch!
author: Lisa M.

description:
Food = good and not totally a grease-fest.

Service = passable, with ESL  But they are very friendly!

Try it before you hate it.   It is a diner.
Parking is a pain.
But if you're around there...why not.

I tried it because my car was at the shop nearby and I needed some food that morning, and it was worth it.
author: Fannie S.

description:
This is the real deal! I get so tired of eggs and bacon and toast costing me $15 in this city. FINALLY a place where you can get a reasonable breakfast (not just reasonable--awesome! The potato carrot pancakes and scones are done perfectly) at a really reasonable price.

The service is also super friendly and helpful, and they don't rush you in and out, which is really great considering the limited number of seats they have available.

Really seems like these people do food well, enjoy what they do, and are happy to keep it just like that. This is one of those SF businesses (Like Ike's and Rosamunde's) that we need to support. I love this place!
author: Sbicy Meatball J.

description: Nice family-run business, excellent food, excellent service.  Enjoyed the scones and home-made jam.  Creative menu.
author: Harvey S.

description: Their scones and jam are worth a trip alone! Very solid breakfast - I'm a fan of the Chorizo scramble.
author: Alison M.

description: They give you warm scones with really tasty jam for free when you arrive! They are the most reasonably priced breakfast in the marina. The smoked salmon, cream cheese, capers on a bagel is delicious and filling. Thanks Home Plate for always being there for our breakfast needs under $50.
author: Pete F.

description: Order the Crab Omelette! More avocado than I have had in a single sitting. Ever! Friendly local servers and great fast service. We came here two of our 3 mornings in San Francisco. Just had to come back for round two!!!!!
author: Dana B.

description: Finally finally finally got to go in and eat at this place that has a line out the dork every weekend morning and honestly not worth the wait. Went on a not so busy Thursday at noon, and sat down immediately and food was just average to me. If your are a vegetarian like me sorry to say most of the items you can't have since its a bunch of meaty entrees, not just the omelettes but their pancakes as well. I got their BBC (banana bacon chocolate chip) pancakes, without bacon obviously. And a side of their hash browns. Mine and my boyfriends hash browns were a little burned, working in food service though I do not complain about little things like that though. My boyfriend enjoyed his meat lover omelet with a side of hash browns. Also the complimentary biscuits were delicious with the strawberry and mango jam given.  It was a good meal but not worth a two and half hour wait which I see every time I am in the marina.
author: Jasmine W.

description: Love this place for breakfast. Their omelettes are awesome as are the scones with jam. Excellent value for the amount of food and the quality.
author: John M.

description: Cute little place, friendly staff and the food was so good! We got huevos rancheros, an omelet and pancakes and it was all terrific!
author: Julian M.

description:
With new ownership, they have what they had before plus more. 
Mon. - Fri., they serve mimosa with no charge for refill, bottom less.... Love it!
Every time I visit, I have a great experience. Food is good and service is excellent.  Friendly server makes my meal time a lot happier. :-)
Of course, taste is important too. Highly recommend this place!!!
author: Annie K.

description: We had such a great breakfast at Home Plate last Saturday morning! The staff are attentive, great service, and the food was amazing. They give you free homemade scones with homemade preserves. The special of the day was fresh crab cake benedict. My husband ordered that. It was soooo good...lots of fresh real crab for $13.95! Unheard of for SF.  I would highly recommend Home Plate for breakfast...great gem of a spot when in the Marina.
author: Jena N.

description: Came here for brunch after a long night out and it definitely hit the spot. They give you a lot of food, and their warm, homemade scones with homemade jam comes free with each order. I ordered the chorizo and eggs, and you can choose between potato-carrot pancakes and toast. I've never had potato-carrot pancakes before, so I got that and really liked it. The hot chocolate was refreshing and they give you a lot - not like those dinky mugs at other breakfast spots. Actually, everything tasted good and homemade!  Service was good, and it's definitely a place I'd go to for brunch if I was in the area again and didn't want a place that was too pricy.
author: Elizabeth B.

description: The potato carrot pancakes is a concept still in diapers, but better from the ones i had before at a different restaurant. We got to a good start with their scones, AMAZING little baked goodness! Huevos rancheros were good, but they could have sprinkled some sea salt to bring up the good flavor they had. Pancakes... approved, and for me to say that is difficult, i am a pancake person and have tried the good and bad all the way from the east to the west. The scrambled eggs were bland. In general, a good breakfast spot for the price.
author: Edward R.

description:
I Love Yelp! but I've never been on her to write a review. BUT after eating at HOME PLATE I had to give them 5 stars. SOOOO amazing. Spent 5 days in SF. first day we ate at ihop not knowing this lil diamond in a rough was right across the street. the next 4 days straight we ate here. their food is beyond amazing! best pancakes, Spanish omelet & orange juice I've ever had.  I left my heart in San Francisco @ Home Plate
 = (
author: Annie M.

description: Raisin pecan French toast. Pancakes and delicious coffee. Nice staff. This place is underrated. Consider this a hidden gem of SF.
author: Michael D.

description:
This is a lovely place to go and enjoy a spot of brunch in San Francisco. It's a really nice little cosy place, located on Lombard across from IHOP. Like others have said, it's not pretentious like other places in the Marina often are. What I really love, is how great the service is here. Truly excellent.

The menu has many breakfast standards as well as some variations and twists, such as oatmeal pancakes and Chorizo frittatas (both incredibly delicious). Each order comes with free scones -- a reason to go in itself I think!
author: Sarah F.

description: I just had eggs Benedict here and it was just great, the best I had in a long time. The service is great in the place too. Would totally recommend the place.
author: Dalia A.

description: Great breakfast/brunch.  Always get eggs benedict with potato/carrot pancakes, with the always amazing mini scones and jam to start!
author: Brett E.

description:
I've been to Home Plate on many occasions, and I'm always surprised for some reason that it's as tasty as it is.  I'm not a big sweets-in-the-morning kind of gal, so I never venture to the waffle/pancake/french toast fare, though I see if ordered often.

This morning I had the Corned Beef Hash, topped with poached "hard" eggs.  Pretty well done.  Wasn't too dry, and you could tell that they hadn't just reheated the hash, as with other places.  Also, I always like the little scone that you get with the meal.  It's not heavy, and a nice way to start things off.

I believe I've had the Hangtown Fry which, coincidentally, is also on the menu of Kuleto's.  Although, Home Plate's is way better.  Wanna know a little story behind the Hangtown Fry dish?  Back in the Gold Rush, thieves and what-not who were sentenced to hanging had a last meal request.  For some reason, this oyster and egg dish took the longest to get since back then it wasn't like they could hop in a car and go get the stuff on the swift-like.  It was the most oft-requested meal because it prolonged their death.
author: Tamar D.

description: becoming my favorite quick breakfast place in the marina when we're just to lazy to drive to just for you cafe or dotties. the potato-carrot pancakes with the sour cream and apple sauce are always amazing, as are the scones, and the place is a great deal even before considering how much food you get.
author: Mike V.

description: Small place, but good food.  Love the fruit purée and fresh scones. I ordered egg white spinach omelet. The bacon is perfectly done.  1/14/2012
author: Duke D.

description: Went here for breakfast Labor Day morning. Short wait. Great breakfast and great service. Loved the jelly.
author: Dory W.

description: This is a really nice and simple place for breakfast. I ordered the home run, which I chose to consist of pancakes, bacon and scrambled eggs. The food was not too heavy, but just right to start off the day. It was yummy! I would recommend the home run if you want a bit of everything. For me it was enough for two of us to share.
author: Annette L.

description: long wait time but was worth it! scones while we waited for our meal was a nice touch. potato-carrot pancakes are delicious & friendly staff!
author: Maddie C.

description: I was recently introduced to this breakfast place in the Marina district. Funny that it is right across from IHOP. Nevertheless, they make delicious American style breakfast. I've been here a few times already and I always ordered the Roasted Chicken or Denver omelets. My favorite was their raisin scones. It's on the house and you get to put mango or raspberry jam. It's so delicious! I usually order more than one scones for myself and not sure if they charge extra though. Even if they do, it's totally worth it. I also tried their potato carrot cakes, yumalicious! Also their waffle is down to earth tasty, it doesn't taste like those generic ones. The portion is alright; I always get full after eating my omelet meal with hash brown and wheat toast. Don't forget raisin scone for starters. Definitely a must try place, it's better than IHOP!
author: Elaine C.

description:
Love, love, love this place.

Faced with the prospect of eating the continental breakfast provided by the hotel we were staying at or iHop, we searched Yelp and found this wonderful gem of a breakfast place.

Every meal from the french toast to the omelette were out of this world good! The complimentary scone alone deserves 5 stars! Friendly and service oriented, the staff really make you feel welcome and at home. It was so good we kept going back every morning!

If you are staying in the Cow Hollows area, you must stop in and try this place. It was one of the highlights of our trip!
author: Glenn S.

description:
This place just didn't do it for me.  The free scone was the best part of the meal.  The oatmeal pancakes were under cooked and a little soggy.  The syrup wasn't maple which irritates me when restaurants use generic syrup.  Also, the fruit wasn't that fresh.  The granola was pretty decent but nothing to get too excited over.

On a positive note, the service was good and our waitress was very helpful, but there's only so much a waitress can do.

Our friend like the chorizo scramble and would come back again, but we did not share that same sentiment.

If your looking to have mediocre diner food in an outdated, very relaxed atmosphere, then give it a whirl.
author: Molly M.

description: I've been here twice now and I love it every time.  The service is great! They never let your water glass or coffee cup go empty. They're always prepared with an extra utensil at hand when you need one and the only waiting you'll do here is waiting to get a table or for your food to cook.  They have homemade scones and jelly that are very tasty. It's a cozy, clean and friendly place.  Nothing on the menu will disappoint.
author: O ..

description: Small hole in the wall with only one unisex bathroom and some of the best food I have ever eaten for breakfast! The complimentary scones were a treat. I ordered the omelet with crab, avocado, scallions and jack cheese. I ordered a side of hollandaise sauce too! I opted for the carrot, potato pancakes as my side. They are very thin and fabulous with sour cream and applesauce. My daughter ordered hot chocolate which was made with steamed milk and Ghiradelli hot cocoa mix. Topped with whipped cream it was decadent! Would definitely return here...
author: Donna H.

description: Love, love, love this place!!!  The food is amazing!!!  Both times we have eaten at Home Plate, we have taken out of town guests and they have been quite pleased too.  They serve you complimentary "scones" which as delicious, but I think they are more the consistency of biscuits.  Either was, they are yummy and warm :)  Both times I have ordered the short stack of Banana-Walnut Pancakes with a side of bacon and can't quit saying how delicious they are.  The bacon is a bit dry but still good.  I am not a fan of the Potato-Carrot pancakes.  Our friends had the special of crab cake benedict and raved on and on about.  There is no doubt that this is the place to go for breakfast!!!  YUMMY!!!
author: Tara P.

description: I was at Home Plate this afternoon and had their home made granola with fruit... trust me, it can't be beat!  This was my third time eating at this delicious restaurant.  It's perfect in every way.  Everyone is so friendly, and it seems that no matter what I order, it's splendid.  They serve Thanksgiving Coffee from Noyo Harbor (Mendocino County), which is rich, smooth, and wonderful.  I will always return to Home Plate whenever I'm in the city of SF!!!
author: G L.

description: I would have given them five stars for the free scones alone! The chorizo with eggs was delicious. I didn't think Chinese cooks would know how to make chorizo, but I was very very wrong. :) My wife had the chicken pot pie which was also amazing. I really enjoyed the urban diner atmosphere as well. Reminded me of my younger days living in New York. Will definitely come back here!
author: James L.

description: Food was amazing. The scones with jelly before your main meal was amazing. I just loved everything about the place. Customer service isn't as good but still a place I recommend
author: Oscar M.

description:
Eat the scone and leave.

The rest of the food's not good at all.

I had  very overcooked sunny side up eggs and weird tasting potato pancakes. They tasted "fishy" for some reason.

You've been warned.
author: Cara N.

description:
I took my son here for breakfast this morning. The atmosphere has changed in the 20 years since I used to live in the neighborhood.  It used to be packed most every weekend morning and we walked in at 8:30 and it was only half full. It sounds like the ownership changed last year and they may have had some issues getting up to speed.  

Given this change, I wasn't expecting much but was pleasantly surprised. The staff was friendly and the food was good. I especially liked the fresh mini scones with fruit puree that they serve with the dishes.
author: Brian B.

description:
We love this place! My daughter, son, and grandson went to Marina District for 
our vacation past summer and we were looking for a restaurant that were serving breakfast and we  came across Home Plate. Love! love! their food selections. We went their everyday for breakfast. Service is great. The people that works their are
friendly and very helpful. Try their crab benedicts!!! Yum.... Lola...
author: Angelita G.

description: Awesome potato carrot pancakes , and really good home made scones and garden omelette. Small place so get there early.  Parking may be a problem, but if you drive around a block or two, you will find paid parking.
author: Ujj N.

description: It's definitely a hidden gems in The Marina. The food is fantastic and pretty reasonable price. Love the fresh squeeze OJ as well as the complimentary warm scone accompany by the Mango and strawberry sauce. My new breakfast spot in the marina.
author: Kevin K.

description: In the face of other breakfast joints, this one is WACK!  I loved Home Plate when I went the first time, I was stoked.  Then, I went again and it took, no kidding here, 45 minutes to get two short stacks, so lame, the food was good but not worth the wait.
author: Eddie T.

description: Great food on a Sunday morning breakfast! Place often packed so you might wait outside for a table but it's worth waiting for. Nice people, great fresh and quickly served. Yumi-i.
author: Julie M.

description: Tasty breakfast and friendly service. Enjoyed the All Star bacon - thick applewood smoked bacon with syrup and red pepper flake. Nothing fancy, just really good breakfast and friendly service. Recommend.
author: Michael B.

description:
very wide selection of breakfast/brunch options
good portion size
reasonable price
friendly waitress
organized wait list and short wait time
yummy food
they bring a raisin bread and two delicious jam at the beginning.
author: Neda M.

description: Once you try their scones you will understand what I am saying! I mean they come with fresh jams ( yes plural, they serve you 2 different kinds!)
author: Big H.

description: Friendly staff. Cute place. Specials of the day. I was skeptical of the potato-carrot pancakes, but we tried them. YUM. The scones were hot and the strawberry and mango jams were amazing - so much flavor - not that watered down stuff from the store. My daughter ordered chocolate chip pancakes, and she gave them two thumbs up. Not only did they pour on the chips, but there were chips all throughout the pancakes. We all loved it so much, we went back the next morning. I ordered an entire order of potato-carrot pancakes. Everything was delicious.
author: Susan H.

description: Just came back here for the first time in about 1 year. YUM! Horrible atmosphere, amazing grub! The orange juice is to die for!!! The french toast is exactly like your mom made it and the eggs are scrambled as I like them (not that this helps you, maybe it does?)
author: Katrina H.

description:
my friend and i were in marina area to do some shopping around 12noon except i was starving..so my friend did quick search and found this place..and i was very pleasantly surprised how good the food and service was.

first of all, food is great! it's just my kind of place, portion is big but i was really hungry so it was awesome..i had the fritta (it had everything i wanted, meat and veg..was delish..!) and hasbrown on the side. 

they give you a mini fresh baked scone before your food comes out, along with mango and strawberry jam(?) which was good.

service was good, not super but good enough. never rushed us and was really attentive about filling up coffee and water..we never had to ask to get it refilled. 
it was sat early lunch but wasn't too crowded, we got sat right away and when we left, there wasn't a line either, but i think we might have just missed the rush brunch hour because there was a long list at the door (names all crossed out) right when we entered the restaurant.

food wasn't greasy either like some breakfast places so it was just perfect and good price too.
if i'm in the neighborhood again, i'm definitely going back for more and hopefully we don't have to wait..
author: Karen H.

description: My family & I went here on a weekday after rush hour & were seated right away. The breakfast crowd was just starting to leave. It probably helped that we visited SF after Labor Day & the tourist season was winding down. The food was very good, the service was good, and I would have given 4 stars if we left it at that. I marked them down because after I received my credit card statement a few weeks later, I noticed that they charged an additional amount (probably tip - it was about 15% more than the bill) without my concent. This was annoying siince we left a cash tip of more than 18%. Now, I don't like ANY place that automatically assumes that we forgot to tip and therefore feel that they have the right to add it on AFTER I have signed the charge slip. What if I were trying to send a message for bad service & purposely didn't tip? Now maybe someone took the cash from the table before the waiter could clear the table, but there's no excuse for adding on to a bill AFTER I have writtten in the final amount. Maybe it's an SF thing to do so.
author: Ronald N.

description:
I am not a breakfast guy but this place was so good, I was craving their food a few hours later.  If I didn't live so far away (East Bay), I would have gone back everyday since last week.  We tried an omelette and some scrams.  They were all delicious!  But the BONUS is they came with these potato pancake thingys that were AMAZING!!! And an apple compote (like apple sauce) and scones.  I usually don't like scones (too dry) but these were moist and came with a delicious sauce!  We tried the strawberry juice and it was so fresh and delicious we had to have two cups.
I can't believe I could get this excited about a breakfast place but it was so good that it inspired me to join Yelp and write a review.
If you go to this place, you will not be disappointed!
author: Scott S.

description: Awesome scones, home made awesome chicken omelettes great service
author: Evon D.

description:
I'll start off with being positive. OJ was fresh squeezed; I really like that. That was the highlight of this place. 

I had an omelette. I was uninspired and wouldn't go here again... ever. The interior was drab and sad like Lombard street feels when you walk on it. 

I also have a pet-peeve of pre-ground pepper... I really hate it. And that's all you could get here.

The pictures make this place seem a lot better than it was.
author: Michael S.

description:
Had lunch here last week and loved their potato pancakes!  I got the chicken sausage, potato pancakes, and the blintzes.  The scone they give you is scrumptious.  The blintzes were just ok... I'm used to blintzes being a bit sweeter with sugar or cinnamon added, the only thing that made them sweet was the strawberry jam that came on the side.  Next time I go here I'll probably skip the blintzes and just go for the sausage and potato pancakes.  

I would recommend getting the carrot potato pancakes as a side, that way you get 4 instead of 2!

They also have really nice juices here, I got cantaloupe this time but will probably try honeydew when I go back~ (and then probably go back to the cantaloupe again since it was so good!)

My friend got their speciality scramble (with chicken sausage) and it smelled really good.  I might have to try that sometime too.
author: Debbie G.

description:
My buddy and I came here for breakfast on a weekday after we went across the GG bridge for an early morning view of the bay. This is great example of a "casual diner" done well.

I had a really tough time making up my mind because so many things on the menu sounded good. They have lots of different omelettes and specialty pancakes.

In the end we shared the raisin bread French toast and the omelette with house-made chicken sausage.

They also have espresso drinks, which is nice, although I didn't have one on this particular day.

Good food, friendly staff, a good experience overall.
author: Alex C.

description: Visited San Fransisco this weekend and decided to try this place out because of the reviews. Right away we ordered the fresh orange juice. It was delicious and tasted like an orange, and not like the stuff you get in the carton. Was already happy with the juice then the waiter brought out scones with house-made jelly. I'm not much of a baked goods lover, but these were great! Flaky on the outside and soft on the inside. Whoever made these knew how to bake. They were served with the jam, which was also awesome. I saved some to spread on my toast. I ordered the two eggs, hash browns, toast, and chicken sausage. The eggs and hash browns were typical, nothing to complain about and nothing to rave about. The chicken sausage was unique and perfectly spiced. It wasn't too dry like I thought it was going to be. I wanted something light because I was going on a hike to Muir Woods and didn't want a huge meal. My friend went with the brunch menu and ordered the crab sandwich. You can tell they used real crab. I'm from the Midwest and most restaurants here are stingy with their shellfish. So being new to the city, we were surprised that a small place like this would serve crab at a reasonable price. The benefits of living on the coast, I guess. My girlfriend got the banana pancakes. They were light and fluffy and absolutely perfect. Service was great. Our waitress was super nice and definitely earned her tips. I usually drink 3-4 glasses of water when I go out to eat and my cup was always full. She did a good job of serving without being intrusive. Overall this is a cozy place that serves up typical breakfast food. You won't find anything extraordinary on the menu, sometimes simplicity is a good thing.
author: Lambeau L.

description:
like other reviews! never had an empty glass of water or coffee! very fast and fresh! free scone and homemade jam (which was delicious!)

I ordered the veggie omelet-delicious, but wanted more avocado. ;( but that's a norm, when you order something with avocado.
My fiance ordered the meat lovers omelet, it was yummy..i had some! 

and their potato carrot pancakes with just the right amount of sour cream served=heaven!

their french toast=amazing!

ALL in all, inexpensive, EXCELLENT service and EXCELLENT food! 

PS: make sure you sign yourself on the clipboard by the door. They'll get you when you're table is ready. =) I actually liked not have a hostess take our name, very neat and very simple.
author: Cynthia R.

description: Really great breakfast/brunch spot. We stopped by on our recent vacation and were very happy with the service and quality of food. It seems to be a more locals spot, as it's not right downtown. They gave us scones and jam while we waited for our food, nice touch. I'd highly recommend it!
author: Vicky N.

description: This is the top of the greasy-spoon grubbing game.  A very tiny hole-in-the-wall that serves up the best short order diner breakfast food that I have tried here in town. The food is fresh and hot and the special board is chock-a-block full of creative amalgamations of egg, meat, cheese, vegetables and other things. They make scrumptuous little homemade crescent rolls, scones and potato pancakes and serve them all with homemade apricot preserves. I usually gravitate toward a scrambler with sharp cheddar, fresh chorizo and green onions. The whole experience is amazing, but do yourself a favor and arrive early on weekends as its very tiny and fills up with rotund RV-driving midwesterners staying at the many unfortunate low-end budget motels that line this part of Lombard Street.
author: Rick H.

description:
Possibly one of the worst breakfast experiences I have had.

The scene: early Sunday morning, one lone guy in the restaurant at a table. I walk in with my toddler and was asked my the waitress if I needed a highchair. I said yes and she yelled at the cook, "highchair! Highchair! HIGHCHAIR!". So, he brings it out and it's covered in crumbs. Okay, no matter I can wipe that off.

Cup of coffee? Terrible. Well, that's okay too. I can go someplace around the corner afterwards.

Scrambled Eggs? Good. No complaints. 
Chicken Sausage? Gross. 
Potato Pancake mystery disc? Terrible.
Croissant-type roll? Are you kidding me? Disgusting.

Lesson learned. I'm out $10 all together.

I feel like I went to a different spot than everyone else who had glowing reviews of Home Plate.
author: J B.

description: Not sure what happened. I have been here in the past and loved it. I was in the area on July 2 and went to breakfast there. Place was empty at 8am so I was happy to get an immediate table.  While the service was good the food was a step above Denny's    My first thought was the place had been sold and the new owners had lowered the food quality. From what I am reading on Yelp that does not seem to be the case.  I had bland eggs and mediocre Pancakes.  And only one tiny scone that seemed to be reheated. Not sure what happened but I hope it was a one time occurrence
author: Tom M.

description:
I used to go here once in a while after being put-off by the long lines at Mama's in Washington Square.  Although Home Plate does not compare to the quality and savoriness of the food at Mama's, it still manages to hold ground.

The wait is never long and the turn-over is pretty quick.  The decor leaves a lot to be desired for, but then again, you're there for the food.  Parking is much easier than in Washington Square, but don't bother trying to park on Chestnut -- instead try going to the other side of Lombard.

The food is not bad, it's made well but is forgettable at best.  Even something as simple as a BLT looks no better than something I can whip up for $0.25 at home.  

The fresh squeezed OJ tastes fresh and has that home-made taste to it. But then again so does Tropicana Home-style juice.  

The real bright star at this place are their scones, and are even better when mixed with their apple sauce that is usually next to the condiments.  

With my generally good review of this place, you might be wondering, why the two stars?  Well, here's why.

For the longest time I wondered if the apple sauce for the scones was reused or not.  But I always dismissed it for fear of destroying one of the few redeemable qualities of this place.  But last time I was there, just before closing, I saw the waitress mixing all the apple sauce from tables she had cleaned and putting it back into the fridge.

Now, I personally don't double dip. But others do.  Do you want to catch herpes or something from apple sauce? I didn't think so!  

On top of that, one of the waiters has the typical extremely long pinky nail.   And I swear to God I saw it damn near touch my food as he was handing me my plate.  From what I heard, those pinky nails are used for either picking your ears or nose.  

*shudder*

Simply put.. DIRTY and forgettable food.
author: Serge S.

description:
Gourmet food at diner prices.  This restaurant has a chef not a cook, and you pay the same amount as you would across the street at IHOP.  The pre-meal scone served with every breakfast order is special, but the housemade strawberry preserve, or whatever it is, that they serve with the scone is heavenly.  After I finish spreading it on the scone, I eat the remainder with a spoon.  I am not sure what it is or how it's made, but they should sell it by the jar.

Service is good also.
author: Lowell W.

description:
I used to eat at Home Plate often back in the 80's when it was owned by someone else.

Recently I found myself in the area and was starving. Taco Bell had a huge line, so I ambled down the street to Home Plate.

First impression: Man, this place hasn't had a deep scrubbing since I was last here in 1989. The grout on the floor, which I think was white at one time, was a shiny blackish-brown. The tabletops were clean,but if you made the mistake of letting your hands touch the underside it came away feeling like it needed heavy washing.

I ordered huevos rancheros - one of my previous favorites.

I was quickly served a warm scone and some strawberry and pear compote. The scone was spot on perfect. it was fresh and had a good number of dried currants in it. The compote had a ring along the inside of the ramekin indicating that it had been filled way in advance. Why? How long does it take to blop compote in a ramekin?

Based on the outstanding nature of the scone I  eagerly awaited my huevos rancheros......

Damn, what a let down.

Here's my food from the plate up:

Plate - Ice cold

Tortilla - Commercially made handmade thick tortilla, but stale to the point that it was totally dried-out at the edges.

Eggs - I asked for sunny-up because you can't f-those up,right? Wrong. My eggs were cooked in too-hot a pan for too long resulting in crunchy dark brown whites and a hard-cooked yolk.

Tomatillo sauce - Ice cold and tasted tinny.

Cheese - about eight strands of jack.

Pico de Gallo - good. It actually tasted fresh.

Potato pancakes - Limp and fishy tasting. Limp indicates they were cooked in advance (why? it was 2:30 on a Wednesday. Were they expecting a huge rush?). Fishy tasting fried foods is sometimes  the result of using old canola oil. 

I was starving so I ate everything except those nasty potato pancakes.

I was kicking myself for not waiting at Taco Bell.

On the way out, I noticed the two cooks frying potato pancakes. Mine were probably cooked two days prior.

Never again.
author: Gilly D.

description:
So, I finally made it over to Home Plate and I have to say, I did not think it was all that. Yes, the scones are good, but that was about it. 
I really did not care for the potato pancake. I thought it was too dry and a bit spongy. With so many breakfast places in the area, I don't think I will be coming back.
author: Lisa A.

description:
Yup. I love the lil scones too.
The omelets and scarmbles and pancakes are decent.
Filling portions and the price is right.
The owners who run the place are sweet.
And remember: cash only.
author: Joyhan S.

description: After just moving here from Chicago, we've been searching for a solid diner. After a couple of absolute bombs, Yelp led us here. "Tasty all the way!" says our friend Scap. "Poached perfection," says my husband Dave of his Eggs Benedict. We all swooned over the complimentary appetizer of warm scones with homemade strawberry jam. Solid food, solid place. So happy we found our breakfast spot in our new city.  Would be 5 stars but I require counter seating with a view of the grill at my 5-star diners. Good bloody's too btw.
author: Allison L.

description:
Home Plate doesn't have much to offer in terms of looks (kinda looks like a cheap chinese restaurant.)

But if you want some greasy eggs, it's the place to hit up.  As an omelette fan, I always like trying new styles, especially untraditional food items chopped in.  I had a roasted chicken omelette, it was the perfect marriage of breakfast and lunch that i was looking for!

p.s. the potato pancakes they give as a side order are awesome with the bit of sour-cream they give you.
author: Vinnie L.

description: Just a cheap, no frills type of breakfast joint. Okay service and okay food for what you pay for. Nothing extraordinary, though scones do seem to taste better when they're free.
author: Jonas T.

description: Food here is good with their own unique flavor with every dish. Must try: Crab cake benedict (I had the hollandaise sauce on side). Although the potatoe carrot pancake was interesting and different, I liked the  raisin scones better. Will probably get my dish with hash browns next time and will definitely return to try an omelet dish. Good friendly service and good coffee! Ambiance was just okay, but good mixed crowd.  I went around 12:30 - 1pm and there wasn't a wait (maybe because it was a rainy day?), but I could imagine this place getting pretty crowded.
author: Samantha C.

description:
Cockroaches = One star
Food = Three stars
Average = Two stars

Life is filled with these little compromises.  It was raining the day I spotted the cockroach running along the wall next to me.  Maybe he was just visiting from outside?
author: Kara D.

description:
I remembered I liked eating breakfast here... but I couldn't remember what I ordered.  So I was going to try it one more time before I wrote my detail-rich yelp review.

However, reading your reviews about cockroaches, recycled saliva syrup, and lost pennies in the jam.... I don't think I will be going back for another try.
author: Laura W.

description:
This place is pretty dirty.
The scones are good, but don't use the apple butter because someone had it before you & dipped their dirty fingers in it. 
The plates seemed pretty skimpy and the potato carrot things tasted old.


We also had a great view of all the shit in the kitchen! Including Stacks of boxes, piles of dirty dishes, and the dirty skillets on the cooktop. Yuuuck.
author: tyler g.

description: Man, my vote goes to Dao, her man Thai 'Bruce Lee' and "T" the chef for serving up the freshest and imo the best breakfast in the Marina.  I never lie and I'm tellin' you to check these guys out.  Jack gets the huevos rancheros with homemade tortillas and has also downed incredible eggs benedicts.  Family owned and operated, these are the true hidden gems I love to frequent.  Look for the line outside on Lombard at Pierce Street near the Sandwich Spot!!
author: Hank M.

description:
Mmmmm... breakfast. The most important meal of the day and sometimes the most delicious, especially when Home Plate is your destination. 

Home Plate offers the perfect amount of variety to suit all tastes -- from healthy fruit smoothies and buckwheat pancakes to the down and dirty bacon and eggs. 

Its a small place and can get pretty crowded, but if you have a diverse dining group and want some delicious grub, this is the perfect place to go.
author: eileen b.

description:
Very Good! We stopped here for breakfast after a long night of Driving and partying.. great Customer Service and friendly service...

Highly Reccomend Denver Omellete!!!

the Scones, They melted in my mouth...
author: Bee L.

description:
Stay away, unless you want to get FOOD POISONING!  This restaurant has some serious hygiene issues.  Some of you comment that their homemade scones and jam are the best, but have you taken a closer look?  The restaurant recycles the jam from one table to another.  The next time you order Pancakes, look at what they do with the leftover maple syrup ... yes, they pour them from one cup to another, and serves you the leftovers! 

DISGUSTING!  Its the  first and last time I will ever visit this restaurant.

If you're smart, you'll walk across the street to IHOP where you are sure you're not tasting someone else's saliva or bacteria. 

NOT RECOMMENDED!
author: Brandon W.

description:
Oh yeah... this one is good.

I have wanted to eat here for *EVER*.  At least, since I remember it being on Lombard and seeing people lined up on those ghetto plastic chairs.

And I am not going to say anything about the service.... it took 15 minutes of them noticing us... first table by the kitchen, as well as the worst table in San Francisco.  It faces the bathroom wall with the back to the entire restaurant, and the chair to the left facing a wall, the entrance to the bathroom, and the entrance to the kitchen and dish pit.

Suhweet.

And in this time that I had before someone noticed that our obviously patient, kind, and whistful calm was being taxed... I noticed some things.

1)  dirty little flecks of dirty little something in the cream.  Is it a rat turd?  Is it leftover burnt crust from the awful toast remnant of the last guest?  THIS IS NOT MY PLACE TO JUDGE.  It shouldn't have been my issue at all.

2)  Long black hair embedded into the potato pancake thingy.  Do I care?  Frankly no... I am worried about bugs and turds, and hair is something that I would never complain about.  Some, however, might aggressively swoon at the notion.

3)  I *do*, however, complain about a second hair.  Yes... there was a second hair in my omelette.  Smaller.  More lashy.  Does a lashy hair compared to a real hair mean less of a gross out?  You decide.

In the end, it was fairly cheap.  The ingredients *WERE PHENOMENAL*.  The homemade marmalade and roll, pancakes, bacon and ham, etc.... it was all delicious and really quite stunning.

But with all the diners in the city, some of the better ingredients won't necessarily make it a good diner, especially if you can't go from the kitchen 3 feet without screwing up constantly.

That is why I go for 5 inches.   Counter at Art's in the Inner Sunset any day of the week.
author: Uncle Fishbits Aeneas X.

description: Great service and good food!!!! The complimentary scone was one of the best I've had- way better than the local Starbucks around the corner! Highly recommend it!
author: Tenz S.

description: Great selection of egg dishes, all with decent sized portions. Best thing about this place is the free freshly baked scone and jam you get once you order. Yum!
author: Lauren B.

description: Not wanting to echo what all the other reviewers have said, I'd just like to add that apart from the great food, what totally blows me away about this place is that it is owned by Chinese people and the entire crew behind the counter (line cooks and all) are all Chinese (okay, maybe a Mexican or two some days). I know it shouldn't, but it always cracks me up to see Chinese people who run American-style breakfast places!
author: Anita L.

description:
Home Plate is a good place for down-to-earth home cooking.  The older chairs and tables gives the place a family style feel.

I ordered a three egg omelette w/ spinach, mushrooms and white cheddar.  Before the omelette is served, a small currant scone is served with raspberry jam.  The scone is moist in the inside and flaky on the outside.  Always a good starter.

The omelette had fresh mushrooms and frozen spinach (cooked up of course - tasting only ok).  With the omelette comes a small croissant (which is closer to bread) and 2 potato-carrot pancakes which are very good.  One time, I ordered the potato-carrot pancakes as my main plate and enjoyed it.

Home Plate serves a good home-style meal for eating on the run!
author: Janet H.

description:
I visited San Francisco for a weekend and went here two mornings in a row. There will be a line after 9am and you have to write your name down on the list outside the door. The owner seems to love baseball, judging from the framed pictures inside the place (and the name of the place, duh). There is more than just breakfast/brunch available, but since we were there for the morning, I only bothered looking at the breakfast offerings. I had one of the daily specials: the garden omelette (asked for it with extra spinach instead of the avocado and with less cheese). My friend had the fried polenta with the apple-chicken sausage the second visit and for the first visit... my brain is failing. I think she had a frittata.

Since we ordered breakfast, I got to try those scones. They are made in the right size: that is, they fit in the palm of your hand and aren't those ridiculously large bricks you find at fake pastry shops. The strawberry and mango sauce were a great complement to the scones. I only ate a sliver because my friend has this very strong obsession with them (and, so, I gave her the rest of mine). My omelette, by default, comes with 3 eggs. Egg whites are more. They filled mine with yummy veggie goodness (I'm not a vegetarian, however!), so I was quite pleased. It disappeared off my plate quickly. Their bread options are wheat, white, rye, sourdough, or an english muffin. I had the sourdough the first time and rye the second. Good bread. I would almost even call myself a bread snob. But, I'm not, really.

I do believe she really liked the apple-chicken sausage and fried polenta. The frittata was akin to my omelette. The workers are very nice and know all the options available with each entree off the top of their head.

I cannot say whether this, as a diner, can stand out from any other diner, because diner fare is diner fare. But, the scones are nice.

Mmm, scones.
author: C Y.

description:
I am absolutely astonished that this place doesn't have the full 5 stars... 

Okay, so at peak times (weekend brunch) there may be a bit of a wait and parking (if you're driving) is kind of a pain but trust me, it is SO worth it. This place looks like a hole in the wall but it is the most delicious brunch/breakfast every single time. Every. Single. Time. There are so many wonderful things about Home Plate! These are the one's you will experience before you even order:
1. Fresh squeezed O.J.
2. Free, Fresh(!) scones - yes, right out of the oven, f-r-e-s-h
3. Choices - anything breakfast under the sun
The best part of all, everything is fresh. I don't have a favorite dish because everything new I try suddenly becomes my favorite. But I strongly recommend the banana-berry pancakes or the blintzes. Also, if the fruit bowl - it is a huge bowl of fresh seasonal and delicious fruits.

Way to work it out, Home Plate. I'm your #1 fan!
author: Kara K.

description: went here before the 49ers beat the Seahawks this season. Scones are really good and I am a fan of them being complimentary. It's hard to screw up breakfast food and while there are those that clearly do, this place excels at it. The decor could use an update but the service and food are a homerun.
author: Matt E.

description:
This place is great!

I had an hour to kill in the city and stopped here for some breakfast. Upon entering I was greeted by a very friendly staff and seated right away. The server was very courteous and I ordered the oatmeal banana pancakes. While I waited they gave me some free scones with jam and butter, which I thought was a real plus. 
The pancakes were awesome! And the server kept refilling my water. 

Overall I really loved this place. I guess you wouldn't really see this place form the street and although there is an IHOP down the street, I highly recommend this place. Its small, quiet and has great staff.
author: Tracy B.

description:
In the tradition of big breakfasts after a long morning run, our friend recommended Home Plate. She has been coming here for years and still loves her Huevos Rancheros.

Cozy place + warm mini scones + coffee really warmed us up this past overcast Saturday. The place is small and we were happy to have seats for all 6 of us with a 2-minute wait at noon.

I had the special scramble of green onions, cheese, chicken apple sausage, mushrooms and tomatoes. My friends had a customized scramble of ham, cheese and spinach. All came with two small potato pancakes and a crescent roll. 

Can't wait to try the pancakes!
author: Kat H.

description:
Good, strong coffee, and FANTASTIC scones! As far as the rest of the breakfast items, swing by the Safeway on Marina Blvd. pick up some eggs, bacon and anything else you'd want for breakfast, go home and make yourself something just as good. Don't forget the fruit! 

But I come here because their service is fast and I'm too lazy to prepare all of that myself.
author: Tan N.

description:
Home plate is a fun place to go celebrate the hangover - if only the tiny memosa wasn't four dollars I think I could have made this my go to for brunch.

The food is good and the staff is friendly.  It doesn't do well with hosting a group larger than four though, so if you're headed out with a big group, I'd check elsewhere.
author: jeremy S.

description:
This was one of the first places the bf and I ate in SF when we came to visit many moons ago.  In fact, I think Home Plate may be partialy responsible for us moving here - or at least for his willingness to follow me from Colorado.

As we dug into our omelettes on that fateful day, the owner came over to see how everything was.  He replied to our expressions of gratitude by saying, "Thing just taste better when homemade."

Indeed!
author: Mandy S.

description: I looked this place up online and it had good reviews, so I took my cutie here to brunch while I was in SF. It was exceptional. The scones alone with the strawberry & mango jam are delicious. I had the french toast with strawberries and it was good. But my cutie had the banana walnut pancakes, and she gave me a taste. They were to die for! If there's a few people waiting to be seated, don't let it discourage you. This place is worth the wait. Great food, nice atmosphere and good prices are what's expected. The only thing I did not like was the picture of Babe Ruth in his Red Sox uniform. I'm a Yankee.
author: Hugo R.

description: The House Plate Special with coffee please...and it was pretty good. You get started off with scones, and get served pretty quickly. I ordered my food with a waffle. The chicken apple sausage was cooked to perfection, and the maple syrup was was really good too.
author: Vivek N.

description: This place is a perfect neighborhood breakfast spot. Friendly staff, good service, and GREAT food. Highly recommended.
author: A G.

description:
I've been eyeballing this place for years, curious at it seems to be a pretty busy joint with lots of critical acclaim on the windows.  So I take a day off and pop in there with my daughter.  First impression,  a no thrills joint with less than enthusiastic service.  We sit down and order our breakfast and quickly received two scrumptious scones which was the highlight of the meal, not sure what the pureed concoction was, but very similar to baby food.

Overall food was just okay...most likely will not return..too many better options in the city....uh like IHOP across the street...really!
author: Maureen T.

description: Practically hidden behind a little storefront among budget motels, you'll discover unreal, fresh speedy breakfasts, served by an industrious friendly staff. Everything is house-made from the delicious scones and jam to the various sausages to the highly recommended mushroom/pine nut/ parmesan sauteed polenta bars. Numerous reviews and busy mornings attest to this little eatery's success. Enjoy!
author: Mark G.

description: Some locals told us this would be a good place for breakfast while on vacation.  It was okay...not the best.  It was decent diner food....but certainly not the best I have ever had.
author: Susan F.

description: The only reason this place doesn't get one star is because we had great service. The food is terrible. I don't understand how this is possible when I ordered eggs and bacon, but our food was bland and tasteless. On the plus side it's cheap, but save your taste buds and head to IHOP down the street.
author: Sally N.

description:
My friend has been dining at Home Plate for 20 years, I guess it's just now under new management. The new owner is a delightful woman and you can tell there's love in the kitchen. We had brunch there and she went with a scramble that was delicious, our friend had the soup and grilled cheese and I had an AMAZING pot pie accompanied by a fresh salad. Fresh made scones came with each of our meals while we waited. 
I'd be excited if this was my local diner because it's so satisfying and inexpensive. Bonus for generously priced mimosas and other champagne related morning beverages!
author: Colleen B.

description:
This is my dad's "favorite breakfast place IN THE WORLD!!!"

I like it, but im not near as enthused about it as he is. If you go in with those expectations, you are bound to be disappointed. The place has been sitting there, virtually unchanged, on Lombard street forever (well at least since my Dad started going there in 1981). 

This place is about as friendly and unpretentious as it gets. The food is solid and reasonably priced (for breakfast in the Bay Area, because they do have to pay rent). It has pretty traditional diner style breakfast fare, but the specials can get pretty interesting and creative. 

Its a tiny place, but i've never had to wait for a table there. 

Gotta love the free scones.
author: Travis D.

description: Cute neighborhood diner run by an Asian family it seems like. They offer pitchers of mimosas which is a plus fro a group of 3. I had the usual over easy eggs, sausage and hash browns. The sausage was literally a sausage you eat at a BBQ, not the small breakfast size ones. I was in for a shock. I had a happening time here. We did not have to wait on a sunny Saturday afternoon.
author: Jeanne C.

description:
Here's yet another place that is a much more suitable option to Mel's diner, should you find yourself in the greater Marina/Cow Hollow neighborhood looking for breakfast. 

It's simply scrumdilicious, and has an extensive menu with something for everyone. It's tiny  but the food and smell of fresh biscuits will more than make up for it's size.
author: Risa F.

description:
Love this place! Have to wait every time to be seated but I don't mind.

First time I ate there I had their Hang Town Fry Frittata, lots of bacon and oysters. Yum! 

Their homemade granola is so scrumptious as well, also try their smoothies. 

Very quick service. They except both cash and credit cards.
author: Ericka A.
